story:
I've never been good at asking for help, but the older I get, the more I realize that it cant hurt. Not nearly as much as the prospect of failure. From this, I've found a direction, a path I can take that will allow me to be the artist I am, without being too physically taxing on my back injury. The problem is raising the funds to get started as a tattoo artist. I'm saving up, little by little, but I could use some help to get there.

As I am currently unable to work and living off of my VA compensation, it will take quite a bit of time to save up on my own. - I'm tired of waiting for them to step up and actually provide a solution, a fix for my back injury so that I can go back to work. Being a tattoo artist would not only allow me the necessary freedoms I need to deal with my disability, but as an outlet, it is also like therapy and will give me an avenue to success. Being a soldier was my number one dream growing up, being an artist, tattoo artist, specifically owning my own shop was my backup, and now appears to be my best shot. A last ditch effort.

What I dream of, more than anything, is having the ability to take care of myself and my family. To be a productive member of society again. For my life to have greater meaning through the pursuit of my artwork on both cloth and mortal canvas.


I swear, on my honor, I will NOT fail.

story:
WHAT IS FAKELORE?

We’re pleased to present our project FAKELORE: Fables and Legends of the Americas.  This stop motion animation anthology narrates selected folktales from North, Central and South American countries. We want to re-­engage a digital audience with fading tales from different cultures. By blending both new and old technologies with these stories, FAKELORE creates a whimsical and surreal world for audiences of all ages and backgrounds.


WHO ARE WE?

We are Palu Abadia (Editor), Nyahzul (Art Director), and Caroline Voagen Nelson (Director of Photography). 

We are three NYC-based, women artists -- two from Colombia and one from the United States -- who have been collaborating on this project for the past two years. As a team, we have been combining our talents of art-making, filmmaking, and storytelling in this unique style. 


WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT!

With your help, we can continue making FAKELORE animations. 

 We need funding for producing stop motion animations about Canadian, Mexican, and Peruvian folktales. The series is both entertaining and educational.


WE HAVE A DIFFERENT PERSPECTIVE ON STORYTELLING

Each story is photographed from an overhead perspective, with real actors and props built to scale. 

Each animation has a unique tone: with Pecos Bill of USA we use a sepia Wild West tone, with Madremonte of Colombia a vibrant lush green, and with La Chaisse Galerie a cool blue winter tone. 


WE HAVE EXHIBITIONS AND SCREENINGS

In November, we had a month long exhibition in Dumbo, Brooklyn showcasing our first animations, along with installations of our props, and film still prints. 

More future screenings coming soon!


WE TEACH KIDS  

 We are thrilled to have already received acclaim, first at the World Maker Faire at the NY Hall of Science (WE RECEIVED AN EDITORS' CHOICE AWARD!!). We had a special workshop to teach stop motion animation with the raspberry pi. Over 60 short animations were made with families. 

We have continued to have workshops this year, including at PS10's S.T.E.A.M. Fair and a guest workshop with The Good School, and want to continue teaching children how to make their own stop motion with the FAKELORE style and new kid-friendly technologies.  

         

   


We Need Your Support to Produce More Episodes 

Each episode we produce needs funding for
- space
- materials for prop building/equipment
- actors 
- transportation
- filming and editing
- animation assistants
- submissions to film festivals

The PERKS for Donating

Check out our AWESOME incentives: tote bags, t-shirts, tank tops, workshops, exclusive film still prints, and more!!!! View the gallery page for close up views of the Perks!

FAKELORE T-shirts!
      
Original Artwork by Nyahzul! 

DONATE NOW!!

We want to revive stories from the past it in a fun and imaginative way that connects children and adults. With this series we aim to create curiosity and teach unique and surreal stories from countries of the Americas. 

We are so passionate about this project that we have been developing for the past two years, working alongside amazing artists who have donated their time and talent to make this project come to life. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our FAKELORE project, with our IndieGogo Link, like and share our Facebook page, and spread the word about the series!

story:
Who Am I?

Hello, my name is Karen Kiester, I currently reside in Arizona having also lived in California, New Mexico and Oregon.  After having been rather “left brain and math oriented” I learned to go into a light trace state which “opened” my right brained, more creative side.  The information for the book and contemplation card deck, Path of the Sacred Masculine, came from a “connection” I have with Josef, the Earthly Father of the Christ while in trace state.  This connection began in childhood and lay dormant for a number of years to be reawakened by a mystical experience in 2006.  I feel challenged to go “public” with this information yet I have been reminded that I am the steward of this information and it is meant to be shared.   See PathoftheSacredMasculine and JosefSpeaks for more information.

What is my campaign?

My campaign is to raise funds to print the contemplation card deck.  Currently there are plenty of card decks on the market but nothing with this theme, nothing that honors the Sacred Masculine.  The cards were created by Keith Johnson, an artist from Jacksonville, OR based on key pieces of information given him regarding each card.  These cards are meant to be shared and enjoyed as well as be a vehicle for guidance. 

About the card deck

The deck is based on a matrix of 9 directions or “suits” modeled after the 8 major compass points plus the center point. It is then cross sectioned by categories consisting of archetypes, tools, elements and realms yielding 36 cards (i.e. 9 directions times 4 categories).  You will find examples of some of the cards in the gallery.

The cards are to be used in conjunction with the book which offers descriptions and ways to embody the card and questions for reflection. The book is aimed towards men, yet women will also find value in its pages and images for we all have both masculine and feminine energy and tendencies. The cards are tools to bring balance into one’s life.  The book has a section where Keith describes his process to create the cards as well as a section where I describe my experience in receiving this information.  The book is currently available for purchase in digital or print form on Amazon.   

Your contribution

Your contribution will help make these cards available for purchase at the reasonable price of $15.95.  Unlike a book, which can easily be made available in digital form or print on demand, the cards require extensive setup and multi-color printing.  Interestingly, the cost difference to print 200 decks vs 1,000 decks is minimal.  I need $5,000 to make this happen.  I will use all the money received to print the card decks.  If my campaign falls short, I will find a way to make up the difference.  But I don’t think that is going to happen. 

Perks!

For a $15 contribution, you will receive a personal note of appreciation from me. For a $50 contribution, you will receive a card deck in a beautiful velvet bag with a personal note of appreciation from me.  For a $100 contribution, you will receive the $50 contribution items plus a personalized signed copy of the book.  For a $250 contribution, you will receive all items included in the $100 contribution plus a 30 minute individual session with myself and Josef.  You may ask any questions that you desire.  


Please share my campaign with family and friends!!!

Thank you for reading this far and considering my campaign.

Blessings, Karen Kiester

story:
Help us Save Rare Treasures in the Himalayas: Nepal & Bhutan

The recent earthquake in Nepal, with tragic loss of human life, as well as destruction of heritage monuments and art, is a profound example of how important documentation is: before, during, and after disaster strikes.

 In a race against time, our team of preservation experts is working closely with Buddhist monks and nuns who care for and use sacred art treasures every day in their monasteries. Our approach combines scientific knowledge and techniques, with traditional methods and respect.

With the dramatic and alarming rise in theft from monasteries and museums by looters and antique hunters, expert use of new technology is essential. Monastics will learn to protect their monastery treasures through Risk Assessment and Disaster Mitigation.

Your donation:

We are now accepting direct donations only through our USA non-profit office. Tax receipts will be issued for USA. 

Treasure Caretaker Training

c/o HALPERN MEACHAM

1790 30th Street, Suite 280

Boulder, CO  80301  USA


Your donation is so important to our monk and nun participants, and:

Supports the training of cultural caretakers in digital documentation and preservation of monastery treasures

Trains caretakers to create confidential digital inventories that include video/audio files

Monk and nun caretakers learn to conduct interviews with elders, to video the interviews, and to integrate the oral histories with the digital inventory records

Provides for follow-up visits to the participants’ monastery by team members to work on specific preservation concerns regarding cultural heritage

Supports continuing training, via email, social media and phone

Creates technical updates as mobile and Cloud technology advances

Provides access to a worldwide network of preservation professionals

Awards and Previous Session of the Workshop

We won the Digital Empowerment Foundation’s Asia Pacific Manthan Chairman’s Choice Award in 2014, and the E-NorthEast Special Mention Award for Innovative use of E-Technology in Cultural Heritage Preservation. UNESCO India is providing organizational assistance for the May 2015 Bhutan session.

The Impact of the Project

Organize, and implement education sessions to empower treasure caretakers worldwide to protect the tangible cultural heritage within their own tradition.

story:
Short Summary

Hello potential Participants!  We are happy to introduce our plan for a Mutant Vehicle of LOVE for the Playa.  We are asking for help to fund the creation of the Lost Vegas Playa Weddings Mutant Vehicle for this years burn. We have already received the initial approval from the DMV to bring the cake to The burn!  )'(

  • We are the Lost Vegas camp at Burning Man, and want to bring together burners in LOVE and provide Playa weddings.  
  • Our mission is to get you hitched, be it to a person, and group, a toaster - who knows how you will feel inspired by love!  
  • We do not discriminate or judge who / what / how many / gender / object / person-place or thing that you want to wed.
  • Playa weddings are non-denominational and can last an hour, the day, or for the burn...or even forever.
  • Help us to spread the love!
Our Mutant Vehicle will be a gigantic wedding cake on wheels!!

What We Need & What You Get

We will transform a six-seater golf cart into a humongous wedding cake.  We have the golf cart and access to engineers and electricians and a power house of a design team, we just need a little funding help to make this wedding cake on wheels come to life.

  • The money raised will go towards supplies, materials, cutting, sawing, welding, stretching, pinning, decorating, lighting etc.!
  • We know that not everyone can marry whom they choose in every state in the US, so we are going to perform Playa weddings, joining those who wish to marry - with no challenges or obstacles placed before them.
  • We are committed to making a beautiful and fun mutant vehicle, and could use your support!

The Impact

We will perform Playa weddings all week, between lovers, friends, groups, two at at time, three at a time!  Always a bridesmaid and never a bride?  Grab your partner, marry for an hour, move on and do it again!

  • Lost Vegas Playa Weddings add value to your burn by making it official!  Well, sort of.  
  • We will take a photo of you after the ceremony and upload all photos to a Facebook page committed these LOVE images. A Facebook page of LOVE!!!
  • We will upload photos of the progress as we move closer to our Wedding Cake on wheels.

Risks & Challenges

We are looking for storage area and building area, and are close to finding both. We welcome any ideas for Las Vegas locations!

  • We are working on getting licensing to make the golf cart street ready so we can work on it in the upcoming months.
  • We will also need to transport our Mutant Vehicle to Black Rock City for the burn, and are looking for a trailer and industrial straps.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have the funds to donate even five dollars, don't worry!  We are novices in building Mutant Vehicles, and would love your input to make this sensational!

  • Please feel free to post this to your friends to get the word out - help us spread the LOVE!!
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools to help us reach our goal!

Thanks for your time, and we LOVE LOVE!

story:
Short Summary

I'm currently a junior in the graphic design program at the Kansas City Art Institute. This Spring, I have the opportunity to study in Florence, Italy for 6 weeks. During my stay I will also be taking day trips to places such as Rome, Sienna, Fiesole, Pisa, San Gimignano, and Switzerland. 

I'll be learning about Rennaissance artists on site such as Michelangelo, Da Vinci, Rembrandt, and Boticelli. I'll also be taking a KCAI exclusive drawing class taught by the very talented Jessie Fisher, as well as intern with a local design firm within Florence. Although I'm a design student, traditional art forms are very dear to my heart and are crucial to my learning process.

What We Need & What You Get

The amount for the trip has been covered through various ways such as help from my parents and student loans. However, the plane ticket, food, housing expenses, etc. are all costs I need to cover upfront, which add up quickly. Fortunately, you can get some sweet art for that. 


You can view some of my work at www.laurenrtaylor.com, or view two colored pencil works in the gallery tab.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this with anyone and everyone! Every bit helps, and every share gets me closer to my goal. Thanks!

story:
Avete sentito un BAM!?

Chi siamo e dove vogliamo arrivare 

Have you heard a BAM!? 

Who are we and where we want to get


[ITA]

A cosa pensate, se sentite un BAM!?

Noi pensiamo ad una realtà fisica nata due anni fa o poco più a Sapri, piccola bomboniera del Sud dell'Italia, che ne conserva calore, slancio emotivo e senso creativo; una Bottega Artistico Musicale pubblica ed autogestita, messa in piedi (letteralmente autocostruita) in un'ex-falegnameria da un gruppo attivo di amici che sentiva, per sé e per gli altri, il bisogno di un luogo di libera espressione, fruizione e diffusione dei saperi di ogni tipo, che fosse lontano dalle logiche inerti del paesello di provincia abbandonato alle proprie criticità, e che potesse, proprio per questo, dar rilievo e curarsi dei propri luoghi, aiutando i suoi abitanti a scoprire e scoprirsi attraverso l'Arte, la Musica, lo Stare Insieme, la Cultura.

Ebbene, a distanza di due anni di parole, oltre che di intensa attività elaborativa e produttiva, di collaborazioni, scambi e riflessioni, spesso fisicamente lontane dagli spazi che viviamo, oggi decidiamo di fermarci, nei quattro giorni del 30 Aprile/1-2-3 Maggio 2015, a raccontarci, per una volta, attraverso le nostre stesse storie, a dare voce alle nostre stesse gole, e ad un Sud finalmente libero di dire.

[ENG]

What do you think about, when you hear a BAM!?

We think about a physical place borned two years ago or more in Sapri, a little bonbonniére in the South of Italy, which keeps its warmth, emotional impulse and creative sense; a Bottega Artistico Musicale public and self-managed, built (literally self-built) into an ex-joiner's workshop from an operative group of friends who needed, for itself and for others, a situation that could embrace free expression, fruition and diffusion of any kind of knowledges, that could stay away from the inert logics of the village left to its own criticalities, and that could underline and take cure, just for that, of its own places, helping its citizens to discover and exposing through Art, Music, Being Together, Culture.

Well, after two years of words, besides an intense planning and productive activity, co-works, exchanges and reflections, often physically far from the places we live, today we decide to stop, from the 30 of April till the 3 of May, to tell us, for once, through our own stories, to give voice to our own throats, and to a South finally free to say. 


E ora, dici! 

Cos'è il Mò.Dì [Maledetto Festival della Parola]? 

And now, say! 

What's Mò.Dì [Damned Word Festival]?


[ITA]

Nasce così, grazie al prezioso contributo linguistico del dialetto che parliamo, il Mò.dì ("Ora, dici!"), il nostro e vostro Maledetto Festival della Parola, una creatura autofinanziata, plasmabile ed interattiva che prenderà vita a Sapri, nei suoi vichi, sul suo mare, nelle sue piazze e nei suoi giardini, sui balconi e sui tetti, sotto il Sole primaverile, con l'intento di (ri)scoprire il linguaggio (e, alla John Cage, la sua grande assenza, il silenzio) come luogo antropologico, come veicolo fondamentale d'informazione quotidiana, come strumento primo di libera fruizione e diffusione del sapere, come massa da plasmare e rielaborare in senso artistico; e con l'obiettivo di mirare, dunque, alla sua straordinaria capacità di filtrare, attraverso una vastissima gamma di schemi possibili, la vera essenza dei nostri e dei vostri popoli.

Dannatamente e politicamente contrario a qualsiasi forma di chiusura, e composto nelle sue parti specifiche da mostre, laboratori, letture pubbliche, workshop, incontri, presentazioni, dibattiti, performance ed installazioni completamente e convintamente aperti a tutti, il Festival Maledetto proverà, per quest'anno, a sfidare e sfidarsi filtrando i suoi contenuti attraverso la tematica del Limite, della Barriera; cercando di tendere i propri discorsi verso questioni diffusamente sentite e pregnanti quali l'(an)affettività verbale, il parlato d'oggi e d'un tempo, le tradizioni oralmente trasmesse, le peculiarità linguistiche mondiali e regionali, il patrimonio dialettale, i linguaggi alternativi, la digitalizzazione totalizzante, il twitteraggio da strapazzo, l'incomunicabilità socio-culturale dell'attuale mondo conosciuto e i movimentismi di zona. 

Il tutto esprimendoci attraverso l'Arte e le sue figlie (la parola nella Musica, nel Teatro, nel Cinema, nella Fotografia, nella Scrittura, nella Street Art, nella Fumettistica, nell'Interaction e Public Design), e concependo gli sforzi spesi sempre e solo come collettivi, inseriti all'interno di una rete di scambio e solidarietà cucita assieme da spiriti ed interessi comuni, sempre presente nel nostro lavoro, a partire (lo si può dedurre) dai metodi di finanziamento prescelti.

[ENG]

So it rises, thanks to the precious linguistic contribution of the dialect we speak, Mò.dì ("Now, say!"), our and your Damned Word Festival, a self-financed, pliable and interactive creature that will come to life in Sapri, into its alleys, on its sea, into its squares and gardens, on balconies and roofs, under the springy Sun, with the aim of (re)discovering language (and, as John Cage, its big absence, silence) as an anthropological situation, as a basic vehicle of daily information, as a primary instrument of free fruition and diffusion of knowledge, as a bulk to shape and re-elaborate in an artistic way; and therefore with the goal of looking to its extraordinary ability of filtering, through the most open range of possible schemes, the real essence of ours and yours people.

Terribly and politically opposite to any shape of closure, and made, in its specific parts, of exhibits, labs, public lectures, workshops, meetings, presentations, debates, performances and installations completely and decidedly open to everyone, the Damned Festival will try, for this year, to challenge itself and others filtering its contents through the theme of the Limit, of the Barrier; attempting to stretch its own conversations to questions diffusely felt and pregnant like verbal (non-)sensitivity, like today's and yesterday's spoken, like traditions orally passed on, linguistic regional and mondial peculiarities, dialectal heritage, alternative languages, scoring computeration, lousy twittering, social and cultural                 (non-)communicability of the present known-world and regional movements.

The all thing expressing ourself through Art and her daughters (word in Music, in Theater, in Cinema, in Photography, in Writing, in Street Art, in Comics, in Interaction and Public Design), and conceiving the pains spended always as collective, inserted into an exchange and solidarity netting stitched together from common spirits and interests, always present in our work, starting from (you can say that!) the financing methods chosen.



E i vostri contributi? 

What about your contributions?


[ITA]

Il vostro contributo, la somma di €2300, che ci auguriamo di poter raggiungere attraverso la campagna di crowdfunding imbastita grazie ad Indiegogo, che ancora ringraziamo, servirà, nello specifico, a coprire le spese dei materiali da autocostruzione (che aiuteranno, secondo le necessità, la realizzazione e la messa in atto delle singole installazioni del Festival), e quelle relative all'ingaggio e al rimborso dei soggetti ospiti dell'evento che, pure, parteciperanno in maniera attiva alla sua creazione. Qualora non dovessimo riuscire ad arrivare al tetto prefissato, saremmo costretti a ridurre il numero e la portata delle attività proposte; nel caso in cui, al contrario, dovessimo trovarci ad avere a disposizione un totale maggiore, sfrutteremmo senz'altro il denaro in più per contattare altri eventuali artisti ed interlocutori, o pensare ad un prolungamento del Festival durante la stagione estiva. 

[ENG]

Your contribution, the sum of €2300, that we wish to reach through the crowdfunding campaign basted thanks to Indiegogo, that we also want to thank, will be necessary, specifically, to cover the self-building materials' (that will help, according to situations, Festival's installations' fulfillment and implementation) costs, and those costs related to hiring and refunding the event's guests who, also, will participate in an active way to its creation. In case we won't reach the roof prefixed, we'll have to reduce the number and the weight of the activities proposed; in case, indeed, we'll find us reaching a bigger goal, we will definely use the money to contact others contingent artists and interlocutors, or think about an extension for the Festival during summer.


Dove siamo stati negli ultimi 5 anni? 

Where we've been in the last 5 years?


[ITA]

Da 5 anni, a Sapri, una rete di soggetti e associazioni locali di cui siamo diretti protagonisti, con la collaborazione di soggetti extralocali, ragiona sulla rigenerazione urbana dal basso, puntando l’azione soprattutto sugli spazi pubblici abbandonati, degradati, non utilizzati. Partendo da un approccio interdisciplinare, partecipato e orizzontale, di ricerca/azione, nascono l’orto sociale Via Campesina, un campo da basket, il Festival Internazionale di Street art Oltre Il Muro, la BAM! (riuso di un’ex-falegnameria pubblica e centro di produzione culturale indipendente), il BAMgarden (giardino pubblico autogestito) ed INNESTI (processo di rivitalizzazione di spazi marginali, progetto di Cilento Labscape con il DIARC- Università di Napoli, che trasforma, a partire dai bisogni degli e con gli abitanti, un parcheggio in una piazza autogestita).

[ENG]

Since 5 years, in Sapri, a net of local subjects and associations of which we are direct characters, with the help of extralocal subjects, reflects on the urban regeneration from the low, focusing most of all the action on public, abandoned, downgraded, unused spaces. Starting from an inter-disciplinary approach, partecipated and horizontal, a research/acting approach, come to life the social vegetable garden in Via Campesina, a basketball camp, the International Street art Festival Oltre il Muro, BAM! (re-use of an ex-public joinery and centre of independent and cultural production), the BAMgarden (a public and self-managed garden) and INNESTI (a marginal spaces' re-vitalization process, a project by Cilento Labscape featuring DIARC-University of Naples, that transform, starting from citizens' needs and with them, a parking into a self-managed square).



Come vogliamo ringraziarvi

How we want to thank you

[ITA]
In cambio dei vostri contributi, vi proponiamo tutta una serie di ricompense (magliette, shopper e agendine) completamente auto realizzate e in linea con la grafica del nostro Mò.dì, tra cui figurano anche degli stencil da street art del maledetto logo del Festival e delle copie digitali della cronistoria fotografica dell'evento.
Se poi voleste raggiungerci qui, a Sapri, in occasione dei dannati quattro giorni, aiutandoci in cambio di ospitalità, saremmo più che felici di accogliervi nella nostra piccola baia.
In ogni caso, continuate a seguirci!
Noi speriamo di parlarvi presto.
[ENG]
In change of your contributions, we propose an all series of rewards (t-shirts, shopper-bags and agendas) completely self-realized and in order to our Mò.dì graphic, among which appear also street art stencils of the Festival's logo and photographic digital copies of the event's chronicle.
If you want to join us here then, in Sapri, during the damned four-days, helping us in change of hospitality, we'll be happy to greeting you into our little bay.
In any case, stay tuned!
We hope to talk to you soon







Words Unite People
BAM! Bottega Artistico Musicale
story_txt:
Avete sentito un BAM!?
Chi siamo e dove vogliamo arrivare 
Have you heard a BAM!? 
Who are we and where we want to get


[ITA]

A cosa pensate, se sentite un BAM!?
Noi pensiamo ad una realtà fisica nata due anni fa o poco più a Sapri, piccola bomboniera del Sud dell'Italia, che ne conserva calore, slancio emotivo e senso creativo; una Bottega Artistico Musicale pubblica ed autogestita, messa in piedi (letteralmente autocostruita) in un'ex-falegnameria da un gruppo attivo di amici che sentiva, per sé e per gli altri, il bisogno di un luogo di libera espressione, fruizione e diffusione dei saperi di ogni tipo, che fosse lontano dalle logiche inerti del paesello di provincia abbandonato alle proprie criticità, e che potesse, proprio per questo, dar rilievo e curarsi dei propri luoghi, aiutando i suoi abitanti a scoprire e scoprirsi attraverso l'Arte, la Musica, lo Stare Insieme, la Cultura.
Ebbene, a distanza di due anni di parole, oltre che di intensa attività elaborativa e produttiva, di collaborazioni, scambi e riflessioni, spesso fisicamente lontane dagli spazi che viviamo, oggi decidiamo di fermarci, nei quattro giorni del 30 Aprile/1-2-3 Maggio 2015, a raccontarci, per una volta, attraverso le nostre stesse storie, a dare voce alle nostre stesse gole, e ad un Sud finalmente libero di dire.
[ENG]
What do you think about, when you hear a BAM!?
We think about a physical place borned two years ago or more in Sapri, a little bonbonniére in the South of Italy, which keeps its warmth, emotional impulse and creative sense; a Bottega Artistico Musicale public and self-managed, built (literally self-built) into an ex-joiner's workshop from an operative group of friends who needed, for itself and for others, a situation that could embrace free expression, fruition and diffusion of any kind of knowledges, that could stay away from the inert logics of the village left to its own criticalities, and that could underline and take cure, just for that, of its own places, helping its citizens to discover and exposing through Art, Music, Being Together, Culture.
Well, after two years of words, besides an intense planning and productive activity, co-works, exchanges and reflections, often physically far from the places we live, today we decide to stop, from the 30 of April till the 3 of May, to tell us, for once, through our own stories, to give voice to our own throats, and to a South finally free to say.

Cos'è il Mò.Dì [Maledetto Festival della Parola]? 
And now, say!

story:
South Gym Begins

BAM Academy is bringing you an amazing facility in South Austin: Bridging All Movement Center.  Just imagine a 26,000 square foot space designed specifically for movement of all forms: Parkour, tumbling, stunts, circus arts, freerunning, Ballistic Movement, dance, and performance arts.  We want you to come on a journey with us and help make this dream a reality.

  • By donating to this project you will create a 16,000 square foot Parkour area, one of the largest in the United States and the largest in Texas.

  • You will help create spaces like a stunt studio, complete with green screen, a Ballistic Movement Zone, and a dedicated AcroYoga Space!  We will also have a full performance theatre, tumbling programs, dance programs, and even a circus arts program! 

BRIDGING ALL MOVEMENTS CENTER

#WHOisBAM

  • BAM Academy is a facility dedicated to all forms of movement. We offer classes in different movement disciplines and a space where people can come to train in their chosen way of movement, share, and learn from others to bridge all movement.

Are you ready for this gym to be in Austin?

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $30,000 to help fund our dreams of creating a center focused on moving in all its forms. Extra funding will help bring in more equipment to help our students advance in their movement capabilities
Every dollar of funding goes into things needed to complete the gym build out:
  • Awesome Parkour Structures 
  • Ballistics Training Zone 
  • 32' x 15' Foam Pit 
  • Full 42' x 42' Gymnastics Floor 
  • Rubber Floor Mats
  • Stunt Training Area (with Green Screen!) 
  • Ninja Warrior Training Obstacles
  • Circus Arts Area
  • Family Sitting Area
Even if we don't reach our goal, all the funding goes into building the Bridging All Movement Center and making the gym as awesome as possible!

The Impact

You have been asking for a BAM location down south and we now have the perfect space. We are giving you the opportunity to help us make this BAM the biggest baddest Parkour and movement center in Texas!

  • We have outgrown our first space and are now ready to bring you a second space called the "Bridging All Movement Center."  It's an all-purpose training facility for kids, teens, and adults to learn, play, and push themselves to the highest peak and improve their movement capabilities. We want to bring the fun and freedom of movement into everyone's life.
  • We believe strongly in the Third Coast.  Meaning, we have Hollywood on west coast, NYC on the east coast, and Austin on the south coast.  We want Austin to lead the film, technology and movement scene.  We are partnering with production companies, stunt companies, and others to create the perfect environment for these industries.

Risks & Challenges

We want to act fast.  Our goal is to be open September 1st of this year, just in time for the start of the school year. We need some of this funding to build our obstacles before we open up. 

  • Office Renovation Begins July 1st
  • Contractors Being Simple Construction July 15th
  • Funding Acquired August 1st
  • Construction Begins August 1st
  • Signage Posted August 15th
  • VIP Soft Opening August 24th
  • Opening Day September 1st

Other Ways You Can Help

Donating money isn't the only way to contribute:

  • Please get the word out and share the campaign with friends and family. The more people behind us the bigger and better the build out for the gym will be.
  • Share! Use the links below to post all about BAM!

The Perks

Memberships perks are redeemable after the official opening.

Perks are transferable!  If you want to help out but not able to take advantage of the perks, let us know and we will transfer your perk to someone who needs it here in Austin.

Have Questions before or after donating?

Email us here info@thebamacademy.com or even call us here 512-394-7434

BAM OUT

story:
Contributions can continue on our follow-up campaign after this one ends, link below: 

http://igg.me/at/dWjKU3iTaNU 


Short Summary

Children in Lebanon are suffering more than you can imagine, stand up for them. I developed this campaign to give you the chance to do just that. Contribute to this project and you will join me in offering children a way to psychologically protect themselves from the dangers of war through expressive art therapy. 

I am Lara Kalaf, a humanitarian therapist and Phd candidate, who will offer art-based therapy to refugee children in Lebanon. These movie-making workshops will teach children how to deal with the psychological consequences of war and eventually help strengthen the psychosocial services NGO's are offering them. 

This is important, because of the lack of research on war-affected children, the programs currently offered in Lebanon are mostly based on what we know about western kids psychosocial needs and may not be relevant to war-affected kids.  


By Supporting This project You Will...

  1. Help positively impact a child at risk.
  2. Hep generate missing research data about resilience for war-affected children.
  3. Support and improve western aid offering psychosocial support.
  4. Actively participate in the development of this unique intervention. 

If you contribute, I will stay in touch and keep you updated. If there is anything you want to see happen when I am on the field, I promise to try to make it happen. It's thanks to you it will be happening after all. :) 


What We Need & What You Get

This is the follow up of a previous campaign that ended too quickly (http://igg.me/at/art4live), the last one had raised a little over $2000, the remaining amount needed to get the first set of workshops running is $5000. 

The funds go straight into the workshops which offer, healthy meals, art material the children can keep, a safe working environment, safe transportation, psychosocial support, art training, recreation, insurance, etc. Ask me and I'll send you a detailed budget.

All funds raised (more or less than the goal) will go towards the workshops, the more money we raise, the more workshops we can organise, and the more kids we will help. 

Donations start at $1, and there are fun perks you can claim like; free access to the movies created by the children, a personalized art piece from one of the kids, and 10 hours of consultancy to a non-profit organization.  And More.  ----------> 


The Impact

A refugee camp is the most dangerous place for a child. Over 45 countries are at war today, meaning that millions of children around the world struggle with the physical and psychological traumas of war. In Lebanon, there are Iraqi, Palestinian, Sudanese and now over 1.1 million registered Syrian refugees, causing a huge spillover effect. Not to mention, with over 4 million refugees fleeing the conflict in Syria, it is the world’s single largest refugee crisis for almost a quarter of a century under UNHCR’s mandate. Refugee children have higher risk of death, disability, and becoming rape victims. They are often taken out of school, become homeless, orphaned or are forced into violence. Their quality of life is drastically deteriorated causing serious physical and psychological suffering that can have a lasting effect on the course of their lives. 

These artistic workshops teach participants realistic ways of coping with the negative consequences of war. This is called psychological resilience and is the best way to prevent the development of psychological dysfunction in war-affected children. Art-based therapies are scientifically proven to enhance resilience and can easily be implemented in refugee camps.


Risks & Challenges

I am looking forward to implementing this project and many more to come, but I need your help to make it happen. If everything goes as planned, I should be able to go on the field by July 2016. I am determined to get this project running and I would just love to see you be part of it with me.   


Other Ways You Can Help

I know some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.


Thank you


WE'RE IN THE MEDIA :

Art-based therapy for young refugees: Can art save lives?

#Refugees

In war-torn Lebanon, a clinical psychologist is using her expertise to help teens cope with their trauma. She invites the public to participate too

- See more at: http://www.middleeasteye.net/in-depth/features/... 
------------------------ 

ART4LIVES offering resilience-building workshops to help refugee children cope with war.

by Naharnet Newsdesk 18 September 2015, 09:19 -  

- Read here : http://www.naharnet.com/stories/en/190104 

------------------------ 
Radio Interview with Marie-Ève, at Ckut 90.3 FM, a Montreal community radio (http://ckut.ca/ ; on "lendemain de la veille"). 
- Listen to it here (@46.00min): http://archives.ckut.ca/128/20150827.08.00-09.00.mp3 
---------------------------------- 

This project is part of an initiative by ART4LIVES, a soon to be, registered charity in Canada whose purpose is to prevent mental health problems in war-affected children by fostering resilience through art. It will provide resilience-building interventions, generate research data about resilience in war-zones, and offer constancy to NGO’s working with refugees.  


THREE REASONS I AM CROWDFUNDING: 

 1. To Spread Awareness

  • I realized that one of the best ways to get people implicated in a cause and raise awareness about an issue is asking them for money :) 

2. Funding Agencies' Budget Cuts & Slow Response Rates

  • Right now funding agencies all over the world have to deal with budget cuts, it is therefore extremely difficult to get funding for a new project proposal at the moment. It can also take a few months to a few years to get an answer, which would make it impossible for me to implement the project by the end of this year.

 3. Impartiality 

  • By crowdfunding I will be completely independent and impartial while implementing the intervention and analyzing the research results. For one this is an ethical issue that I am happy I won't need to worry about. It will also give me the freedom to implement the project without limitations and generate unbiased data. For instance some organisations may ask you to work solely with Syrian children, however Lebanese children are also suffering by the spill over effect of the Syrian Crisis.
story_txt:
Contributions can continue on our follow-up campaign after this one ends, link below: 

http://igg.me/at/dWjKU3iTaNU 

Short Summary Children in Lebanon are suffering more than you can imagine, stand up for them. I developed this campaign to give you the chance to do just that. Contribute to this project and you will join me in offering children a way to psychologically protect themselves from the dangers of war through expressive art therapy. 
I am Lara Kalaf, a humanitarian therapist and Phd candidate, who will offer art-based therapy to refugee children in Lebanon. These movie-making workshops will teach children how to deal with the psychological consequences of war and eventually help strengthen the psychosocial services NGO's are offering them. 
This is important, because of the lack of research on war-affected children, the programs currently offered in Lebanon are mostly based on what we know about western kids psychosocial needs and may not be relevant to war-affected kids.     


By Supporting This project You Will...

Help positively impact a child at risk.
Hep generate missing research data about resilience for war-affected children.
Support and improve western aid offering psychosocial support.
Actively participate in the development of this unique intervention. 

If you contribute, I will stay in touch and keep you updated. If there is anything you want to see happen when I am on the field, I promise to try to make it happen. It's thanks to you it will be happening after all. :)

story:
Find Emerging Thai Artists – Online Social Platform

emerging-artists-thailand.com

Each year hundreds of Thai students graduate from excellent Fine Arts universities in Thailand. Although these artists produce work that is of world-class potential, they have little opportunity to connect with a wider art market. This is due to language barriers, lack of art infrastructure, and absence of worldwide fair opportunities. This leads to an unstructured market. Emerging artists thus can’t encounter possible clients, who usually think that art is expensive.

To connect these young artists with their potential clients, Rock Around Asia art gallery has developed an online social platform that enables this relationship while integrating all of the services currently available through our gallery. This online platform will be complemented by pop-up exhibitions and events around Bangkok that will showcase the art of emerging Thai artists. 

The prototype of our platform was launched on October 1st, 2015, and the first sale of an artwork over the platform was 5:32pm the same day. Since then, we have been working on refining this prototype and launch the complete version of the platform on December 1st. You can access the prototype by going to http://www.emerging-artists-thailand.com and creating a member profile. At this stage it is completely functional - but we need your help to be able to improve it and keep it going!

Online Platform Features:

  • Compelling Social Network Model: Visitors to the site can easily browse artists and artworks. Artists have detailed and insightful profiles where consumers get a whole new level of access to artists and their work, through photos, videos, studio visits, interviews, and artwork analysis. 
  • Easy access to art: Visitors can access any of Rock Around Asia's services. You can purchase art through the online store, you can arrange a leasing arrangement, you can commission an artwork from one of our artists, and you can keep track of our upcoming events and exhibitions.
  • Membership: Anyone can register for free for Level 1 membership access. This will allow you to browse all areas of the site. To be able to buy art, commission art or lease art, however, you must register for Level 2 Premium membership access. This will cost 2000 baht/year (US$60) for individuals and 4000 baht/year (US$120) for businesses. This cost will be deducted from your first purchase. 

Examples of artist profiles

  • Fair Pricing: An important part of our platform is a transparent business model based on fair pricing. Consumers are assured of getting a fair price for a quality product. Our prices will be non-negotiable, ensuring that the students are treated fairly and can more easily navigate the art market. 
  • Predicting the Market: Our platform not only taps into a new artist market, but also predicts the market. The artists that are available on the platform are the future of Thai art. This makes our platform concept extremely valuable not only to individuals and businesses who want fairly priced art, but also to art collectors, museums and art galleries who want records on artists from the very start of their careers or want to start a profitable collection. 
  • Language and Translation: The project is developed in close cooperation with Thailand’s Fine Arts universities and their staff and students. Our ability to translate and communicate with emerging Thai artists is of great aid for consumers wishing to cooperate with these artists. We are currently working on fully translating the site to Thai, creating another bridge between artists and the art market.

We will use two years to establish this concept in Thailand. Our plan is then to expand to other countries in the region, such as Vietnam, Indonesia, Myanmar (Burma), Malaysia, Cambodia and Laos.

What do we need?

  •   500 000 baht (approximately US$15 000).

Why do we need this?

  • To be able to improve the quality of the platform through better quality photos and videos.
  • To be able to have pop-up exhibitions around Bangkok, giving our artists an opportunity to have their work exhibited.
  • To be able to hire more staff to take care of the workload associated with giving more artists a chance to exhibit with us.
  • To be able to keep going and fulfill our goals together with Thailand's emerging artists!

Why is this campaign unique?

The purpose of this project is to support Emerging Artists in Thailand by purchasing their art because they have no chance to sell. Supporting our artists by buying and promoting their art is the best way to support our campaign.

To do this, first you need to support Rock Around Asia, who is developing this platform.

You do this by "purchasing" a perk, which gives you a large discount to the artworks on the platform.

What is our business model?

For each artwork sold on the platform:

- 40% goes to the artist

- 40% goes to Rock Around Asia

- 20% goes to a fund used to promote and support the artists through education, exhibitions, events, workshops etc.

What do you get?

Because you give to this campaign, you help Rock Around Asia, so in return, we will decrease 10%, 25% or 40% from our commission from the artwork sale price, depending on which perk you choose. Once you have chosen a perk, you become an automatic Premium Member and can get a 10%, 25% or 40% discount on any artwork from the platform.

How Do You Get Your Discount?

Once you have donated, go to the platform at www.emerging-artists-thailand.com and create an account. When you have selected an artwork, send us a message and we will provide you with a coupon for the discount.

How Else Can You Help?

If you feel that you cannot donate to us right now, then there’s plenty of other ways that you can help. Help us by sharing this campaign, and by getting the word out about our project!

-  Facebook: Rock Around Asia

-  Twitter: @rockaroundasia

-  Instagram: rockaroundasia

-  Tumblr: rockaroundasia

Thank you, 

The Rock Around Asia Team

story:
Hello good people out there,

We are Independent Theatre - a new Bulgarian theatre company. Recently we've started a program called New Beginnings. Our goal is simple: each year we select one of the debut shows, created by the alumni of The National Academy for Theatre and Film Arts in Sofia, Bulgaria and  invite its team to keep on giving performances on our stage. This year we've selected "Dead Souls", directed by Teya Sugareva. But we've faced an unexpected issue. So here is what Teya and her team have to say about it:

We are young emerging theatre artists. We need money to recreate our debut performance “Dead Souls” and extent its life outside of the Theatre Academy. We have already found a Theatre company (Independent Theatre), who will share their building with us, without any rent charges and who will promote the show among their audience. And this is huge! It is one of a kind gesture, when it comes to Bulgarian theatre industry. And they agreed, because they really like the show. 

DEAD SOULS page in Independent Theatre's website

But we have a problem. The set and costumes were destroyed by the Theatre Academy after our graduation. So we raise money to be able to rebuild everything and to upgrade its artistic quality if possible.

What we need?

We need 2000$ for our decor: for materials and working-out in a manufactory for creating professional theatrical decors and sets.
We need 1000$ for our costumes: for materials (fabrics) and sewing. The projects of the costumes exist, but we have to sew them again.
We need 1000$ for stage lighting: we have to buy special spotlights that the theater does not have at this moment to illuminate the performance in the best way.


We are investing all of our hopes in the good people out there, who know how it feels to be so close to making your dream come true. Yes. But we still need your help to complete our mission.

We keep on working every day – we wake up early and rehearse in our free time, because we truly believe that everything is possible.

Please, support us!

CAST        

               Teya Sugareva - Director                                George Strezov - Composer

                  


     Karolina Dalkalacheva and Radostina Todorva - Set and Costume Design 

                  


       Yordan Rasin - Bulgakov                                   Hristo Ushev - Chichikov

         


Anton Grigorov - Secretary                                 Yonko Dimitrov - Chairman

                     


Denitsa Darinova -  Korobochka                    Stefan Dimitrov - Sobakevich

         


         Deyan Tsvyatkov - Manilov                               Nikola Parashkevov - Nozdrev

      


Mariana Boneva - Sofia Ivanovna            Borislava Stratieva - Anna Grigorievna

story:
Short Summary

The Artisan Collective LLC is a small independent partnership formed by four artists and a wine lover! The retail store, located in Halsey Village (downtown Newark), features specialty crafts, wine tasting education and social events. We are excited to be a part of the new up and coming Halsey Street revitalization, and we also want to share our crafts with the world.

What We Need & What You Get

The goal of this Indiegogo campaign is to gather the funds to launch our new e-commerce website, expand our product line, order office material, print advertising materials and implement a sustainable marketing campaign that will allow us to successfully assess our target market and increase customer base. We will also be able to continue to bring exceptional gifts, art, wine tastings, craft classes, and open mic events to our loyal customers who have supported us since we opened our doors in April 2012.

In addition,  we will use funds to purchase tools and supplies for each partner that are specific to enhancing their individual crafts.

The Artisan Collective

The Collective is made up of the following artists:

KullahRulz (Jae Quinlan) - Jewelry, T-shirts, CuffLynx

Akifra Design Studio (Saundra Toby-Heath) - Mudclothe inspired art

Divino Enterprises/Sipper's Delight Wine Tasting Social Club (Burley Tuggle) - Wine tasting events and wine accessories

Monique Decor (Monique Howard) - Soy candles, bath products

Sew What (Geraldyn (Jerri) Mitchell-Lee) - Recycled fabric bags

Here is a breakdown of what we need:

$2,000 - Website re-design, expansion, implementation and ongoing maintenance of e-commerce modules.

$400 - Design and print product brochure, palm cards, Look Book, and marketing material.

$600 - Social Media/Communications Consultant to assist with the creation of monthly newsletters, e-blasts, event invitations and flyers, and updating our social media platforms (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc.).

Here is what you get:

  • One-of-a kind, handcrafted gifts and accessories made with love by our Artisans.
  • Access to exclusive Artisan Collective Wine Tasting (Sipper's Delight) and entertainment events  (Crack the Mic).
  • Signature Artisan Collector's Items customized to fit your personality and style preferences.
  • Personal satisfaction knowing that you having contributed to the growth and sustainability of our small business!

The Impact

The Artisan Collective's products are infused with positive energy and love. The soy candles, bath products are made with natural products. Akirfa Design's products are made with mud clothe from Mali and adorned with unique natural ornaments. KullahRulz rings, necklaces and bracelets are hand made with hand selected beads and gems. Sew What Bags are made from re-purposed fabrics and Divino Enterprises (Sipper's Delight) specializes in educating the wine enthusiast. We work hard to keep our overhead low while buying local and supporting other small businesses.

Risks & Challenges

Owning and operating a brick and mortar business in today's market is very challenging. Although we recognize there is competition in the emerging Newark arts community, the Artisan Collective has a unique women-owned small business incubator model. Our products are special because they are handcrafted, using organic, recycled and natural materials, and in most cases one-of-a kind. Our biggest risks and challenges are that we are learning as we go.  Everything we know about running a small business has been learned from our collective experiences as independent vendors, community leaders, and from participation in entrepreneurial programs. As we continue to learn and grow, The Artisan Collective will use funding from this campaign to acquire assistance with marketing and promoting our business. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can give money to our campaign. If you cannot contribute financially, please SHARE this campaign with 5 friends by liking it on Facebook, forwarding it to your social networks and sharing the campaign on your wall.  Every little bit helps! Thank you in advance for your support!
story_txt:
Short Summary The Artisan Collective LLC is a small independent partnership formed by four artists and a wine lover! The retail store, located in Halsey Village (downtown Newark), features specialty crafts, wine tasting education and social events. We are excited to be a part of the new up and coming Halsey Street revitalization, and we also want to share our crafts with the world.   What We Need & What You GetThe goal of this Indiegogo campaign is to gather the funds to launch our new e-commerce website, expand our product line, order office material, print advertising materials and implement a sustainable marketing campaign that will allow us to successfully assess our target market and increase customer base. We will also be able to continue to bring exceptional gifts, art, wine tastings, craft classes, and open mic events to our loyal customers who have supported us since we opened our doors in April 2012.In addition,  we will use funds to purchase tools and supplies for each partner that are specific to enhancing their individual crafts.The Artisan CollectiveThe Collective is made up of the following artists:KullahRulz (Jae Quinlan) - Jewelry, T-shirts, CuffLynxAkifra Design Studio (Saundra Toby-Heath) - Mudclothe inspired artDivino Enterprises/Sipper's Delight Wine Tasting Social Club (Burley Tuggle) - Wine tasting events and wine accessoriesMonique Decor (Monique Howard) - Soy candles, bath productsSew What (Geraldyn (Jerri) Mitchell-Lee) - Recycled fabric bagsHere is a breakdown of what we need:$2,000 - Website re-design, expansion, implementation and ongoing maintenance of e-commerce modules.$400 - Design and print product brochure, palm cards, Look Book, and marketing material.$600 - Social Media/Communications Consultant to assist with the creation of monthly newsletters, e-blasts, event invitations and flyers, and updating our social media platforms (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc.).Here is what you get:
One-of-a kind, handcrafted gifts and accessories made with love by our Artisans.
Access to exclusive Artisan Collective Wine Tasting (Sipper's Delight) and entertainment events  (Crack the Mic).
Signature Artisan Collector's Items customized to fit your personality and style preferences.
Personal satisfaction knowing that you having contributed to the growth and sustainability of our small business!

The Impact The Artisan Collective's products are infused with positive energy and love. The soy candles, bath products are made with natural products. Akirfa Design's products are made with mud clothe from Mali and adorned with unique natural ornaments. KullahRulz rings, necklaces and bracelets are hand made with hand selected beads and gems. Sew What Bags are made from re-purposed fabrics and Divino Enterprises (Sipper's Delight) specializes in educating the wine enthusiast. We work hard to keep our overhead low while buying local and supporting other small businesses.

Risks & Challenges 
  Owning and operating a brick and mortar business in today's market is very challenging. Although we recognize there is competition in the emerging Newark arts community, the Artisan Collective has a unique women-owned small business incubator model. Our products are special because they are handcrafted, using organic, recycled and natural materials, and in most cases one-of-a kind. Our biggest risks and challenges are that we are learning as we go.  Everything we know about running a small business has been learned from our collective experiences as independent vendors, community leaders, and from participation in entrepreneurial programs. As we continue to learn and grow, The Artisan Collective will use funding from this campaign to acquire assistance with marketing and promoting our business. 


Other Ways You Can Help

 
We understand that not everyone can give money to our campaign. If you cannot contribute financially, please SHARE this campaign with 5 friends by liking it on Facebook, forwarding it to your social networks and sharing the campaign on your wall.  Every little bit helps! Thank you in advance for your support!

story:
Our Exhibition

Hi there! We are Lucia Masango and Eleanor Evans, curators and artists for the 'To Fly (Freedom)' exhibition taking place at Gaffa in Sydney, Australia from May 28 to June 8. 

The To Fly exhibition consists of up and coming Australian, South African and Chinese artists from different mediums and it will showcase works including paintings, jewellery, photography, video and animation.

The concept behind our exhibition is to explore what freedom means in the context of the modern world. To Fly aims to explore this topic from a variety of view points including the beauty of freedom but also challenging the notion of freedom as it currently exists in terms of the use of the word for gain politically or financially. Through our work, we create representations of freedom in ways that relate to our unique perceptions of freedom as a result of cultural, social and economical backgrounds.

The exhibition will focus on various topics of our choice in relation to the theme freedom. 

Who We Are, What We Are Doing 

https://vimeo.com/luciamasango  

Lucia Masango: I am a South African artist who graduated from the Australian National University (ANU) in 2013. My primary art medium is video and I have experience in video art, video production and postproduction for film, television and social media. I have exhibited works in various galleries including the ANU Main Gallery, PhotoSpace Gallery and Foyer Gallery.
My video and series of paintings titled We Die Like Animals are addressing the topic of humanity, the lack of humanity and its impact on freedom with regards to racism and classism.  

http://www.eleanorosaur.com/

Eleanor Evans is a Canberra based animator and designer working in Canberra, she has a passion for stop motion animation and production design. Aside from working on short films she regularly exhibits her work having recently exhibited at M16, ANU main, Foyer and PhotoSpace galleries. She has produced and animated advertising for television and social media.
In her work Buzz, Eleanor is exploring the language of war through the prism of cinematic short hand in military cinema. Her intention is to highlight the trivialisation of conflict and the misuse of the term freedom as justification for violence in media and politics.

https://vimeo.com/user6914691 

Ellie Windred is a Canberra based digital artist who graduated from the Australian National University in 2014. She is an active video portrait and filmmaker with an interest in typography. Her work has been shown in exhibitions at ANU Photospace, ANU Main gallery and M16. 

In her series of video self portraits, is exploring her troubled relationship as a feminist with food and vanity. Her work looks into the trappings that food obsession creates in a modern western life.

 www.flickr.com/photos/endvision/  

Josh Sellick is an active Canberra based filmmaker and and he received his training from the University of Canberra. He is experienced in the fields of photography and audio production and graphic design. 

Josh is shooting portraits that portray the subject during intimate moments of which they are free from they physical constraints of their bodies.

Wei Rong Wu is a Canberra based Chinese born painter who graduated from the Australian National University in 2013. She has exhibited her paintings in a range of group exhibitions and has had her work privately collected in Shanghai (China), Ohio (USA) and Sydney (Aus). 

In her water colour painting for To Fly, Wei Rong is representing the human figure in a euphoric landscape in which it is free.

Rebecca Hinwood is a Sydney based gold and silver smith who received her training from the Australian National University and graduated in 2013. She has exhibited her work in a range of galleries in Australia including the ANCA gallery, Toowoomba Regional Art Gallery and the Gallery of Australian Design. Recently her work has been displayed in the Water House exhibition 2014 and the Australian National Contemporary Jewellery Awards, 2014. Her work is also available through Sterling, the contemporary jewellery shop at Gaffa and KIN gallery Canberra.

For this exhibition she is creating several jewellery pieces that revolve around the concept of the bird and their link with freedom.

What We Need From You

We've secured our exhibition gallery space with Gaffa in Sydney and now need your to help us pay for it! 

We need $1600 to pay for our exhibition space:

$1320 - For the rental of Gallery 2 for the two duration of the exhibition.  

$200 - Is for the additional bond requested by Gaffa. 

$80 - Will go towards paying for petrol for the pick up truck/ute we will be using to transport artworks between Canberra and Sydney. 

Other Ways You Can Help

For those of you who can't contribute financially but would still like to help, you could help us with: 

  • Getting the word out on our exhibition and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Using the Indiegogo share tools to share our campaign.

story:
'Everybody needs beauty as well as bread, places to play in and pray in, where nature may heal and give strength to body and soul.'

John Muir (on Julia Morgan: Architect of Beauty)

Enriched words from the father of Our Natural Parks.  

So why are we here, committing ourselves to notions that were espoused such a long time ago?  What power have these ideas that we plea never to lose touch of them.     This is a story about resurrecting a past tradition and infusing it into today's architectural discourse.  There is an urgency here.  We cannot abandon a movement that is so bound to the protection and guardianship of our future.            It must be acknowledged that the First Bay Area Tradition has real roots here and Julia Morgan was an essence of that authenticity and mindfulness.  She was our pioneer of sustainability.  Her buildings resonated the breath of their environments and ultimately grew from site.  Alas, one hundred years have elapsed and this embedded knowledge of her processes are forgotten.  

Now, more than ever, we need reminding.

Hence, the opportunity is here and now.   

'Emergence' is a site specific installation that reflects the First Bay Area Tradition's architectural philosophy.  We envisage a space that is in the process of growth within the site.  It is a phenomenological installation that is ultimately capturing a moment of transformation, both within self and place.  It is wholly emergent.    

Site

The site where we propose this installation is currently an unkempt lawn at the rear of a Julia Morgan designed home at 3630 Jackson Street in San Francisco.  The home has been chosen for this year's San Francisco Decorator Showcase and will be open to the public from April 25th to May 25th.  All proceeds of the event will benefit the local University High School's financial aid program.  

Our design practice, Siol, has participated in this event in years previously and understand succinctly what it takes to get a project of this typology built.  

Details

The design entails a 15' x 15' courtyard that is sunken into the landscape.  Earth bermed retaining walls (8' high) provide both physical enclosure and acoustic isolation.  The only entry point is a narrowing gravel pathway that directly slopes into the space.  A smooth dark earth plaster on the walls encloses upon the visitor as one approaches the space.  The interior slate shingled walls are a nod to both the existing home and the tradition's choice of natural materiality, while the wall's sectional entasis allows natural light to penetrate within.  A series of concealed light wells within the structure diffuse natural light to specific areas.  This ephemeral quality of shifting light only enhances the depth of the space.  Integrated seating within the walls encourage pause and reflection.  At the center point of the space, a mature oak tree provides the direct focal point of the installation.  The tree has several layers of interpretation.  It is a direct reminder of the architecture we strive to create.  In the words of architect William McDonough. 

'Imagine a home that, like a tree, generates its own energy from the sun; that produces food, provides shelter, encourages biodiversity, eliminates waste and helps protect water resources.'  

We sense that Julia Morgan would be harmoniously aligned to such a lofty analogy for the future of architecture.  The tree also represented a bigger mystical and aesthetic component within the installation.  It is an enquiry into society's perception of the meaning of nature and humanity's role within the ecosystem.                  

Budget

We are currently $30k short of making this a reality.  Hence, we need help!!!!!!!     Timing is also not on our side as we need to start construction on March 1st to make our deadline for the public opening.  If we don't make our budget we will have to drastically value engineer the entire project and in our opinion, diminish the essence of the installation.    


Some history for those not familiar with Julia Morgan.  

Julia Morgan and the First Bay Area Tradition (1880 - 1925)

Julia Morgan was not only the first female licensed architect in California, she was also instrumental is defining an architectural philosophy, a legacy we now define as the First Bay Area Tradition.  In 2014, she was posthumously rewarded the AIA Gold Medal, the first woman to be bestowed with the honor.  Along with other Bay Area architectural luminaries such as Bernard Maybeck, Ernest Coxhead and Willis Polk, the First Bay Area Tradition was heavily influenced by the teachings of Ruskin, Emerson, Thoreau and Morris.  This connectivity and respect for place, nature and craftsmanship was core to this tradition.  They embraced an honesty in the expression of architecture and understood the site to be integral to the design process. 


Please donate what you can (it all helps) and share this campaign with family, friends and colleagues.  

Thank you for taking the time to read this.   

Warmest Regards,


Kevin Hackett, Jessica Weigley, Robo Gerson & Michael McFadden.                                                                                                                          Siol


Architecture. Interiors. Landscapes.

2311 Fillmore Street, San Francisco, CA 94115

story:
As the Medford Arts Center completes four-and-a-half successful years, including being named Burlington County’s Best Art Gallery in 2014, we feel the need for greater outreach into the community. 

    

     Our goal enables us to keep the “ARTS ALIVE” in Medford as well as the surrounding areas; and assist us in continuing our programs, including art exhibits, classes, musical concerts and poetry readings.

     Towards that end, we are asking everyone's support for a mural project in Freedom Park.

     We will be working with the art teachers and students at Medford Memorial School and the Haine's Sixth Grade Center to create designs for a mural to be painted on the side of the park’s restroom building. The winning design would be projected onto the building by our art team and painted in by all the students. A theme such as “freedom,”  “diversity” or “nature” would be selected after consultation with the schools. The designs would be completed in school during the spring semester, with painting  accomplished at the start of the summer vacation.

 

     The opportunity for students to be a part of a community project is immeasurable. They will not only embrace their own creativity but build upon team work and time management skills as well. A gala unveiling would conclude the project, with a party, music and official remarks. Students, their parents and the community would be invited. 

     Our vision is that we would repeat the project in three years with a new group of students. 

     Crowd sourcing would provide the funding for this project as well as sponsors. Hands on volunteers are appreciated also.

    Your support will give us a big boost as we launch this project so help spread the word and Keep the Arts Alive in Medford and the surrounding areas !

   

Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
GonzoFest 2015, curated by Hunter's longtime friend and fellow poet Ron Whitehead and executed by the magnifcent seven is the culmination of 20 years of brainstorming, planning, and plotting ways to secure the rememberance of one of Louisville's greatest unsung heroes, Hunter S. Thompson. Last year we succeeded with the help of many partners to commemorate Hunter with a Hometown Hero banner now displayed on Bardstown Rd on the Bristol Bar and Grill building, and this year we hope to continue the tradition with a Hunter S. Thompson bronze statue created by a local artist with the location TBD. 

We're coming to the gonzo fans out there for donations to help us financially with the massive undertaking of this festival, material costs for the statue, and to help celebrate Hunters life. Some of our biggest financial burdens are the costs fabricating the statue, booking the talent and securing critical infrastructure for the festival. 

GonzoFest 2015 will feature live music from musicians of differing styles including Vessel, 1200, Twin Limb, Graffiti, Thems Live, Thirty Spokes, and Small Time Napoleon. Poets and writers will read their Gonzo and Hunter S. Thompson inspired work as well as Hunter’s work. 

In addition to music, live art, and spoken word, GonzoFest 2015 will host screenings of a GonzoFest 2014 documentary, a Literary Contest focusing on Gonzo journalism and art, and possible celebrity appearances, with a focused effort to bring Bill Murray to this year's festival in our #billtotheville viral video campaign.

All of this entertainment and remembrance of Hunter’s work/life will be held on April 11th in Louisville Kentucky at Waterfront Park's Harbor Lawn with more details on sponsors, vendors and lineups TBA.

This is a chance for HUNTERS FANS EVERYWHERE to be part of GONZO HISTORY! Buy the ticket and take the ride!

Take a moment to look through the rewards to the right and make a contribution or just give what you can. Take a look at our instagram, twitter, facebook, and other websites, and share, like, and help us spread the word. 

Additional Perks and breaking news will be announced in the coming weeks, keep checking back for more updates. 

#gonzofestlou

#billtotheville

Tickets available  at:
www.gonzofestlou.com
Keep Louisville Gonzo.

Thompson bronze statue created by a local artist with the location TBD. We're coming to the gonzo fans out there for donations to help us financially with the massive undertaking of this festival, material costs for the statue, and to help celebrate Hunters life. Some of our biggest financial burdens are the costs fabricating the statue, booking the talent and securing critical infrastructure for the festival. GonzoFest 2015 will feature live music from musicians of differing styles including Vessel, 1200, Twin Limb, Graffiti, Thems Live, Thirty Spokes, and Small Time Napoleon. Poets and writers will read their Gonzo and Hunter S. Thompson inspired work as well as Hunter’s work. In addition to music, live art, and spoken word, GonzoFest 2015 will host screenings of a GonzoFest 2014 documentary, a Literary Contest focusing on Gonzo journalism and art, and possible celebrity appearances, with a focused effort to bring Bill Murray to this year's festival in our #billtotheville viral video campaign.All of this entertainment and remembrance of Hunter’s work/life will be held on April 11th in Louisville Kentucky at Waterfront Park's Harbor Lawn with more details on sponsors, vendors and lineups TBA.This is a chance for HUNTERS FANS EVERYWHERE to be part of GONZO HISTORY! Buy the ticket and take the ride!Take a moment to look through the rewards to the right and make a contribution or just give what you can. Take a look at our instagram, twitter, facebook, and other websites, and share, like, and help us spread the word. Additional Perks and breaking news will be announced in the coming weeks, keep checking back for more updates. #gonzofestlou#billtothevilleTickets available  at:www.gonzofestlou.comKeep Louisville Gonzo.

story:
Exit Strategy Studios is a non for profit collective who have worked really hard in the last year, voluntarily, to create a platform where any individual can pursue their personal creative endeavours. We have hosted a variety of art exhibitions, creative skill shares, fundraisers for grassroots organisations, art battles and been a home for many artists and their studios.


In the past month someone has complained to the Moreland council about our activities and an investigation has taken place. 
We are now facing a possible closure of ESS due to lack of funding and council support. 

What we need now is to raise enough money to cover rent for the comming months until we find our feet again and find artists willing to rent out studio spaces.

Rent is $4200pcm + council rates which amount to $2000 a year.

We are asking now for people to support the freedom of expression, focus on their local communities, fight for the voice of the creative and take charge of their city and the image they want to create within it.

If 5 people donate $1000 we reach our target.

Or if 50 people donate $100 we reach our target.

Or if 500 people donate $50,

Or 5000 people donate $1 we can stay open and still work towards creating the ideal community arts space the Moreland area, and greater community of Melbourne deserve.

Please help us so we can help you!
