story:
Hey there!

My name is Sara, I'm 27,  I'm a fashion & portrait photographer from Italy and I live in NYC.

 

THE GOAL

The main goal for this project is to shoot a series of creative artistic portraits featuring women of all ages and cultures from all around the world to show that  BEAUTY lies in every one of us, no matter what we look like, where we are from or what our cultural background is. BEAUTY doesn't only have to be the kind of BEAUTY we are force fed in magazines and advertising. I Believe all women are beautiful. I believe all women SHOULD FEEL BEAUTIFUL.

I'd like to start this project with Morocco and the Italian Alps. 

 

 

(images below borrowed from pinterest, these are some of the location i'd like to shoot at in Morocco)

 

 

 

 

MY BACKGROUND 

I started my journey into photography a little over two years ago after several injuries stopped me from continuing my career as a professional dancer. Since the day I was born, my life has always revolved around creativity. Creating something, making art and chasing dreams is what I live for. When I got into photography fashion was the obvious choice as my vision is very feminine and romantic. With hard work and lots of stubbornness I managed to turn photography into a career within just a few months. I love creating and designing beautiful images and bringing them to life. I love telling fairytales through them.  

if you'd like to see more of what I do check out my portfolio at www.saramelotti.com and my blog at http://heyfollowers.com/

THE STORY BEHIND THE PROJECT 

After two years in the fashion business I started to feel torn inside.  Fashion is a beautiful form of art, no doubt about that, and I do love my job. I wake up every morning and thank the universe for being able to live the life I live, for being my own boss and for being able to make a living being creative. What causes me to be so conflicted is the idea that I am contributing to setting a very unrealistic standard of beauty for the world and many women are suffering because of that.
The images I create, the images we see in magazines and billboards are not real: it takes hours and hours of work and big teams of people to achieve these results. After a few hours of hair and make up, professional styling, and lots of retouching the girl in the pictures doesn't even look like the girl in the picture!  The gorgeous girls I photograph are professional models. They are beautiful but only a very small percentage of women in the world look like that. Yet that's the standard we grow up looking at, and unfortunately many young women are negatively affected by it. I feel the need to create something more meaningful that could help to change the general perception of what real BEAUTY is. All of this has lead me to this project.

 

THE PROJECT

What I'd like to do with this project is to show men and women that real BEAUTY lies everywhere and in everyone. We can find amazing and different kinds of beauty from culture to culture, from country to country, and from person to person. 
My long term project is to travel to several countries and capture beautiful and
creative portraits of every day women, immersed in their own cultural and environmental settings. I will focus only on women as my vision is still very feminine and romantic.
 
These are the countries I'd like to cover in the long run (I'm thinking it will probably take at least 5 years to travel to them all and keep up with my life in NYC)
Morocco - Italy (Sicily&Alps) - Ethiopia -  Peru - China - Ireland - Mexico - India - Turkey - Cuba - Japan - Vietnam - Greece  - Russia - USA(Lousiana & Hawaii) - Indonesia - France (Provence & Brittany) - Iceland - Namibia - Yemen.

 

 

 
It would be amazing to eventually turn this project into an exhibition. Once the whole project is completed it could become a book that shows both the photographs and tells the stories of the women portrayed.   
It's an ambitious project but I have never believed in the word impossible! 

 

 

THE SPECIFICS
This campaign is only for the first TWO countries I'll cover: MOROCCO   (Essaouira, Chefchaouen , Marrakech) and  the ITALIAN ALPS. If the project is successful [and it will be ;) ] I will move forward with shooting in all the other countries on the list above and do future campaigns if needed.
I would love to shoot 5 to 10 creative portraits for each country on the list. And collect the stories of all the people who are willing to pose for me. I will be applying my unique photographic style that I use in my fashion work to these portraits in order to create something magical!
(Images below shot by me )

 

 

WHAT I NEED

I'm trying to raise $4000 to bring the first part of this project to life. Your contribution would go towards:
-Hiring a male assistant. (estimated $1000)
-Hiring a fixer/translator Morocco is a dangerous country for a  tiny, young caucasian girl with blonde hair and green eyes traveling by herself with expensive photography equipment. A fixer would also help me talk to the locals and collect their stories in Morocco, and would help keeping me  safe from possible attacks. (estimated $1000)
-Compensating all the people, the women that are willing to be photographed, for their time and for sharing their story. (estimated $1500  for 15 portraits, $100 per person)
-extra hard drives, memory cards, emergency gear to make sure we won't be restricted. (estimated $500)
 

    Other Ways You Can Help 

    If you think this is a good cause but can't help financially please just make some noise for me!! Share this campaign on your social media accounts by using the Indiegogo share tools on the left sidebar!

    Thank you so much for reading this and for contributing to the cause! If this could help people open their eyes about what beauty really means it could make a small difference in making some people's lives better, everybody deserves to be happy!

A fixer would also help me talk to the locals and collect their stories in Morocco, and would help keeping me  safe from possible attacks. (estimated $1000)
-Compensating all the people, the women that are willing to be photographed, for their time and for sharing their story. (estimated $1500  for 15 portraits, $100 per person)
-extra hard drives, memory cards, emergency gear to make sure we won't be restricted. (estimated $500)
 


Other Ways You Can Help 

If you think this is a good cause but can't help financially please just make some noise for me!! Share this campaign on your social media accounts by using the Indiegogo share tools on the left sidebar!

story:
So people have been wanting some of Micheal Boswell's posters

Well here they are.... So cop some and help me pay my tuition bill

I have completed all of my requirements for my B.F.A. concentrating on Graphic Design from MSU Denver, but I can not pay my final tuition because I am unemployed and there are not many design jobs in Denver. MSU Denver pumps out twenty or so designers a year making the job market in a small city like Denver challenging.  I am asking for help to pay my tuition and finally and truly have my degree plus a couple of bucks to stave off waiting tables.

The perks are you will get quality art/t-shirts for helping me out. Check it out, I have a ton of great stuff by myself Ron Reeves and Designer/Illustrator Michael Boswell. Photos of all of the work is on this page when you scroll down. Most of it is in extremely low quantities and sizes so grab it while you can. Once pieces run out I will add more work that I have in the files.

You can check out Michael's work at www.michael-boswell.com

and mine at www.ronald-reeves.com

Thank you

Ron

Please email me at hello@ronald-reeves.com to check availability of sizes for shirts.

Or look below to check as I change it with each pledge.

story:
1000 masks in remembrance and hope...


My name is Hilary ( facebook profile), I am an American artist originally from California. I have been living in Southern Sicily for the past 9 years. During this time I have witnessed the increasing crisis of refugees stranded on overcrowded boats trying to find sanctuary on our shores. In 2013 there was a terrible tragedy off the Island of Lampedusa, with the loss of over 300 lives in sight of land. Some of those people are buried in the town where I live: Cianciana. In 2014 I finished a small project composed of 10 masks, commemorating these nameless victims. I am a migrant myself, although my journey to Sicily was far less harrowing. I feel a personal connection to people seeking  a new existence either through choice or need. We are all each other in some way.  A Sea of Humanity

Mi chiamo Hilary, Sono un'artista americana della California. Ho vissuto nel sud della Sicilia per 9 anni. Durante questo periodo ho assistito alla aumentando crisi dei rifugiati incagliati su imbarcazioni sovraffollate cercando di trovare rifugio sulle nostre coste. Nel 2013 ci fu un naufragio al largo dell'isola di Lampedusa, con la perdita di oltre 300 vite in vista di terra. Alcune di queste persone sono sepolti nella città dove vivo: Cianciana. Nel 2014 ho finito un piccolo progetto composta da 10 maschere in gesso, per commemorare queste vittime senza nome. Sono un migrante me stesso, anche se il mio viaggio in Sicilia era molto meno straziante. Mi sento un connessione personale con persone in cerca di una nuova esistenza per scelta o necessità. Siamo tutti a vicenda. Un Mare dell'Umanità.


I completed the first 50 masks during part 1 of this campaign. . . .The masks will represent the many nameless victims of these journeys.

Ho completato le prime 50 maschere durante parte 1 di questa progetto. . . .Le maschere rappresenteranno le numerose vittime senza nome di questi viaggi.



I will create 1000 masks, to be exhibited here in Cianciana at Passareddu Artist Residency:  a sea of faces. An installation titled "Sea of Humanity"  I have been working on this project for 8 months.  We have the ideal setting for the installation.  Passareddu Artist Residency is constructed of second hand shipping containers, volunteers and love. The masks will be displayed inside the shipping container, to illustrate the difficulty of such journeys, and to remind us that we are all human.

In order to achieve this goal, and purchase materials, I am selling some of the masks as I create them.

Creerò 1000 maschere, da esporre qui a Cianciana a Passareddu Artist Residency: un mare di facce. Un'installazione dal titolo "Mare dell'Umanità" Ho lavorato su questo progetto per 8 mesi. Abbiamo la luogo ideale per l'installazione. Passareddu Artist Residency è costruito con container di seconda mano, volontari e l'amore. Le maschere vengono visualizzati all'interno del container, per illustrare la difficoltà di questi viaggi, e per ricordarci che siamo tutti umani.

Al fine di raggiungere questo obiettivo, e l'acquisto di materiali, vendo alcune delle maschere come li creo.


The opportunity to participate and support the amazing work of DOCTORS WITHOUT BORDERS

I was able to donate 50€ to Doctors Without Borders after my first fundraising. I am determined to continue with this part of the project as it encompasses exactly that generosity of human spirit that is so valuable and cherished. Each mask is for sale for 50€, 5€ (10%) of each mask sold will be donated to Doctors Without Borders at the end of this campaign.

La possibilità di partecipare e sostenere l'incredibile lavoro di Medici Senza Frontiere

Sono stato in grado di donare 50 € a Medici Senza Frontiere dopo la mia prima raccolta di fondi. Sono determinato a continuare con questa parte del progetto in quanto comprende esattamente che la generosità di spirito umano che è così prezioso e caro. Ogni maschera è in vendita per 50 €, 5 € (10%) di ogni maschera venduto sarà devoluto a Medici Senza Frontiere, alla fine di questa progetto.


The Impact


Art can be a profound and personal way to share our opinions and visions, and to understand more about our relationships as fellow human beings. I hope this Sea of Humanity piece will promote discussion about more positive and humanitarian solutions. 

Even the smallest of contributions will help. One artist and many many faces to construct. Art for humans. 

L'arte può essere un modo profondo e personale per condividere le nostre opinioni e visioni, e di capire di più sui nostri rapporti come esseri umani. Spero che questo Mare dell'Umanità promuoverà discussione su soluzioni più positivi e umanitarie.

Il più piccolo dei contributi sarà di aiuto. Un artista e molti molti volti a costruire. L'arte per l'umanità.

Un Mare  dell'Umanità.I completed the first 50 masks during part 1 of this campaign. . . .The masks will represent the many nameless victims of these journeys.Ho completato le prime 50 maschere durante parte 1 di questa progetto. . . .Le maschere rappresenteranno le numerose vittime senza nome di questi viaggi.I will create 1000 masks, to be exhibited here in Cianciana at Passareddu Artist Residency:  a sea of faces. An installation titled "Sea of Humanity"  I have been working on this project for 8 months.  We have the ideal setting for the installation.  Passareddu Artist Residency is constructed of second hand shipping containers, volunteers and love. The masks will be displayed inside the shipping container, to illustrate the difficulty of such journeys, and to remind us that we are all human. In order to achieve this goal, and purchase materials, I am selling some of the masks as I create them.Creerò 1000 maschere, da esporre qui a Cianciana a Passareddu Artist Residency: un mare di facce. Un'installazione dal titolo "Mare dell'Umanità" Ho lavorato su questo progetto per 8 mesi. Abbiamo la luogo ideale per l'installazione. Passareddu Artist Residency è costruito con container di seconda mano, volontari e l'amore. Le maschere vengono visualizzati all'interno del container, per illustrare la difficoltà di questi viaggi, e per ricordarci che siamo tutti umani. Al fine di raggiungere questo obiettivo, e l'acquisto di materiali, vendo alcune delle maschere come li creo.The opportunity to participate and support the amazing work of DOCTORS WITHOUT BORDERS 
I was able to donate 50€ to Doctors Without Borders after my first fundraising. I am determined to continue with this part of the project as it encompasses exactly that generosity of human spirit that is so valuable and cherished. Each mask is for sale for 50€, 5€ (10%) of each mask sold will be donated to Doctors Without Borders at the end of this campaign.  
La possibilità di partecipare e sostenere l'incredibile lavoro di Medici Senza Frontiere Sono stato in grado di donare 50 € a Medici Senza Frontiere dopo la mia prima raccolta di fondi. Sono determinato a continuare con questa parte del progetto in quanto comprende esattamente che la generosità di spirito umano che è così prezioso e caro. Ogni maschera è in vendita per 50 €, 5 € (10%) di ogni maschera venduto sarà devoluto a Medici Senza Frontiere, alla fine di questa progetto.
The ImpactArt can be a profound and personal way to share our opinions and 
visions, and to understand more about our relationships as fellow human 
beings. I hope this Sea of Humanity piece will promote discussion about more positive and humanitarian solutions. Even the smallest of contributions will help. One artist and many many faces to construct. Art for humans.  
L'arte può essere un modo profondo e personale per condividere le nostre opinioni e visioni, e di capire di più sui nostri rapporti come esseri umani. Spero che questo Mare dell'Umanità promuoverà discussione su soluzioni più positivi e umanitarie. Il più piccolo dei contributi sarà di aiuto. Un artista e molti molti volti a costruire. L'arte per l'umanità.

story:
THANKS FOR STOPPING BY

I'm so happy you're here. I cannot begin to explain how passionate I am about illustration and about the idea of taking a step further on my journey. Thank you for being a part of this time of my life.

  • For the past few years I have been doing editorial illustrations, and have grown in confidence and in professional ability. 
  • I would like to be published in the 2017 Directory of Illustration.
  • The Directory of Illustration is the leading marketing resource for working artists in America and Europe. In order to get in, they have a minimum quality criteria that you have to meet. Once you meet their standard, you can be distributed to a verified list of about 20,000 people and businesses that buy illustration. 
  • "It worked great for me last year with the economy picking back up." - Greg Newbold, my old professor and listed name in the directory.
  • I'm sure that an exciting opportunity is waiting for me just around the corner of this magnitude exposure.
  • Be sure to check out my portfolio website at www.katiepayne.com

THE COST

A single page spread in the 2017 directory cost exactly $2,600.

THE FUNDRAISERS PERKS

Check out what I am offering as perks to help raise that $2600!

A PRINT FROM THE PRINT SHOP

Check out what I have available in my print shop at www.katiepayne.com/prints. All prints are 8"x10".

TOTE BAGS

Choose between Beauty, Ariel, Frozen, and Oh Deer.


GRAPHITE 5X7 DRAWING

I'll do a graphite drawing of your choice. Recommended number of heads is 1-2, and we will need to work together to get a really nice photo reference that will lead to nice results.

DIGITAL PORTRAIT PAINTING

I'll do a digital painting of your face! I'll work with you to find out what you're looking for, and we'll make something cool happen. Afterwards I can mail you a glossy print perfect for framing.


BEHIND THE SCENES 

If you're curious to see how digital painting works, go ahead and take a look at this time lapse video I made two years ago!


Risks & Challenges

If I don't earn the total amount, I'll use what I did earn towards getting into the directory, and continue to try to earn funds. If it's just not possible for 2017, I'll shoot for 2018.

THANK YOU!

story:
Sunrise Tarot

Artwork of bright and surreal collage landscapes withuneven edges, set inside white borders. Each card begins to brighten one’s view until everything becomes clear, so that wisdom follows understanding.

The seeds to care & nurturance!

Sunset Tarot

The approach of nightfall brings attention to the hidden, mysterious nature of unknown darkness.

This ethereal deck has uneven, saw-toothed edges of imagery, set against blue borders.

The shadows reveal transformation!


TWO DIFFERENT DECKS... two ways to know yourself & others

Darkly illuminating, surreal tarot cards made in Italy!

The latest unique offering from the International Tarot Museum!

Sunrise and sunset are the most magical times of day. From the obscurities of darkness to the illumination of new intentions of dawn - these cards help recognize your shadows and transform them on an illuminated path.

If you need to know the outcome of a new project, you might refer to the Sunrise Tarot. Otherwise, if you want to understand how to detach from a problem and turn it into opportunity, use the Sunset Tarot.

To recognize both aspects, the two decks are best used together!


If you need to know the outcome of a new project, you might refer to the Sunrise Tarot. Otherwise, if you want to understand how to detach from a problem and turn it into opportunity, use the Sunset Tarot.

To recognize both aspects, the two decks are best used together!


About the Artist: Giovanni Monti is painter, photographer and video artist who manages the exhibition space Fantomars in Bologna (Italy). He writes a popular art magazine blog. His distinct and unique deck creations: Sunrise & Sunset Tarot are a surreal look at the Major Arcana. A Dark and Light contraposition of dreamy collages which may awaken primal hopes and trepidations as one meditates with the cards. The original artworks are in permanent exhibit at the International Tarot Museum in Riola (Italy).

Funding for this project provides a means to print the 44 card set, Sunrise & Sunset Tarot (22 Sunrise Tarot + 22 Sunset Tarot cards) in an original, limited edition of 400 decks at an affordable price, without impacting the superb quality of production.

Sunrise & Sunset Tarot Artist: Giovanni Monti

Text: Leaflet (in Italian/English) by Giovanni Monti

Number of Cards: 44

Sunrise Tarot 22 Majors + Sunset Tarot 22 Trumps

Cards Numbered, Untitled

Theme: Surreal Collage Imagery

Card Backs: Surreal Collage Imagery

Card Size: (Approximately) 3.9 x 5.9 Inches, 10x15 cm

Limited Edition of 400 Decks, Numbered & Signed by the Tarot Museum

Publication Year: 2016

Published by the International Museum of Tarot

Box: Ribbed, Corrugated w/ Side Clasp, with Hot Wax Seal


SUNRISE TAROT

SUNSET TAROT

BACK

Cost of production:

Printing: 400 high quality Tarot decks = €. 4000 Euro

Surreal Collage Imagery art works = €. 3500 Euro

400 Boxes = €. 1200 Euro

Printing: 20 x 100 Postcards = €. 900 Euro

If we don't reach our entire goal, we will still produce a portion of this unusual project.

We offer very special perks! All will be personalized… postcards (numbered editions), prints and decks - to enhance your special collection of uniquely magical tarot!

PLEASE NOTE: These decks are at a special promotional price of only € 49!         The actual published price will be € 60! 

This will be a limited edition (with no intentions to reprint).

TWO DIFFERENT DECKS... two ways to know yourself & others

story:
What is Free Range Asheville?

Free Range Asheville is a brand new arts organization established by Estelle Woodward Arnal and Jeff Arnal as a platform for research and discourse where artists can engage and collaborate in performance and laboratory settings with other artists and organizations.  After 15 years of performing, curating, and producing music and dance in Brooklyn and Philadelphia, Jeff and Estelle took a giant leap of faith and relocated to Asheville, NC to rediscover their southern roots and pursue a long-held dream of starting their own arts organization.

Free Range Asheville is a nimble organization that offers programs in a variety of settings ranging from under-utilized commercial spaces, traditional performance venues, and natural environments throughout the Western North Carolina region. Our vision is to create access points to culture that cross disciplines, traditions, and genres for people of all ages and economic backgrounds. We are committed to making Free Range Asheville programs accessible to everyone, and admission to all of our events is $10 or less.

Inaugural Season

We are thrilled to launch Free Range Asheville’s inaugural season which will kick-off on February 23, 2016 with the highly acclaimed classical chamber orchestra The Knights at The Diana Wortham Theatre in Asheville.

Throughout 2016 we will host a series of dialogues with cultural thinkers, offering audiences an opportunity to gain insight into their influences and creative process. We are excited to welcome pianist, teacher and writer, Jonathan Biss for a conversation on April 3, and on April 7 we will host a solo performance and discussion with MacArthur award-winning saxophonist & composer, Ken Vandermark.

This is just the beginning!  We hope you will consider supporting Free Range Asheville. Your gift will allow us to continue developing adventurous programming for the communities in Western North Carolina and beyond. An exciting roster of artists is planned for the second half of 2016 including more music, dance, and interdisciplinary work.  We look forward to sharing the complete line-up with you in the coming months.

Make it Happen

The growth of Free Range Asheville has been exhilarating, but we cannot sustain this work without additional support. Funds raised from our IndieGoGo campaign will go toward expenses for the first half of our inaugural season. In order to cover artist fees, space rental, production and marketing costs, and ensure that we are able to keep ticket prices for Free Range Asheville events at an affordable rate of $10 or less, we must raise a minimum of $5,000 by February 1.  Additionally, we have set a stretch goal of $10,000 to cover the second half of the 2016 season.

Free Range Asheville is a labor of love and we are making a sizable personal investment in this inaugural year. We have been working hard to secure sponsorships for the 2016 season and have been successful in obtaining underwriting from a number of local businesses to offset the costs of housing and feeding visiting artists.  As a new organization it is essential that we establish a solid foundation of programming that demonstrates our ability to successfully implement our vision and goals.  Without this track record, it is extremely challenging to apply for grants or other types of institutional funding, and we cannot rely on income from ticket sales alone to cover expenses.

We invite you to join us in helping make this dream a reality.  We are pleased to offer our supporters a singular collection of perks that reflect the culture and counterculture that make Asheville a place like no other.

Thank You!

Every gift of any amount makes a difference and brings us that much closer to reaching our goal of $5,000 by February 1.  Thank you for considering our request for vital support for Free Range Asheville!

Please help us spread the word by sharing our campaign with friends, family, and colleagues who might be interested in learning about what we do.  

Follow us on Facebook and Twitter to get the latest updates from Free Range Asheville.

Free Rangers

Estelle Woodward Arnal – Executive Director
Jeff Arnal – Artistic Director

Jeff and Estelle began their collaborative relationship in 1999 while they were in graduate school at Bennington College.  In 2000 they moved to Brooklyn, NY where they were active as performers and organizers in the music and dance community.  From 2002-2006 they served as Artistic Co-Directors of Improvised and Otherwise, an annual festival for experimental music and dance in Brooklyn. Their work was presented at The Chocolate Factory, Danspace Project, Roulette, Movement Research, and the Vision Festival among others.  Both Jeff and Estelle have held positions with prestigious arts organizations throughout the Northeast including Jacob’s Pillow, The Pew Center for Arts & Heritage, and Dance Theater Workshop.  As consultants their clients have included Big Dance Theater, iLAND inc./Jennifer Monson, National Sawdust, and The Greenwall Foundation.  They bring their combined passion and experience to Free Range Asheville with the goal of contributing thoughtful programs that complement the vibrant cultural community in Asheville.

story:
I Need Your Support

My name is Vincent Jimenez and I'm a digital illustration, graphic designer & 3d modeler.  I have been reached by various individuals asking where they can purchase a print of my work and even turn it into a t-shirt.  Although I have been able to help a few, I believe this interest is evolving into something that requires more capital to be able to successfully reach the masses.  Your contribution would help tremendously in this effort and perks you receive won't hurt either!


What We Need & What You Get

My goal for funding this campaign is $1200.  This would cover costs for adding a fully integrated store e-commerce to my existing website, prints, frames, merchandise, t-shirts, and shipping of said products.  Your contribution will net you some merchandise including 'Freedom' stickers, 'Freedom' t-shirt and/or 'Doom'   11 x 17 art print. 

_____________________________________________________________________________

  • $ 1 contribution
  • 'Freedom' sticker x 2

    ________________________________________________________________________
  • $15 contribution
Guys 'Freedom' t-shirt (White) (Small-XXL)
100% ringspun combed cotton
 + 'Freedom' sticker x 2
_____________________________________________________________________________

  • $15 contribution

Girls 'Freedom' t-shirt (White) (Small-XXL)
100% ringspun combed cotton

+ 'Freedom' sticker x 2  ___________________________________________________________________________

  • $18 contribution

  • Guys 'Freedom' t-shirt (Black) (Small-XXL)

    • 100% ringspun combed cotton

  • + 'Freedom' sticker x 2
_____________________________________________________________________________

  • $18 contribution

  • Girls 'Freedom' t-shirt (Black) (Small-XXL)
  • 100% ringspun combed cotton

+ 'Freedom' sticker x 2
________________________________________________________
  • $ 20 contribution
  • 'Doom' 11 x 17' art print
  • +'Freedom' sticker x 2 
_________________________________________________________________________

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: Will the 'Freedom' t-shirts shrink?
A: All cotton shrinks, but the 100% ringspun combed cotton our shirts use doesn't as much as 100% cotton.  Heat causes the shirt to shrink.  If you would like to avoid any shirt shrinkage wash in cold water and let air dry.  

T-shirt product specs
  • Anvil Fashion Fit Tee
  • The softest shirt we sell
  • 4.5-ounce, 100% ringspun combed cotton
  • Soft to the touch for all-day comfort
  • Flattering contoured silhouette
__________________________________________________
Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • You can also support me by getting the word out on there on the various social media websites by sharing this campaign.  Check out my website and social media links below to see more of my artwork, designs, and illustrations.  
  • Website
  • Facebook
  • Instagram

Thank you!

story:
Hello!

Jacob and Miriam are two passionate individuals. You will barely ever see Jacob without a camera in front of his face (in fact I wasn't really sure what he looked like for a while) and Miriam will often disappear into her notebook, scribbling poetry.

They have both been working prolifically over the past few years, creating and coming up with projects. Unfortunately, art is seldom financially lucrative, and preparing for such projects is often costly. And so they are asking for your help with this next adventure. Please help them make it possible for the sake of art and so that they can continue bringing beautiful /moving things to life!
This next project aims at preserving the moment in one of Malta's oldest and most historically-dense city - Birgu. Through street photography and poetry written for those images, Jacob and Miriam want to give you in an insight into Birgu's everyday life, it's secrets and mysteries, the way it inhales and exhales..

A sample of poetry

Vittoriosa

Sometimes despite the chaos
There is a silence in you
That begs attention
A ghost ship, sailing in place
Majestic, distinguished
Holder of history
- Vittoriosa

(Miriam C)


This is what they need:

Funding for mounting photographs and poems: 340 euros

Funding to build boards on which to exhibit: 150 euros

Funding to organise the exhibition launch on the 20th July 2015:  This is still to be determined (we are also looking for sponsors for food and drink)

The Perks that you get for your generosity:

 12 euros - a handwritten original poem by Miriam Calleja
20 euros - an 8 x 10 original print by Jacob Sammut

80 euros - four 8x10 prints and a handwritten poem (this is a set!)

100 euros - a handwritten, signed and mounted poem (price after launch would be 150 euros)

120 euros - a signed and mounted print (price after launch would be 250 euros)

500 euros : 4 mounted prints and a mounted poem (which is a set, and a tremendous bargain!) all signed by the artists

You always get: hugs and infinite gratitude!


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you feel that you cannot help right now (and we can assure you that we will be grateful for every little amount) please spread the word about this event and do come to visit the exhibition. Let the artists know what you think, how the prints and poems make you feel. Reach out and connect! That is the purpose of art :)
story_txt:
Hello!Jacob and Miriam are two passionate individuals. You will barely ever see Jacob without a camera in front of his face (in fact I wasn't really sure what he looked like for a while) and Miriam will often disappear into her notebook, scribbling poetry.
They have both been working prolifically over the past few years, creating and coming up with projects. Unfortunately, art is seldom financially lucrative, and preparing for such projects is often costly. And so they are asking for your help with this next adventure. Please help them make it possible for the sake of art and so that they can continue bringing beautiful /moving things to life!
This next project aims at preserving the moment in one of Malta's oldest and most historically-dense city - Birgu. Through street photography and poetry written for those images, Jacob and Miriam want to give you in an insight into Birgu's everyday life, it's secrets and mysteries, the way it inhales and exhales..A sample of poetryVittoriosa
Sometimes despite the
chaos
There is a silence in you
That begs attention
A ghost ship, sailing in place
Majestic, distinguished
Holder of history
- Vittoriosa

(Miriam C)

 This is what they need:
Funding for mounting photographs and poems: 340 euros
Funding to build boards on which to exhibit: 150 euros
Funding to organise the exhibition launch on the 20th July 2015:  This is still to be determined (we are also looking for sponsors for food and drink)
The Perks that you get for your generosity:


 12 euros - a handwritten original poem by Miriam Calleja
20 euros - an 8 x 10 original print by Jacob Sammut



80 euros - four 8x10 prints and a handwritten poem (this is a set!)

100 euros - a handwritten, signed and mounted poem (price after launch would be 150 euros)

120 euros - a signed and mounted print (price after launch would be 250 euros)

500 euros : 4 mounted prints and a mounted poem (which is a set, and a tremendous bargain!) all signed by the artists
You always get: hugs and infinite gratitude!





Other Ways You Can Help


 Even if you feel that you cannot help right now (and we can assure you that we will be grateful for every little amount) please spread the word about this event and do come to visit the exhibition. Let the artists know what you think, how the prints and poems make you feel. Reach out and connect! That is the purpose of art :)

story:
DINOSAURIA of THE AMBER COAST!

A growing collection of modern art dinosaur works meant to educate, inspire, thrill and give back to a community I adore.

First and foremost, thank you for reading this. This project is a dream of mine and every moment you spend here is another moment of energy I can give my project. Thank you for your good vibes. My hope is to find a permanent home for the collection and to add to it as often as possible. Also to employ locals to care for the museum itself while I am in my home country of Canada. Please check out the landing page for updates on the project and progress pictures. http://dinosauriatheambercoast.tumblr.com

The museum will be free to local kids and school groups and be "pay what you can" to others. My idea being to teach the young generation here that creativity has no boundaries and can be a pathway to achieving things you never thought possible. A valuable lesson for anyone, especially the less fortunate.

I'm following my heart for this project, I've been a professional artist for many years (JoshGorleiii.com), this work is meant to give back and share something that inspires me personally. Funds raised will go towards the exhibit and the surrounding community. In the event the campaign does well (please!) I would love to make Cabarete my home and teach art classes free of charge to the local youths.


Thank you so much for checking out my campaign and I am personally in your debt if you share this project, or for any donation you may make.

Josh Gorle.

story:
Thanks so much to everyone for getting us beyond the 50% mark! (Spread the word.) Our artists are making great strides. Watch for news on Facebook.

Diana Markessinis, The 4th Tree, Los Angeles River, painted fiberglass and metal base, ongoing series. Photograph by Eric Stoner.

Help us: Meet our goal, pay our artists, purchase materials, feed our interns lunch! And, who can resist these eyes?

Ripley Whiteside, Notre-Dame-de-Grâce, (detail)

Yes, the news and rumors are true—the Los Angeles River is going to get the restoration and revitalization Angelenos deserve, and the world will admire, thanks to public and private monies. But how will the revitalization of the river play out? Certainly, many economic and environmental factors are being considered, yet, there is one unique aspect of Los Angeles that isn’t getting the full attention it needs—the arts!   

TEN FEET, the inaugural initiative of the LA River Public Art Project, is a one-day public art installation at five sites along the LA River Bike Path. And we need your help. After a year of sweat equity, a modest seed grant from the Baldessari Family Foundation, and our own funds, we need to raise $15,000 by the end of the day on October 10th to provide construction materials, artist’s honoraria, and support materials. Please consider supporting the TEN FEET project in order to demonstrate to the city that the arts should be a fundamental component of river revitalization projects.

  WHY TEN FEET?

Recently adopted guidelines require a 10-foot buffer for riverfront property improvements. TEN FEET is intended to heighten awareness of these guidelines, and stimulate discussion and ideas for this critical ribbon of space that bounds our newest and potentially largest continuous trail and open space system in the city.


  WHO WE ARE

For over a year, a group of architects, landscape architects, and artists have been meeting with city officials and community arts and river advocates, and have formed the LA River Public Art Project, whose vision is to ensure an arts and culture infrastructure on river revitalization projects. 

Elaine Rene-Weissman is an Architect, LEED AP, and principal of ERW DESIGN. Projects include Vista Hermosa Park in downtown LA received the ’09 Civic Award and Grand Prize from the LABC, and the ’09 AIA LA President's Award (Best Public Space); Made In California: NOW at LACMA; and the Marsh Park pavilion on the LA River. She has a BFA from SVA, and a Master of Architecture from Yale. She is on the Design Review Team for the Santa Monica-Malibu School District, and the NELA Advisory Committee.

Esther Margulies, ASLA, RLA is a landscape architect, and a USC lecturer. She has led award-winning planning and site design projects: K-12 schools, university campuses, The Baldwin Hills Park master plan, Vista Hermosa Park and the Annenberg Community Beach House. She co-chaired the first ASLA Studio Reach Design Charrette on the LA River in 1997 and served as principal in charge of public realm projects for LA Metro, and the cities of Long Beach and Buena Park. Perhaps most significantly for the LA River, Esther helped draft the final LA River Master Plan project and was directly involved in the extensive community outreach and authored the Vision section.

Tom Marble is an architect engaged in the built form through construction, film, writing, and teaching. He provides Project Management for art installation projects.

Molly Renda is an artist and graphic designer. She is Exhibits Program Librarian at NCSU Libraries, NC State University, Raleigh, North Carolina.

story:
Le Spasme

Le Spasme est une OSBL qui promeut les Artistes handicapé/es et qui souhaitent les aider à diffuser leurs oeuvres à travers le Qc.

Inclusiv'Arts est un festival pluridisciplinaire, visant à présenter d'incroyables artistes aux multiples talents. Des artistes qui défendent une vision, mais rêvent d’inclusion. Les artistes handicapé/es sont trop souvent mis/es de côté, mais on oublie vite que le handicap, ce n'est pas végéter à attendre que le temps passe. Ces hommes et ces femmes foisonnent d'idées et de projets, qui font avancer la Culture. Nous souhaitons leur offrir une plateforme où ils pourront présenter leurs passions et leurs réussites. 

Il se tiendra du vendredi 11 septembre au dimanche 13 septembre 2015, à l'Auditoire, le nouveau lieu de rencontre, de création et d'échanges interculturels dans le Mile-End situé au 5212 Boulevard Saint-Laurent, à Montréal.

Pourquoi a-t-on besoin de vous?

Nous voulons offrir sur deux jours dans un espace accessible à tous des performances en Arts visuels (expositions de peinture et de photos, projection de courts-métrages), des spectacles (théâtre, danse, défilé de mode accessible), des workshops, un déjeuner-conférence, des stands pour les artistes et artisans.

Outre des places VIP pour certaines performances, nous offrons également des prix offerts par certains de nos commanditaires, des magazines édités par notre organisme et même, des séances photos/vidéos.

Tout ce que vous aurez la gentillesse de nous donner servira à offrir à tou/tes nos invité/es (artistes et spectateur/trices) la meilleure des expériences, afin de pouvoir rendre ce festival annuel. Tous les organisateur/trices sont bénévoles et aucun des fonds ne servira à rémunérer les membres du Spasme.

Notre équipe

Notre équipe est composée de 5 membres permanents, ayant tous un handicap à leur manière. Le Président du CA, Patrick Desjardins est un cinéaste quadriplégique atteint de paralysie cérébrale et fut le précurseur du projet. 

Nous avons tous un pied dans le milieu des Arts (littérature, cinéma, BD, photo) ou le communautaire, et tous passionnés par ce que nous faisons. Nous avons un parcours plutôt fourni dans ces domaines et les forces de chacun/e mises ensemble font que nous sommes un groupe qui atteint ses objectifs. Nous aimerions vous faire partager ce qui nous motive et vous entraîner dans notre univers.

Rien ne sera mis au hasard pour vous créer un événement exceptionnel.

Il n'y a pas que l'argent...

Si vous n'avez pas les moyens financiers de soutenir, vous pouvez nous aider en faisant la publicité de l'événement, en en parlant autour de vous, si vous connaissez également des gens qui aimeraient commanditer l'événement (par votre emploi, des gens/artisans dans votre entourage), que vous souhaitez avoir un stand ou encore être bénévole durant le festival, vous pouvez nous contacter.

story:
My name is Ewa and I am embarking to fulfill my greatest dream – to become an actress. I’m leaving everything behind and going to New York to study acting at William Esper Studio.

Why do I need your support?

I’ve managed to save enough money to cover the first year tuition (19,100$), visa (660$), a ticket to NY (610$) and get by there for four months. I’ll be in NYC on a student visa and will have no work permit. Your donations will help me extend my stay in NY and pay my accommodation until the end of the program.

The last two years were exhausting. I had a demanding job in consulting and I used every free evening, weekend or holiday to go to theatre workshops and to perform in an alternative theatre. Now I want to give my dream undivided attention.

We only get to live once. We need to follow our passion; otherwise this one life of ours will be wasted.

I am doing this, because I don’t want to wake up being 80 only to realize that I didn’t have enough courage to at least try to pursue the life I desired. Following my dream is frightening and exhilarating at the same time. It is liberating. It feels like finally letting go.

How did it come about?

I had lived my life as if it was a trial one and once I’d tested all the options I’d get a new one and be able to live it fully then. I was gifted in many areas and met a lot of people on the way that had ideas of what I could do. More often than not I listened and tried them out. This way I did a lot of seemingly reasonable things. I graduated with honors in Mathematics, Computer Science and Spanish Philology and had worked as a programmer, a translator and a university lecturer in Latin American literature. But as much as those careers seemed a rational choice way back then, they made me unhappy.

A decisive moment

Realizing that I want to be an actress was a difficult moment for me. At the time I worked as a business consultant for one of the top consulting firms. I looked back at my life and saw myself floating in a boat in a river and letting be dragged by its currents into comfortable, safe, accepted directions - and never having the courage to take control and to paddle upstream of the uncanny brook that had always been calling me. It made me feel so embarrassed, afraid and vulnerable that it took me over a year to tell anybody about it, let alone do something about it.


Letting go!

When I finally did, the first reaction I got most of the times was “are you out of your mind?” or “you should have thought about it 20 years ago!; it’s too late now”. But fortunately there were others that encouraged me to follow my calling however crazy it may have seemed. And I did. I gave acting more and more attention and allowed it to grow within me. Finally, against all odds, I applied for a two-year program at William Esper Studio in New York, one of the best drama schools for a master of fine arts as per The Hollywood Reporter!!!

And I just got accepted.

Help me prove that dreams may come true if you find courage to pursue them!

story:
Exu (pronounced "EY-shoo") is a 48-page, full-color tabloid-sized newsprint publication. Each page will have one image by one artist (except for the pages devoted to prose and comics). The idea is to give these artists a large showcase in which their art will have a bold graphic effect. It's the visual impact of old tabloid newspapers that inspires Exu.

Exu is an artist-centric publication, and most of our expenses (64%) are payments to the artists. Your advance orders will therefore mainly go into the hands of the artists, writers and cartoonists who produce Exu, and it will help us determine the final print-run.

Exu's contributors are mostly from Houston, with a few more from other Texas locales. They are Trenton Doyle Hancock, Kelly Alison, Seth Alverson, Debra Barrera, JooYoung Choi, Jamal Cyrus, Bill Daniel, Nicky Davis, Nathaniel Donnett, Matthew Guest, the Amazing Hancock Brothers, Hillerbrand+Magsamen, Perry House, John Hovig, Galina Kurlat, Emily Peacock, Fernando Ramirez, Sophie Roach, Christopher Sperandio, Jason Villegas and Inés Estrada.

In addition to the creators of these large single images, there will be prose contributions by Dean Liscum, Pete Gershon, John Nova Lomax, Jim Pirtle and a reprint of a of a 1956 newspaper column by Sig Byrd recounting a visit out to Chinquapin ("the loneliest spot on Texas") with artist Forrest Bess.

Also included in Exu are comics by Mack White, Scott Gilbert, Sarah Welch and Brett Hollis.

The cover is by the great Ike Morgan.

(Check out our gallery for a preview of some of the art inside.)

Exu is photography, painting, drawing and comics. Exu is journalism, memoir, and fiction. Exu is fine art, street art, illustration and outsider art. Exu is about variety and diversity.

Exu is named for the god of the crossroads. It's raw and harsh like cachaça, Exu's favorite libation. Try one today.

story: On January 24th 1991, artist/writer/filmmaker PETE SPRANKLE had his first art exhibit at the legendary LIMELIGHT nightclub in New York City. When the main promoter overbooked the room he was supposed to show in, the artist was forced to find an alternative space. He ended up hanging his whole collection on wooden beams in a stairwell made out of an old bell tower. This show would be remembered as THE STAIRWELL GALLERY, and would be the first of many shows over the next few years. 2016 will mark two and a half decades since that very first show. This Indiegogo campaign is set up to raise money to produce and promote an art event called THE STAIRWELL GALLERY 25th ANNIVERSARY. But we need your help. The theme of this show will be centered around ALEX THE RABBIT, a character created to promote diversity and originality. By investing in original art you can help make this event happen. The money raised will go to promoting the event, renting a gallery space, and supplies for a new collection of art. If you can't invest but want to help, go to Facebook.com/PeteSpranklePresents. There you can share the campaign with your friends and follow the progress. You can also promote your own art, music, films, and Indiegogo campaigns. Please support THE STAIRWELL GALLERY 25th ANNIVERSARY and the art of PETE SPRANKLE who truly believes that, "Those who think unrealistically are the ones who change reality."

story:
Short Summary

visit our website

see what the media thinks

Hi. I'm Ricky. And I want to introduce you to Lampshade.

Lampshade is a place to conjure magic. 

To explore yourself. To be yourself. To share yourself. To incubate ideas, get inspired, collaborate, create, and motivate.

Oh, and play.

A typical day at Lampshade might look something like this: 

  • 6am-8am morning meditation and yoga
  • 8am-6pm cafe, gallery, bookshop, revolution hub, impromptu stage
  • noon-1pm free school: how to make soap
  • 3pm-4pm free school: how to play guitar
  • 6pm-7pm nightly happy time happy hour (revolving)
  • 7pm-8pm monthly youth open mic
  • 8pm-10pm live jazz
  • 10pm-? drag queen moonlight acro yoga


Lampshade is basically a one-stop bliss shop. It's a...

  • cafe
  • bookstore
  • performance & event space
  • music venue
  • art gallery and studio
  • yoga and meditation center
  • classroom
  • platform for ideas, panels, & talks
  • community and youth outreach
  • revolution hub
  • seller of local art, jewelry, stones, & crystals
  • Home of Le Shade: all-natural sundries - lotions, soaps, deodorants, etc.

The city of Ypsilanti is on the upsurge. Imagine a tiny little midwestern New York City or San Francisco of the 80s. Artists and entrepreneurs and wonderful believers of all walks are reinvigorating the city with hope and love and life. Lampshade wants to be a guiding light at the helm of the city's comeback.

Whether it's morning yoga and meditation to bless the space for the day ahead, an afternoon class or impromptu jam session with local coffee, or evening jazz over manhattans. . . something will always be happening at The Shade.

On a deeper level, Lampshade is a sanctuary. A focused aggregator of light. We're all incredibly powerful and creative. So let's go on an adventure. Outside of the fear of lack. There is abundance, always. Enough love, enough money, enough talent, enough looks, enough God for everyone. There is always enough.

Oh, and we think It's time for more artists to make a living doing what they love. So all folks working at lampshade are local musicians and writers, working on and sharing their craft. That means you might catch some virtuoso violin or poetry midday, midweek while indulging your affogato and doing that accounting work.

This is an entirely community-based effort. Your support will go a long way in ensuring a safe, energetic, spiritual, artistic, communal space for the next Mozart, Einstein, Plato, Hemingway, and Buddha to come together and hash it out.

 We want to create a new paradigm.

We're introducing a new barter currency called the shmeckel, which can be used just as cash at lampshade and other local participating places. 

In addition to the brick-and-mortar space, we are launching a live-stream, video-supported radio station. As well as a full tech platform, including a phone app. Our goal is to open the portals for a worldwide dialogue to explore how we can mindfully fuse capitalism and community. How we can make this world closer to utopia.

So you feel safe and secure and loved... what's your next move?

Check us out on facebook, tumblr, twitter, or our website: http://lampshade.life 

Oh, and the news already likes us! 

http://www.mlive.com/business/ann-arbor/index.s...

What We Need & What You Get

We actually need around $100,000 but I am investing all of my savings and reaching out to many connections I've made over the years. This project has been brewing since 2008, and only now, with help from wonderful people like you - will lampshade birth into the world.
  

The space needs a lot of TLC. The building is old. And beautiful. But sad. Here's a few things we're working on:

  • Installing central air/heating
  • Revitalizing hardwood flooring
  • Redoing plumbing and electric
  • Renovating the basement
  • Building a stage
  • Building two handicap bathrooms
  • Building a small kitchen prep space
  • In (not-so-short) short - Transforming the entire building save for the gorgeous exposed red brick, which is what initially made us fall in love

We're building in downtown Ypsilanti, MI, which as I mentioned, is undergoing a wonderful transformation from crime and dilapidation to mindful, beautiful community full of small businesses and energetic folks with a vision. We couldn't be happier to join in the reawakening of a truly wonderful city. 

What You Get... We think our perks are pretty groovy. You can read all about them by looking to your right. Right now! Plus, you get to be an integral, foundation-level part of something different. If you don't live locally or can't make it to The Shade, we have a separate set of perks that are cool kid baller status.

The Impact

We can't overstate how big this project is. Our goal is to revolutionize how small business is run. To find that mindful fusion of commodity and community. We want to build safe spaces for people to have genuine, relaxed, open communication and collaboration to mindfully take us into this next generation and beyond. America is a great place, but it can be so much better. We must carve space outside of greed, capitalism, big banks, mindless conspicuous consumption, and fear of scarcity and competition. There is abundance. There is always enough!

Risks & Challenges

The building is old. Ypsilanti is still on the comeback. We need funding. Michigan is often cold. We have a large vision that could be perceived as scattered. We operate in a world that isn't always so mindful. We are genuinely good people who may get taken advantage of. . . 

There's inherent risk. And so we accept it. And then solve it.

As we said, this project is big and audacious. As we all should be! Why not take up more space? Believe in and explore Self a bit more? We are all one. Once we jump past fear, there's a whole new playground just waiting for us. But we must be brave. We must leap.

As with everything, there are risks. But only with great risk comes that illustrious - and often illusive - great reward. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, we understand. We're grateful you've read this far. We still need a lot of help. You could start by sharing this campaign on your social media platforms and with friends and family. We need architects, carpenters, electricians, plumbers, heaters/coolers, painters, artists, musicians, folks with great ideas, folks with a couple hands and hours to kill. And we need supplies. And beautiful art and furniture and vision. And we need you. Just as you are. To come have a cup of coffee with us!

p.s. If you're registered as a republican, the coffee is on us! You just have to stick around for an hour and chat with someone you might otherwise not get the chance to.

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I'm Lilah.  Thank you for checking out The Vetiver Foundation funding proposal!

Mission Statement: This residency is designed for the artist who is interested in personal development, caring for oneself - body, mind and spirit.  We are invested in you. Our goal is to nurture seamless homeostasis in the creative individual.  Through art, one gives birth to innovation and functionality.  The disposition of the thing birthed is of utmost importance as it participates in the expansion of our technological society and our shared consciousness.  Thus, the balance of the engineer/parent/artist/person at the heart of concern as his/her well-being is vital to local, global and cosmic POSITIVE growth.

The global goal of The Vetiver Foundation is to establish Ashrams in underserved communities.  Within these facilities, our volunteers — comprised of our residency faculty, paid curatorship and intensive recipients, community leaders and truly big-hearted individuals — will seek, rehabilitate and provide vocational instruction to  local candidates who demonstrate a strong interest in being part of bettering the lives of their fellow citizens.  These trainings will consist of deep healings, setting a firm foundation of the self in each candidate, followed by training as 

  • healers
  • artists
  • yogis
  • administrators

The ashram members will also seek to provide access to career pathways outside of these frameworks so that possibilities as endless as those we, the providers, know may find their way into common conversation and consideration within these populations. 

After setting up the structure for these positions, these growing leaders will be guided - at a pace incremental to their ability and in consideration of their ongoing needs - to outreach in their center and provide the same well-rounded recovery and support given them.  The ultimate focus is to support a population of purpose driven individuals and communities empowered toward self-sustainment.


What We Need & What You Get

This residency is for artists of any creative proclivity, but provides modalities and classes that lean toward the performative aspect and includes weekly artist lectures by local and visiting established individuals and collaborators working in both the larger media public venue/ traditional theater for fine arts and in appropriated site-specific dance and performance creation.

Through our at-home and global outreach events and efforts, we will be partnering with medical staff, art supply companies, Ayurvedic and Chinese Medicinal clinics, spa and kitchen supply companies as well as chefs and Somatic Movement practitioners, yoga teachers, various kinds of fine and performing artists, human resource administrators and small business coaches.  

**Our ultimate first year earning goal is $250,000.00.  We are seeking funds in quarterly segments because -- hey, I need to build a team and while it's just me and my one resident, done grass-roots style (in my apartment- they say your passions become your life, I wake up to mine), I aim to be BOTH realistic and hopeful. 

  • 1st Quarter: non-profit application and set-up + establishing organization procurement policies so we can apply for grants (yep, they charge for that), art supplies + 1st residency exhibition facility rental, first residency meal & transit stipend, add to foundation reserve (so far I've funded this part, but in order to continue and dedicate myself full-time, my savings need to go toward my personal/survival expenses) 
  • 2nd Quarter: utilities & cleaning in temporary 1st phase living + 2nd residency meal & transit stipend, small faculty expenses (hire PT grant writer/Gifts Rec'd Dept. Chair + 1 performance mentor), continue adding to foundation reserve
  • 3rd Quarter: replenish art supplies, 2nd residency exhibition facility rental, 3rd residency meal & transit stipend, continued utilities & cleaning, begin purchasing larger curation supplies (includes performance staging) + opening/closing event expenses & press, small faculty expenses, continue adding to foundation reserve
  • 4th Quarter: begin purchasing bedding for multiple residents (we plan to accommodate 4-6 per session), 3rd residency exhibition facility rental, 4th residency meal & transit stipend, continued utilities & cleaning, expand curation supplies  + opening/closing event expenses & press, small faculty expenses (hire 1 administration asst), continue adding to foundation reserve

In coordinating 2nd yr funding, it is projected that we will seek 2 additional healers + 1 additional artist/performance mentor + PT high-performance physio-expert (a combination of athlete and physician input).  At that stage, we will also be seeking expanded resident housing.  I have scouted a building with ample space for:

  • residency quarter, 
  • a yoga/meditation hall with smaller private session studios, 
  • resident studio workspace, 
  • performance hall, 
  • small holistic med-spa and counseling wing, 
  • Foundation administration offices.
...hopefully, the present owner is serious about his intention to donate this property to a non-profit {fingers crossed!}.

PERKS!

So here's what you've been waiting for, THE PERKS!  (See www.LilahSwete.com for all series and treatment details. Scrolling over each treatment section will show a pop-up detail.)
LOOK to the RIGHT of the screen :)))

  • — all recipients located outside of Los Angeles, CA or Dallas, TX will be offered optional receipts for their perk (e.g. — extended and via web only, or in person and limited due to travel expenses but with additional ongoing support +)


__________
IF I don't reach my entire goal, I'll cry... and then I'll get right back up on the horse and try, try again!  This foundation is my baby.  I've been detailing it on paper for over a year and in my mind for a year before that and however long it's been marinating in my spiritual pathway just waiting for my mind to quiet down long enough that I received the inspired idea.  So, let's say the funds are short.  Wait, let's not say that!  Seeing as how I'm chugging along, making this thing happen in small ways already, the funds earned will go toward proliferating this small cell version of a cause all while continuing on in my efforts to take it to higher heights.


The Impact

As a performance artist and yoga therapist, I’ve been blessed to spend time with unbelievably talented and forward thinking individuals.  I’ve also witnessed the depths they are willing to survive for the sake of creating, innovating and sharing.  I was fortunate to grow up in a family devoted to working with the homeless, terminally ill, battered women and foster children — especially having been a foster/adopted child myself. These varied sides of experiences have led me to my current undertaking, the development of The Vetiver Foundation.

I’ve found it is important to start with “me”, to fast on goodness and allow that process to naturally cleanse the purpose-palette, to perform an exercise in creativity. I want to encourage creatives the world-over to ask and allow yourselves to receive the support you inherently deserve and the love of a fellow human being. 

In manifesting and manufacturing, we are giving AND receiving simultaneously. We are living our bliss and thereby providing an example for conscious, joyful universal expansion. 

Open the cage door and let it fly; creativity doesn’t want to be locked away.


Risks & Challenges

The only risk I'm taking is on you.  I need your help, which is really what defines this foundation -- each of us relying on the other for support in creating something that serves others.  Art, be it painting, dancing, photography, found appropriation, song or any other varied medium is a universal language.  Even if the words don't translate, the tonality and the essence of the performer does.  The gift of creating, the awesome opportunity to witness and interpret that creation as it relates to your own story, these things bond us as a race of humans.

So the challenge? It's to convince you and other outstanding, loving individuals like yourself that you, me, your neighbor's son, our global family is worth the support in creating, sharing, rehabilitating and repeating.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, thank you for taking the time to look at my campaign! I could always use more eyes for this page, so please, get the word out and share this page! 

Possible Tweets:

Support @LilahSwete's amazing artist residency for local, global and cosmic POSITIVE growth! See what all the talk is about at https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/the-vetiver-foundation/x/11152536#/story Please ReTweet

Collect your perks! @LilahSwete is offering life-changing goodies for your help building The Vetiver Foundation. Check it out https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/the-vetiver-foundation/x/11152536#/story Please ReTweet

Possible Facebook Posts:

My friend Lilah Swete is building something that changes the way we define ART for good. The Vetiver Foundation is dedicated to providing artist residencies infused with holistic health education and treatments.  It is a creative movement for a global arts awakening, inspiring underserved communities to empowerment of purpose and self-sustainment.

Check it out here and help!  

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/the-vetiver-foundation/x/11152536#/story

Join me in contributing to her efforts!

___________________

Also please visit my website at www.LilahSwete.com for other ways to contribute (via class attendance or therapeutic package purchases) and www.TheVetiverFoundation.org to see updates as we grow.

story: I am raising money to get a Wacom Cintiq Tablet 27", ToonBoom Harmony 12, and an Epson scanner. I'm going to be opening my own home animation studio where I will freelance my work out to the public and start my own positive cartoon. I plan on doing commercials, etc. while giving back to the community.

I'm going to be opening my own home animation studio where I will freelance my work out to the public and start my own positive cartoon. story:
Short Summary

MABELLEarts does amazing things with amazing people. Thank YOU for being a part of the MABELLEarts family!  We transform neglected, forgotten parks in low-income neighbourhoods into creative hubs and meeting places for thousands of neighbours and friends through inclusive community arts programming. We are now gearing up to launch a new project in a new place.  But we need your help to do it. 

The West Mall is a community rated 149 out of 150 by Toronto Life Magazine on a variety of factors including crime and housing. We will be using what we've learned over 10 years of work and play in the Mabelle Park (with people of all ages and backgrounds) to spark a new park transformation project in the West Mall neighbourhood, while keeping our great work in the Mabelle community going strong.  

Your donation will support a two week art and nature camp for kids and families at the West Mall. It will also support honoraria for Mabelle youth and adult Community Leaders. This is all part of our dream to continue our work in Mabelle Park, while bringing activities to more places in 2016. 

We believe that every person should have access to the wonder and joy of community arts and inclusion. We need your help now to make this happen!

"It's like a fantasy world. With people crazier than your imagination. And they make these incredible things that you couldn't dream of, of maybe you could, but they make it true." --Sultan, Mabelle Youth 

What We Need & What You Get

• Your support will allow us to serve to the West Mall neighbourhood without taking away from the important work that we are doing at Mabelle.

• Your donation will support much-needed art and nature projects in the West Mall including a free art and nature camp for low-income kids and families.

• Also, check out our perks! Most of them include original creations by MABELLEartists. Whatever gift you receive, it will be beautiful and lovingly crafted.


The Impact

Harnessing the many lessons learned over 10 years in the Mabelle Park, we’ll bring together partners, artists, architects, and community leaders with hundreds of people of all ages and backgrounds to connect with nature, the arts and each other. We transform neglected and forgotten parks in low-income neighbourhoods into creative hubs and meeting places for thousands of neighbours and friends.  

This decreases community isolation, increases community safety, and offers opportunities to connect and become friends. Please help us by making a donation now to continue this work in 2016.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spreading the word is also a big help, so please share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, etc. and help us spread the word about MABELLEarts.

Tell your friends and family, coworkers and strangers about MABELLEarts. 

With gratitude and love, 

Leah, Shifra, Dani... and the MABELLEarts crew
