story:
“UNCHAIN YOUR HEART” 

From Tokyo to the US, then from the World back to Japan.
 

International artist, Takashi Hara, and modern fashion Kimono brand, ROBE JAPONICA will start a “new” funk art exhibition tour, Taboo City.  We believe we can make a change within controlled societies and inspire people to live strong.

 

Everybody has something bright.

We believe everyone has something bright and unique within themselves.  Sometimes this brightness can be seen, but sometimes it remains hidden. While some individuals can express themselves strongly, others tend to struggle. I think this division of expression is totally fine because the world wouldn't be nearly as interesting if we all expressed ourselves in the same manner. It’s nice to share and understand our different characteristics.

We want to support people who struggle to keep this brightness -  it is okay to live the way you are. We believe our collaborative art tour would make a change. Even though it may be a tiny change on each person, it can be a big wave with numerous people.


*When you help me in Japanese, please look at the Motion Gallery website.

 

Taboo City Art Schedule (TBU)

<First Exhibition>
Date: Spet.16-26. 2017
Location: Gallery NIW, (Kagurazaka, Tokyo)
Style: Installation Art with mix media
Update: Facebook and Instagram (#taboocityart)

<2nd Exhibition and Future Tour>
Currently, we are looking to bring this tour to Los Angeles, Phoenix, New York City, and Philadelphia. We are still in the process of speaking with and applying to galleries and museums. We appreciate any offer from anywhere from whole over the world!! 

 

Fund Management

This crowd funding goal is set for having the 2nd exhibition in the United States, and for future exhibitions, we would like to set stretch goals. *It will be combined with the MotionGallery's corporate crowdfunding in Japan.

Material: $3500.00
Gallery/Space Rent: $3500.00
Promotion: $1000.00
Overhead Expenses: $2000.00
Goal: $10000.00 (6500.00 on Indiegogo)

Stretch Goals: $13000.00, 16000.00, 19000.00 to extend the tour

 

“Taboo City” Draft Image


*Scale: H2.5MxW3MxD3M  (H8’xW10’xD10’)

 


*Huge Kimono Design

There are many rules in a society that exist besides law, most of which are unspoken rules. Do we really have to follow all of these rules? Is it necessary to become a follower because of what other people are doing? Unknown rules that exist deeply in our societies along with the indefinable constraints we share - those are the rusted chains engraved on our individual hearts.

The whole installation is combination of a toy-like floating city in a huge kimono and texting tunnel.

Kimono?
It is a traditional Japanese garment. The word "kimono", actually means a "thing to wear" (ki "wear" and mono "thing"), has come to denote these full-length robes. The kimono is always worn for important festivals or formal occasions. It is a formal style of clothing associated with politeness and good manners.

- Wikipedia

ROBE JAPONICA is making a huge kimono with special design with traffic signs, streets, and some other rules you may see in a city. Takashi Hara will create pig sculptures living within the city of artful architectures made from tree logs and old house posts. There will be a piggy train going through the city with the small pigs following these rules without doubt.

Why Pigs?
Pigs are an iconic and reoccurring representation with Takashi Hara’s artistic practice.  He uses pigs and texts as a narrative in his allegorical artwork to reflect on societies and their tendencies to put ambitions in a cage. In most cultures, the pig is a subject of derision and abuse. We confine them and manipulate them to our own needs. What is so different from our lives in a manipulative society?

 


*Draft Image of Texting Tunnel


*Tunnel Deisgn

Grey and green represent our texting culture, which is disconnected and colder than actual conversations. It guides viewers to think of how some words, which people throw out, are like intangible chains. The grey side is made of traditional fabric, and the green side is made by ROBE JAPONICA with calligraphic texts by Hara on top.

ソレハダメデシ                    なんで？ 
(That’s not right. Can’t do that.                 Why not?)

フツウミンナヤラナイカラ                                    XXX?  
(Because, Normally, we don't do such a thing.                XXX?)

ソウイウモノダカラ　　    だめって誰が決めたの  
(It’s just how it is.                Who decided it’s wrong?)

ソンナノワガママダ　　　そんなことはないちゃんと考えてる  
(Don’t be selfish.                 Come on, I’m actually thinking well.)

チャントマッスグアルキナヨ　　　 （ぐちゃぐちゃに消した文字）
（You should walk straight & properly.                “unreadable writing”)

 

Return

We would like to send a part of art from Taboo City, and add supporters’ name to Team Taboo City, which will be displayed within the installation during the tours. 

For investing reason, we set prices somewhere at 50%off from our market price and include shipping fee from Japan.

-ART PIECE(s)
-Name in Team Taboo City
-Gratitude Email
-Images of “Taboo City”
-Postcard


"Framed Tunnel Art" Size: A4 or Square


"Jizo Chess Pigs" Size:about H4-5inch


"Artful Architecture" Size: Approximately H1-2', W1', D1'


"Wearable Kimono Art" Size: One size but Kimono is flexibly adjustable 


"The Main Huge Kimono" Size: Approximately 10'x10', (Great to display!)

Risk and Challenge

This is an ongoing project.  The more support we receive, the more we can accomplish.  Even if initial goals aren’t met, the project will still continue.

We truly appreciate if you could share this page and event with your friends, family and colleagues, offer or suggest any exhibition opportunity, and introduce us to anyone or any institution that would be interested in our goals.

 

At the end

Thank you for looking at our crowd funding page. We hope to hear from you and look forward to meeting at one of our exhibitions. Please stay in touch via SNS and updating page here.


Takashi Hara, ROBE JAPONICA

 

 

Biography

Takashi Hara  
Takashi Hara is an international artist from Tokyo, Japan. Hara’s work has been exhibited across the United States, Canada, and Japan. His appreciation of art started when he was 6 years old while studying Japanese calligraphy.   He continued mastering his skills and professional development as an artist, and at the age of 21, moved to Canada where he earned a Bachelors Degree in Fine Arts. Hara later moved to the United States and received a Masters of Fine Arts degree from Arizona State University.  Hara uses his international experience to explore and comment on various societal constructs through paintings, ceramics, calligraphy, and poetry. He has served as president of a collective contemporary art gallery, Eye-Lounge, in Phoenix, Arizona, established a contemporary art company TokyoTAM Ltd. (Trans-Pacific Art Movement) in Japan, and he has organized and engaged in cultural artistic events across Canada and the United States.

ROBE JAPONICA 
“To me, It’s totally fine to wear kimono without proper accessories or manners as long as it’s cool.” – Ueoka, Designer and founder of ROBE JAPONICA.

ROBE JAPONICA is Men’s Kimono brand that combines traditional Japanese kimonos with contemporary designs to create modern, high fashion garments.

Their concept, “Wearing modern Japan,” alludes to society’s view of the kimono, which is seen as a craft and beautiful tradition that is only worn under particular and ‘proper’ situations.  Individuality should be more important than following proper views of fashion.  ROBE JAPONICA attempts to loosen the way kimonos are worn by creating a more casual approach to this beautiful tradition.

The kimono is always worn for important festivals or formal occasions. It is a formal style of clothing associated with politeness and good manners.
- Wikipedia
ROBE JAPONICA is making a huge kimono with special design with traffic signs, streets, and some other rules you may see in a city. Takashi Hara will create pig sculptures living within the city of artful architectures made from tree logs and old house posts. There will be a piggy train going through the city with the small pigs following these rules without doubt.
Why Pigs?Pigs are an iconic and reoccurring representation with Takashi Hara’s artistic practice.  He uses pigs and texts as a narrative in his allegorical artwork to reflect on societies and their tendencies to put ambitions in a cage. In most cultures, the pig is a subject of derision and abuse. We confine them and manipulate them to our own needs. What is so different from our lives in a manipulative society?
 
*Draft Image of Texting Tunnel
*Tunnel Deisgn
Grey and green represent our texting culture, which is disconnected and colder than actual conversations. It guides viewers to think of how some words, which people throw out, are like intangible chains. The grey side is made of traditional fabric, and the green side is made by ROBE JAPONICA with calligraphic texts by Hara on top.
ソレハダメデシ                    なんで？ (That’s not right. Can’t do that.                 Why not?)
フツウミンナヤラナイカラ                                    XXX?  (Because, Normally, we don't do such a thing.                XXX?)
ソウイウモノダカラ　　    だめって誰が決めたの  (It’s just how it is.                Who decided it’s wrong?)
ソンナノワガママダ　　　そんなことはないちゃんと考えてる  (Don’t be selfish.                 Come on, I’m actually thinking well.)
チャントマッスグアルキナヨ　　　 （ぐちゃぐちゃに消した文字）（You should walk straight & properly.                “unreadable writing”)
 
Return
We would like to send a part of art from Taboo City, and add supporters’ name to Team Taboo City, which will be displayed within the installation during the tours. 
For investing reason, we set prices somewhere at 50%off from our market price and include shipping fee from Japan.
-ART PIECE(s)-Name in Team Taboo City-Gratitude Email-Images of “Taboo City”-Postcard
"Framed Tunnel Art" Size: A4 or Square
"Jizo Chess Pigs" Size:about H4-5inch
"Artful Architecture" Size: Approximately H1-2', W1', D1'
"Wearable Kimono Art" Size: One size but Kimono is flexibly adjustable 
"The Main Huge Kimono" Size: Approximately 10'x10', (Great to display!)
Risk and Challenge
This is an ongoing project.  The more support we receive, the more we can accomplish.  Even if initial goals aren’t met, the project will still continue.
We truly appreciate if you could share this page and event with your friends, family and colleagues, offer or suggest any exhibition opportunity, and introduce us to anyone or any institution that would be interested in our goals.
 
At the end
Thank you for looking at our crowd funding page. We hope to hear from you and look forward to meeting at one of our exhibitions. Please stay in touch via SNS and updating page here.
Takashi Hara, ROBE JAPONICA
 
 
Biography
Takashi Hara  Takashi Hara is an international artist from Tokyo, Japan. Hara’s work has been exhibited across the United States, Canada, and Japan. His appreciation of art started when he was 6 years old while studying Japanese calligraphy.   He continued mastering his skills and professional development as an artist, and at the age of 21, moved to Canada where he earned a Bachelors Degree in Fine Arts. Hara later moved to the United States and received a Masters of Fine Arts degree from Arizona State University.  Hara uses his international experience to explore and comment on various societal constructs through paintings, ceramics, calligraphy, and poetry. He has served as president of a collective contemporary art gallery, Eye-Lounge, in Phoenix, Arizona, established a contemporary art company TokyoTAM Ltd. (Trans-Pacific Art Movement) in Japan, and he has organized and engaged in cultural artistic events across Canada and the United States.
ROBE JAPONICA “To me, It’s totally fine to wear kimono without proper accessories or manners as long as it’s cool.” – Ueoka, Designer and founder of ROBE JAPONICA.
ROBE JAPONICA is Men’s Kimono brand that combines traditional Japanese kimonos with contemporary designs to create modern, high fashion garments.
Their concept, “Wearing modern Japan,” alludes to society’s view of the kimono, which is seen as a craft and beautiful tradition that is only worn under particular and ‘proper’ situations.  Individuality should be more important than following proper views of fashion.  ROBE JAPONICA attempts to loosen the way kimonos are worn by creating a more casual approach to this beautiful tradition.

story:
Mother King: an OperaWorks 52 production in three acts

OperaWorks 52 is a music- and story-telling partnership between artists Dameun Strange and Venessa Fuentes. 

Dameun Strange is an award-winning Minnesota Sound Artist/composer who grew up in Washington, DC. He moved to Saint Paul, MN in 1991 to attend Macalester College where he majored in music and English. Recently, Dameun returned to his art music roots, composing Railing Forward: The John Henry Suite for sax quintet, string quartet, and percussion ensemble for collaboration with choreographer Erinn Liebhard. He's currently composing Persimmon and Ebony: the first in a series of orchestral pieces on the subject of the Yoruba pantheon. Dameun also composes electronic music and performs with longtime collaborators Kahlil Brewington and See More Perspective. Dameun was Awarded the American Composers Forum MN Emerging Composers Award in 2015 and a Cedar Commission in 2016.

Venessa Fuentes is a writer. Her poems appear in Between the Heart and the Land/Entre el Corazón y la Tierra: Latina Poets in the Midwest (March/ABRAZO Press, 2001), and The Wind Shifts: New Latino Poetry (University of Arizona Press, 2007); one of her personal essays can be found in A Good Time for the Truth: Race in Minnesota (Minnesota Historical Society Press, 2016) edited by Sun Yung Shin. Venessa lives in South Minneappolis and is a member of the Women of Color Artist Collective, a group of artists, healers, activists, and storytellers.

The goal of OperaWorks 52 is to stretch the walls of opera into an elasticity that will never return to its former shape. We aim to change what you might think about when you think about the word opera. Did you know that the word we often associate with sparkly evening gowns and starched shirts is rooted in the plural of the Latin word opus, which means work? Well. We use opera to manifest a future that is much brighter because it is more inclusive. We use art to challenge the status quo. To OperaWorks 52, the word opera is not confining; it is boundless.

Mother King is our first project. The three-act opera is an adapted work based on the life of Alberta Williams King. Without a doubt, she is the influencing force behind Martin Luther King, Jr. But, how many of us know her name, her story, her legacy? OperaWorks 52 wants to lift this narrative up to join broader conversations about the very real, sometimes overlooked contributions Black women make to social justice movements.

We have a score, a libretto, and an ensemble. We plan to debut Mother King in February 2017. We look to you and your networks to help us activate this project. 

 

Advance Mother King. Let us thank you.

Mother King has a goal of raising $8,000:

  • $3,500 for our ensemble of principles and instrumentalists;
  • $1,500 for a production manager and costuming;
  • $1,000 for poster, postcard, and program printing; and
  • $2,000 for our venue

Community: we look to you and your networks. Your dollars will make a difference, and we have thank-yous in store.

story:
Short Summary

Make America’s Fate {MAF} is the combined effort of Hamtramck-based artists, Valon Gatz and Nicki Szydlo.  Nicki is an artist whose colorful abstract paintings are informed by her intuition.  She has a BFA from Wayne State University with experience in printmaking and bookmaking, and regularly works in her home studio.  

Valon is a senior in Wayne State’s Journalism program. He has experience working with publications in the Metro Detroit area; often preferring to gather people’s stories over more clinical analyses of local issues.  

Make America’s Fate is Valon and Nicki’s combined response to an election season that has implanted both fear and hope within the American people in unprecedented fashion.

Inspired by the testimonies that they heard from concerned citizens; they started MAF in an attempt to chronicle these very real fears and hopes in a way that didn’t feel impersonal.  The serial will be a collection of 10 unique American narratives about their own experience with the 2016 presidential election and 10 paintings inspired by the emotional content of each narrative.  Each edition will be a DIY-printed copy of one citizen’s story, with a high-quality print of the painting as the cover.  Each copy will be free.  By distributing MAF in our community’s shared spaces, we distribute this project in a way that is truly accessible and personal.  

This is where you come in.  To help fund the cost of printing for this project for and about our communities - we need assistance from our communities.

The entirety of MAF will always be available online for free, but the printed aspect of the project is SO important.  Being able to hold a copy of a book in your hand makes it so much more personal than reading it on a blog.

 

By donating to the project, you help us print in a way that looks good and more importantly--can be distributed on a meaningful scale.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Art printing is expensive.  Even in our least expensive quote, to get high-quality prints made of the paintings with archival ink on acid-free paper, they would cost upwards of $7 each - meaning each book would cost us at least that much to print.  Unfortunately, the lucrative career of an artist doesn’t normally allow us to spend $7 each on something we want to make 200 of.  We did a bit of research and discovered that printing at home was much more economical, and wouldn’t sacrifice the quality of the print.  All funds raised will go directly towards our DIY printing operation. We’ve set a modest goal with the idea in mind that every donation counts. Should we fail to reach our goal, we’ll still use what was given to us and put it toward the costs of the operation. 

 

The main cost we need to worry about is the combined cost of a high quality photo printer and a continuous ink system. The former allows us to print covers that capture the lush detail of the original painting. The latter, the Continuous Ink System, allows us to print several covers in a more cost-effective way than having to buy several overpriced single print cartridges.

Our initial goal of $600 includes the following:

  • The Photo Printer - $350
  • A Continuous Ink System - $150
  • Paper - $100

With this, we could print 200 issues. Since we will release ten stories, this means we could print 20 copies of each story. At this scale of distribution, it costs us about $3 an issue.

If we could get another $200($850 total), we could print 40 copies of each issue, a combined 400 copies total. This would make the cost per issue about $2.13.

If we made another $200($1050), we could make 60 copies of each issue, resulting in 600 issues at a cost of $1.83 per issue.

The Impact

The 2016 election has caused a unprecedented reaction in the American public. During election season, a poll on political animosity found that Americans were more divided by their ideologies in this election than they had been in the prior two decades.

Naturally, this has created a disproportionate amount of fear in some and elation in others. Conversing with fellow Detroiters, we found some of our neighbors now feared for their lives in what was supposed to be one of the safest nations on earth.

It remains to be seen how Trump’s presidency will affect all of us. What’s more clear are the emotional testimonies of Americans in this historic moment. We thought these testimonies were largely important, that they shouldn’t be forgotten. It was with that in mind that we started MAF, as a way to document these voices and to gain perspective through a unique medium with an intensely personal lens.

 

We believe it’s important to share these stories as widely as possible, and we hope you do too.  Contributing to MAF is a great way to give our local community a direct way to connect with the experiences of others.  If successful, it will be a way to connect several communities through the same project.  After an election that has left our nation so divided, empathy and understanding for our fellow Americans is more important than ever. It’s our hope that MAF will do a small part in helping achieve that for people across the country.

 

Risks & Challenges

We have been very excited to get the ball rolling on this project for quite some time.  In turn, we have had plenty of time to discuss the possible outcomes of this crowdfunding campaign.

 

In the event that we do not reach our fundraising goal, we will still create and print MAF until its completion of 10 issues.  We may have to purchase our printer used, and we may only distribute in a limited, local run.
 

Regardless, whatever the outcome of the crowd-funding, we WILL see MAF to its completion, even if we have to pay out of pocket to do so.  This is a project that is worth sharing, if only on a small scale.  Your help wouldn’t make less work for us, it’ll allow us the opportunity to do more work and get these issues out to a larger number of communities.

 

On the other hand, if we get overfunded, all money raised past the goal will go directly towards printing costs.  At $600, we are able to print 20 copies of each edition.  At $850, we can print 40, and at $1100 we can print 60.  Once we have the printer and continuous ink system, the cost of paper and ink are our main concerns.

 

And if we get lucky enough to get funded way beyond what we have requested here, we may have to replace equipment and/or hire someone to help us print.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this project on social media. Spread the word about our crowd-funding and also our need for more interviewees.

 

Donate art materials, since we aren’t asking for a dime to cover the cost of what Nicki is using to create her paintings. Things like canvi and paint would be highly appreciated.

 

Be an Interviewee. Fill out this form if interested.

 

Reach out to us at makeamericasfate@gmail.com if you’re interested in helping distributing this in your local city.

story:
CRIMSON CAMPER PROJECT

HOOKING YOU UP WITH ARTWORK, FOR OFFSETTING YOUR CARBON FOOTPRINT.

  • I'm Niko Dellios; a digital nomad, adventurer, artist, and photographer. 
  • We need more ways to show the world that we give a shit, so I'm seeking to give you an opportunity through backing artwork.
  • Follow the journey through photography, and drone imagery.
  • www.crimsoncamper.com

    THE PRINTS

    THE WEST COAST OF THE UNITED STATES IS GRAND. THE PEOPLE, THE PARKS, THE SURF; EPIC.

     I'm capturing the highlights through vibrant paint markers. For additional backing I'm taking requests for subject matter/locations of illustrations.

    • The majority of your backings go to a carbon offset organization of your choice.
    • A small portion of your backing will cover printing/processing and shipping costs.
    • That means that your are taking steps to a better/cleaner/healthier future for all.
    • See them: www.crimsoncamper.com

     

    WHY OFFSET?

    WHETHER YOU'RE A DIGITAL NOMAD DRIVING THE PACIFIC COAST HIGHWAY IN YOUR CAMPER, COMMUTING TO WORK IN YOUR CAR, OR USING A TOASTER...

    YOU'VE GOT A CARBON FOOTPRINT.

    Burning fossil fuels for transportation creates CO2, which has a massive impact on the natural cycles of our world (with and without humans). The more you burn, the bigger your footprint.

    If you like it here (Earth)...it's time to take action to preserve it.

    • It's not realistic for all of us to move "off the grid" and become carbon neutral.
    • This is a great way to mitigate your impact, by supporting organizations that specialize in emission reduction.
    • View your offset as insurance (but tangible): protecting yourself from a not-so-desirable future.

     

    YOUR CHOICE

    PICK WHERE YOU WOULD LIKE TO FOCUS YOUR CARBON OFFSETTING!
    Find more information on the Crimson Camper Website: http://www.crimsoncamper.com

    • CHOOSE.TODAY
      • ​Holding corporations responsible for their emissions by purchasing carbon allowances.
    • CARBON FUND
      • Carbon offsetting and green house gas reduction options in Energy Efficiency, Forestry, and Renewable Energy
    • CITIZEN'S CLIMATE LOBBY
      • Climate action across all geographic regions and political inclinations. Focus on passage of a Carbon Fee and Dividend proposal.
         

    NOW YOU KNOW!

    WHETHER YOU BUY A PRINT OR NOT...NOW YOU KNOW.

    • Maybe you don't like my art.
    • Maybe you don't like that I always wear hats.
    • Please share the project on your social media outlets, maybe someone else likes my hats.
    • I'm happy you got this far and hopefully learned more about your carbon footprint.
    • More information on offsetting programs is available on www.crimsoncamper.com

    Thanks!

story:
Short Summary

Hey there! My name is Daniel Gold. I am a NYC based choreographer and performer that created Leg Up On Life. Leg Up On Life is an artistic initiative that was created to help give a platform or artists to come together to present works while raising money for phenomenal organizations that give back directly to society.

As an artist I have learned it is not always easy to come by opportunities to present new work or even get on stage as a performer. Leg Up is a way to help give more opportunities for artists to utilize their craft while giving back to the community in the best way they know how.

 

What We Need & What You Get

As stated in the video producing these events and helping keep the costs down for all the artists involved is NOT cheap! Donations to the campaign will go straight to this years events including cost on...

  • Venue 
  • Rehearsal Space
  • Classrooms
  • Event Technicians
  • Programs
  • Event Promotions
  • Tickets
  • Transportation
  • and more!!

The Impact

Leg Up On Life BLEW past its goals for fundraisers this year. Aiding both Dancers Against Cancer and The Trevor Project. It also allowed 15 teachers, 16 choreographers, and 103 performers a chance to put there talents out to the public. We plan on keeping the Leg Up community going and welcoming even more people. Giving even more opportunities and helping more organizations with their missions.

Other Ways You Can Help

Not only could you help by donating even $1, $5, or more.... BUT you can help spread the word! Help us make some noise about this campaign. The more people informed the better the chances we are to meet our goal. Blasting us on your social medias, emailing our link, texting, or even word of mouth. Any way of getting word out is better than no way.

Most importantly, come show your support. Buy a ticket to one of our events, come take classes when they are offered. The mission of Leg Up On Life is to get these artists work out their and appreciated for amazing causes. Come enjoy a show or many and see some quality and diverse talent you won't get a chance to see anywhere else!
story_txt:
Short Summary
Hey there! My name is Daniel Gold. I am a NYC based choreographer and performer that created Leg Up On Life. Leg Up On Life is an artistic initiative that was created to help give a platform or artists to come together to present works while raising money for phenomenal organizations that give back directly to society.
As an artist I have learned it is not always easy to come by opportunities to present new work or even get on stage as a performer. Leg Up is a way to help give more opportunities for artists to utilize their craft while giving back to the community in the best way they know how.
 
What We Need & What You Get
As stated in the video producing these events and helping keep the costs down for all the artists involved is NOT cheap! Donations to the campaign will go straight to this years events including cost on...

Venue 
Rehearsal Space
Classrooms
Event Technicians
Programs
Event Promotions
Tickets
Transportation
and more!!

The Impact
Leg Up On Life BLEW past its goals for fundraisers this year. Aiding both Dancers Against Cancer and The Trevor Project. It also allowed 15 teachers, 16 choreographers, and 103 performers a chance to put there talents out to the public. We plan on keeping the Leg Up community going and welcoming even more people. Giving even more opportunities and helping more organizations with their missions.
Other Ways You Can Help
Not only could you help by donating even $1, $5, or more.... BUT you can help spread the word! Help us make some noise about this campaign. The more people informed the better the chances we are to meet our goal. Blasting us on your social medias, emailing our link, texting, or even word of mouth. Any way of getting word out is better than no way.
Most importantly, come show your support. Buy a ticket to one of our events, come take classes when they are offered. The mission of Leg Up On Life is to get these artists work out their and appreciated for amazing causes. Come enjoy a show or many and see some quality and diverse talent you won't get a chance to see anywhere else!

story:
What is Doodles?

Hello! My Name is Samia and I am the founder of Doodles Creative Sessions, New Bedford’s most colorful mobile studio! 

Doodles is a community art program centralized around free expressions of creativity from our children. After four years of utilizing donated spaces to thrive in our community, Doodles has decided to take a different approach. As you can imagine, rental prices for a commercial space can be costly, so a compromise was greatly needed. We were faced with a problem, yet innovation brought on the idea of a mobile art studio space that will provide a stable location for the program and allow the program to come right into your community! 

Now, more than ever, it is imperative that the community takes on fostering creativity as public school budgets continue to slash recreational programs. Studies have proven that art has a direct impact on a child’s ability to learn and how they perceive the world around them. Children who partake in the arts are four times more likely to be recognized for academic achievements. Creating art has a way of bringing a sense of calm, playfulness, and freedom. Doodles is very passionate about protecting these core values. 

Samia currently works in Operations for DJD Medical and retains a degree in Criminal Justice from Bridgewater State University. Samia’s background originates from obtaining her ECE certification in high school to working in daycares, and eventually becoming a private nanny for a military family. While Samia is maintaining a full-time career and navigating the ins and outs of being a new mom, she dedicates much of her spare time to maintaining and working on ways to expand and grow Doodles!

With your contribution, Doodles will become self sustainable and continue to be a mobile artistic force, working towards encouraging more children to explore the arts. We will be able to build a customized trailer, and shed that is eco friendly and within compliance so that all children can enjoy all of its awesomeness! 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $10,000 in building capital to fabricate the custom mobile art studio. We plan to use the funds as follows:

Custom Wood Shed 12’x8’ $3500

Trailer Bed 16’x6.4’ $2500

400 Watt Solar Panel Kit $1500

Lighting $200

Gladiator Wall Storage/Counter System $400

Triple Tier Metal Lockers $400

Portable Sink $250

Interior Design with Coloring Wall $500

Approx.$9750 (Installs & Labor not Included)

Contributions of ANY AMOUNT will be entered into a raffle for a 1 year membership to Doodles Creative Sessions and an all access pass to all Doodles' special events.

We are working on some unique perk packages that will be updated periodically. A very cool, limited edition “Color Me” Doodles hoodie will be one of them! 

You can purchase monthly memberships or “Color Me Doodles” shirts (washable markers included) at a discounted price as your contribution to  the campaign. 

Lament your love for Doodles and become a name etched into our mobile studio's Doodles Donors plaque that will be bedazzled at the entrance of the art studio. 

Doodles' Impact

Doodles is dedicated to opening our doors to any and all youthful creative minds. We value your consideration now, more than ever, the village mentality is needed to protect the things we still value in our communities, and whole heartedly would appreciate your help in making this possible. We have proven the effectiveness of our program over the last five years and need your help to ensure it can last another 25 years and beyond. We recognise the benefits of creativity in people's lives for personal development. Creating art has a beautiful way of bringing a sense of calm, playfulness, and freedom. With your help, we can connect with others through the language of creativity and play. We need you to make this aspect possible and viable for the longevity and continuity that these children deserve! 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk we face is that the winter months in New England will render the mobile art studio immobile in inclement weather. We will outfit and insulate to maintain heat to continuously provide mobile arts on the tolerable winter weather days. A parking location is a minor a concern but there are some connections with city officials who are looking to donate a parking space/mobile art studio bus stop. 

Winter Storage : Although we will attain a regular outdoor parking location for the trailer when it is detached from our vehicle, we will need to secure an indoor parking location for snow emergencies etc. Contacts are also working on finding a suitable solution to this as well, but nothing seems out of reach or will impede the usage of the mobile art studio. 

Our largest challenge will be obtaining the most protective insurance. Auto insurance will be acquired for the trailer and liability insurance for any possible “uh oh” moments amongst our members and ourselves. We have been interviewing local insurance companies to navigate through the accurate policy.

 

Other ways to help Doodles

If you are unable to make a monetary donation our campaign, we would LOVE some hands-on help :

  • sharing our campaign on your social media networks
  • donating supplies
  • helping with the build-out (paint some walls, drill some holes, etc.)
  • sharing your skills with us (teach a sewing class, etc)

story:
American Born Self Taught Artist Richard Kurtz, lives & works in his Oxnard,California Studio just off of PCH.

Jennifer Esperanza of Esperanza Projects represents and shows his work.

Esperanza is thrilled to be offering Richard's work at PULSE Miami, December 6th - December 10th, 2018. & at The 2019 NYC Outsider Art Fair in January.

In this fundraiser, Esperanza Projects is offering some of Richard's smaller works at affordable prices to raise money to cover basic operational costs of doing these art fairs. The booth fees for the two fairs are close to $18,000. Other fees incurred are transportation of the artwork from Southern California to Miami & NYC, hiring installers, paying staff, housing, printing etc. • Each work offered here is an original, one of a kind piece of art made by the artist.

The art fairs are important. Richard paints every day & maintains a studio practice. This is all possible through the support of people like you -collectors, friends, and family.  This year, Esperanza Projects exhibited  Richard Kurtz at the NYC Outsider Art Fair and Art Palm Springs. 

Richard & I are thankful for all of your support. We know the healing power of art. Our goal is to share this experience with you. Art is healing for the artist, the culture and the art collector. 

I have worked for five years with Richard to help take his work out of relative obscurity & to help him find balance. Presently, he maintains a daily studio practice.  We all benefit. For when the artist is able to explore and maintain an inner dialogue and investigation, this enriches our culture too.  

Please, take the time to see the work of Richard's I am offering and follow us on our journey.

Thank You & Kindness,

Jennifer Esperanza 

Artist Richard Kurtz 

Artist Richard Kurtz 

Richard & The Sea 

The Goal Is ELEVATION 

Artist Richard Kurtz & Jennifer Esperanza of Esperanza Projects

story:
Who am I?

My name is Simon Devon. I am a professional actor born in the U.S.A and based in Edinburgh, Scotland, UK. I have an acting degree from the University of Central Lancashire (UCLan). My experience is mostly in live theatre but I find all forms of acting fascinating. I take an active interest in politics, particular US politics, and am drawn to forms of art that challenge people and give life to new and progressive ideas.

What's the idea and why does it matter?

As an American citizen, I am regularly drawn back into U.S. Politics and I find President Donald Trump appallingly fascinating, harrowing and intriguing all at the same time. Many people speak of his impeachment and his resignation with a sense of imminence but it has become apparent that although the former is getting more and more likely, the latter is not. Donald Trump does not appear to be of the opinion that he has done anything wrong despite countless evidence to the contrary. 

But what if one day, he did? What if one day he suddenly wanted to reform and take back everything he has done? What would it take for him to make up for everything, or is it even possible to seek that kind of redemption? What kind of things would he need to say in such a speech in order to gain, if possible, forgiveness from all the people he has wronged?

I asked myself these questions and realised the answers turned into my writing the resignation speech we all deserve to hear. But to do this speech justice, and to bring it to life, I need everyone's help to do it.

I want to create an immersive film so everyone can meet The Good Donald and then see him fall. The ins and outs I'll detail, but by contributing to this project you will be rewarded with seeing what may never happen; Donald Trump resigning. I will perform and give a version of Donald Trump that is articulate, remorseful and good. This is something I don't just want to show to the world, but to the president himself. I want his reaction to the version of himself that cares. You will help me to achieve this.

The Funding Stuff

The total cost for this performance we believe will be £2000. This will  cover the following;

 

Camera rental and operator

Teleprompter

Sound Equipment

Editing in Post

Lighting and Green Screen

 

Venue Hire

Replica Desk

Props and Background

 

Costume

Make up

Hair

 

Script Writers/Editors

Acting and Directing costs

Marketing and Advertising

Producing costs

Fees for the IndieGoGo Platform

 

There will likely be hidden extra costs that need to be taken into account as well, the total should cover all of these but any extra would only be beneficial.

 

Giving Something Back

The Good Donald himself would also like to offer extra rewards/perks depending on the size of contribution made:

£10 or more will get you eternal gratitude from The Good Donald (which doesn't come lightly) and a thank you via email

£20 or more will get you a public tweeted apology to you from The Good Donald (you can name the specific thing he must apologise for.)

£30 or more will get you an official handwritten apology to you from The Good Donald (you can name the specific thing he must apologise for)

£50 or more will get you an official phone call apology from The Good Donald (you can name the specific thing he must apologise for)

£100 or more will get you an official video call apology from The Good Donald (you can name the specific thing he must apologise for)

£250 or more will get you a face to face meeting, in a location of your choice, with The Good Donald where he will apologise to you in person. *

£500 or more will get you a meal with The Good Donald where he will apologise to you in person *

£1000 or more will get you a game of mini golf with The Good Donald where will apologise for all the times he has cheated at Golf. You will win. *

*The final three options may be subject to your location and the availability of both The Good Donald and the contributor; since The Good Donald is based in the U.K. But I want to reward as many people for their contributions as possible so we can work something out.

- Please email The Good Donald at realgooddonald@gmail.com with the necessary details, name, twitter handle etc so you can claim your appropriate perk.

All contributors will be credited in the final production, and will have the eternal gratitude of The Good Donald. 

If we don't reach the initial goal that we intended, then corners may have to be cut in places that will impact the overall quality of the performance. The idea is simple and it's a good one, but what will make it work is the execution of it. It will need to be a flawless production with an excellent script. The latter will be left to me and script writers Stewart Schiller and Alexander Dodd (both who I have worked with on many productions), but the former will rely on the right funding so I can hire professional crew and artists to contribute.

 

Risks and Challenges

Aside from the obvious challenge of making this look like an authentic president's address; which will require a tight and professional production; there is the challenge of the performance of myself; the actor. I will need to make this version of Donald Trump empathetic, remorseful and human. This already looks like a gargantuan task but I am confident in my skills as an actor. The training I received from UCLan was astounding and has produced several incredible and successful actors already. I have a wealth of experience in acting roles and have the ability to make characters believable and convincing.  (Feel free to view my C.V. on spotlight for an idea of my experience and training.) 

https://www.spotlight.com/interactive/cv/0610-9...

Part of what makes an Actor successful in his craft is their ability to empathise with the character. Whilst I have not separated children from their parents, incited racial hatred in an entire country and committed several acts of sexual assault (allegedly) I have the ability to place myself in the shoes of any person in order to imagine what that person must be thinking. I can draw on this to give the performance required.

Other ways you can help

As with any performance, a big part of what will allow for the success of this performance will be people seeing it. And even if you cannot contribute I would greatly appreciate it if you can share and spread the word as much as possible. Indiegogo have some pretty simple sharing tools, so sharing doesn't take much effort and it will help bring this project to life. I firmly believe that it is vital that people see this, and I need your help to make that happen. Thank you so much for taking the time to consider contributing. I really do appreciate it. You, my friend, are wonderful.

story:
Who Am I?

I'm a PhD student in Creative Writing. Currently unemployed. I'm the first in my family to graduate high school. I taught English for 10 years, got my MFA in poetry, sold my GNND house, and bet everything I had on getting a PhD. I teach College Composition, tutor part-time, and generally try to get involved in things that matter.

 

The Product!

I don't get paid all summer. My tutoring job is down to 0 to 2 hours a week. Serving jobs are not hiring for the summer. I need a little moola to help pay the bills (rent for June is covered!)

So I'm making a zine! It will have original comics, poems, and other creative stuff. This project will be made completely by me--no editors, no publishers, no printers--just me. You won't find this stuff in any academic journals, lit mags, or poetry rags--just the old fashioned way: printed at Kinkos. 

 

The Impact

Your contribution will help

1. create some art!

2. keep my phone on

3. get me to a week-long writing retreat

4. visit my dad and family

5. help costs of food and travel

6. motivate me to vlog, post, write, move, keep on keeping on

7. cover the costs of printing and mailing the zine--direct, no gatekeepers, no tastemakers

 

The Trip!

I plan to visit friends and crash on couches in the following places:

1. Georgia

2. Kentucky

3. Ohio

4. New Hampshire - I want to be there for my dad on Father's Day!

5. D.C.

6. North Carolina

and I plan to vlog, post,  and write all about the places, people, thoughts, troubles, and joys I find along the way. 

Please share!

Chances are you might be close to broke, too! You can still share my campaign and help get the word out. Thanks!

story:
Short Summary

We're three students at Saint Joseph University of Beirut who came together as a new curating entity in order to realize this project in the frame of the MA program in art criticism and curatorial studies. We're setting up an art intervention at Rashid Karami International Fair of Tripoli in order to artistically reclaim the city symbolized by the Fair. We invited local and international artists to examine the city of Tripoli through various mediums that echoes the suspended state of the fair.

Day 1 - اليوم الأول

A state of suspension overshadows not only the fair but all of the city, leaving the buildings hung in time, prisoners of their day 1. Never able to fulfill their initial vocation, they stand today fighting age and negligence. Our one day art intervention at the Fair is an attempt to be part of its day 1 by inviting local and international artists to share their reflections on the city trying to make their way out of this state of suspension.

“Day 1” is a question rather than a statement. It invites the audience to think about the future of this iconic place, thus of the city, in order to be part of the decision. The decision of having a “day 2” that can be a huge step for a city full of potentials.  

The intervention, inspired by the fair, will stop by the end of its day 1. Asking the same question, would there ever be a day 2? A a question that adresses the potential of art within a dialogue about the city.

 Although we're halfway the realization of the project thanks to the generosity of all of the artists who agreed to participate as well as the administration of the Fair, we still need your generous contribution to mark the start of our curatorial career. 

Time: 23rd of June 2018.

From 4:00 pm to 8:00 pm.

Place: Rachid Karami’s international Fair of Tripoli.

Participating artists

A Live Sound Intervention by Sharif SEHNAOUI and Shakeeb ABU HAMDAN 

BAROUDI, Samira

DIB, Ibtissam

EL HALLAK, Firas

EL HARIRI, Rafic

MOURAD, Yahya

POTEL, Dorine

RAFEI, Ali

SAFADI, Badr

SALEH, Mustapha

 

Curating team

Narimane Abouelseoud

Lena Allam

Chantale Fahmi

Your generous contributions will help us cover the technical and production costs.

Total Budget:                                         $5560 

Printing & execution of artworks    $1700

Installation costs                                  $700

Marketing materials                            $1060

Catering                                                   $700

Cleaning & Safety measures            $500

Electricity & generators                     $300

Transportation (guests

and artworks transportation)          $600

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help us by spreading the word on social media platforms – Facebook, Instagram, Twitter etc.  

You can also volunteer to help us in the organization of the day, to do so, contact us on facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Day1EscapingSuspension

story:
I want to bring my art out in the world to reach people and make their imagination spin.
My paintings are full of hidden signs of joy, mystic, freedom and love of our beautiful planet. 
Showing my art in Tokyo will give me the oppertunity to meet my audience and let them share their thoughts about how my paintings "talk" to them.

Visit Tokyo International Art Fairs website

I need fundings for:

1. Flight ticket - Stockholm - Tokyo -$1000 USD

2. Hotel in Tokyo -$800 USD

3. Exhibition - Wall at the Tokyo Art Fair - $ 3000 USD

4.Mention in E-Newsletter Preview of Art Fair with artwork image linked to website -$ 550 USD

5. Extra large feature in Catalogue 1 page - $ 300 USD 

6. Mention in Press Release  - $ 650 USD

A painting is born

 If I see a beautiful landscape it goes straight into my heart and my feelings start to play with it. Trees change colour to blue or purple, water flows, not downhill but uphill, houses twist and reshape, they become castles or flying homes created for love. When I work the painting always comes from the subconsious part of me. It works it´s way like a feeling starting from the heart and slowly moving like a warm wind to my brain. There it moves around for a while, playing with diffrent settings of color, shape and refelction. The painting can stay there in my brain for days, sometimes weeks or even months. It is a little like carrying a baby, you hold it within you and care for it with feelings and thoughts. Finally the painting is ready to be born.

Then I go into the flow, letting the shapes run down from my brain, down to the canvas and find their place. I use a lot of water when I work and let the colors mix and remix. There are layer after layer of paint, letting one color shine through the colors painted abowe. Light is very important in my paintings and I let it glow like a strange moon dancing across the skies or like splashes from a waterfall.

The painting progress takes time. Every layer of paint that I put on the painting has to get completely dry before I can start with the next layer. And so it goes on, layer after layer - sometimes up to 20 layers on one painting. 

But then I come to the point where I feel I have let out what the painting wanted to say and the shape it wanted to form on the canvas. It is a feeling of complete and peace, but also a litte of "missing my inspiration" it has now been transformed into a painting thats shining in front of me.

The work is done and I go out again to find new inspiraton.

 

Exhibitions in selection

2016 - Louvern, Paris

2014 - Agora Gallery, Manhattan, New York

2013 - Stockholm Art Fair

2011 - Brick Lane Gallery, London

2010 - Agora Gallery, Manhattan, New York

For more exhibitions - visit my webpage

Represented by

The Pax Gallery in Wienna

Agora Gallery, Manhattan, New York

Agora Gallery - About my art

Agora Gallery - Read about my participation in the exhibition "Syncronicity

story:
Welcome to Endless Art 

Hello, my name is Javaun Willis and my love for art and all creative things manifested at a very early age. Growing up I was always fascinated with superheroes and comic books and fantastical world building which made me want to sketch and draw and create. As I became older and more skilled I realized that the supplies became more expensive and the space I desired to work in was much larger than what I had available. Then before I knew it, I went off to school in Florida at Full Sail University to study computer animation. The special thing about Full Sail is that they had their facilities running 24/7, which meant there was always a place to work and I always had many tools and supplies at my disposal. After I moved back home to Indiana it was almost strange not having a place I could always go to escape and dive into my art. Which is why I want to create an open environment for people who live in a larger city such as Chicago, where space at home may be limited, or even just a place where you can clear your head and recenter your focus. I also know that for many artists, especially up and coming ones, resupplying your materials can become expensive. I want to create an affordable experience for not only professionals but also for young artists trying to build their brand. 

All funding for Endless Art will go toward initial startup expenses, marketing, and pinpointing a location to setup shop. All contributions, no matter if its a dollar or if you decide to take part in one of the perks provided, will be vital to the development of this project. I'm prepared to take on this journey with you all, and whether the goal is met or not, any funding made will go toward the opening of the studio whether that be through bank services or other means. All that matters is that it starts here with you all and I just want to say thank you in advance for helping me pursue my vision.

story:
Our Story

Hi Indiegogo!  

My name is Wolf Voigt and I'm the owner of a company called Glitter Hippo®.  Im a craft store fanatic like many of you and visit many retail hobby stores at least a few times a month.  About two and a half years ago I was trying to find glitter at my local Michael's craft store and saw there were really no glitters that stood out.  Yes, there were many colors but the packaging for all the brands available were very bland and the glitters were just not as amazing as I had hoped to find.  So, I asked myself the question, what if I created my own brand of glitter?  

I was on a mission to create my own glitter brand company so I contacted several manufacturers around the world,  who create glitters with unique properties, to bring all of them to one place to be offered.  Six months later, in July of 2015, www.GlitterHippo.com was founded.  When I first started the company we used zip lock bags with  sticker labels and although the business vision was there, the model was not where I wanted it to be.

Today, we have re-branded our Glitter Hippo® glitter with new packaging, a story of how the Glitter Hippos came to be and even have our line of Glitter Hippo® toys available!  With your help, we will be able to get Glitter Hippo® in retail stores across North America and have the best glitter available with the most attractive packaging! 

Heres where you can help!

We are seeking to raise $5000 to help purchase inventory and new packaging for our many different glitters.  The types of different glitters we have include: Holographic, Color Shifting, Glow in the Dark and so many more.  Because these glitters are different than the standard ones you see at your local hobby stores, they are also more pricey.  Our new packaging has the Glitter Hippos® in a huddle in the front of the package with a transparent hippo shaped window revealing the color glitter in each package and their story of how they came about on the back of each package.  The design will certainly gain the attention to anyone who is looking for the coolest glitter around!

So what kind of Perks do we have?   AWESOME ONES!!!

  • Glitter Hippo® brand glitters including: Holographic, Glow in the Dark, Color Shifting, Micro, Fluorescent, Shimmer, Matte and more!
  • Glitter Hippo® toy figures.  9 total colorways!
  • Glitter Hippo® Apparel! 
  • And last but not least, our everlasting thanks for helping us fund our project and get Glitter Hippo® into craft stores near you!

Risks & Challenges

Before we started the Indiegogo campaign we wanted to make sure our game plan was in place with our new packaging and perks to avoid having our supporters wait a long time to receive their perks.  We anticipate to have many of the perks out to our supporters within 30-60 days of the campaign ending

Other Ways You Can Help

Would you like to help us even more??  Please! SHARE, SHARE, SHARE on your Social Media platforms and tag us!  We are on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram as @GlitterHippoStore.

The more exposure for our project the better we can be prepared to move forward with our dream in being in retail stores.


Thank you to EVERYONE who has an interest in helping us out! 

~Wolf Voigt

story:
About Taro's Origami Studio: The Nation's Leader in Origami

We believe that origami can help people through tough times.  Since 2011 Taro's Origami Studio has been a mainstay in the Park Slope and greater NYC community, providing people with a new life-long skill.   We have helped spread origami through countless classes, lessons, birthday parties, after school programs and corporate events.

We've been profiled in the New York Times, and featured on ABC 7-

 

 

Here's a clip of us that even got all the way back from Japan-

 

 

And finally, here's a fraction of the companies that we've helped bring their visions to life with origami:

From large projects...

 

To groups looking to help us all like the Ad Council...

 

 
We've always been at the leading edge of presenting origami to the world.

 

 

The reason why we decided to implement this project

In March when schools closed and non-essential businesses were shuttered, we took it upon ourselves to help limit the spread of the virus and closed immediately. 

 
 
Taro's has remained open in a limited capacity during this pandemic, and while we have been working hard taking orders, shipping books & paper and offering curbside delivery, the loss of foot traffic, community events and corporate projects has been financially devastating.  And even though the re-opening of businesses has begun, we here at Taro's recognize that close-quarters origami lessons will still have some chance of transmission, so we have voluntarily decided to stay closed and take this opportunity to find a new way to move forward.

Which brings us to this campaign.

We believe that Taro's Origami Studio is a valued part of this community and are thrilled to announce the vision of our new Mobile Origami Studio!

We are grateful to our community for this chance and look forward to teaching and folding with you for years to come. 
 

How we will use the Taro's Mobile Studio?

Now instead of having to visit us in Park Slope, we will purchase/lease and convert a commercial van, to be able to come to you and offer origami lessons, events, classes, and sales in safe outdoor environments throughout New York City and beyond.  

Inside the Mobile Studio we will have:

  • A world-class origami library to help teach models
  • A state-of-the-art origami learning tablets
  • A museum-quality selection of amazing origami models
  • A one-of-a-kind origami store

This is an exciting chance to help not just Park Slope, but also the undeserved areas of our great city.   And with the announcement of our new Origami Scholarship Program we are on the lookout for the next generation or origami artists and teachers.

 

We use state of the art technology to teach everyone

Taro's Origami Method Learning System

Have you ever gotten frustrated with Origami?  Traditional origami books can feel out of date and a bit like a foreign language.  To fix this Taro's has spent the last decade perfecting our own unique and sophisticated teaching method called Taro's Origami Method that breaks up all of origami like the letters of the alphabet.   In this way we teach you all of the tools you need to succeed and enjoy folding.  And we continue to have professional origami teachers available to provide you with one-on-one video lessons to help you along to path to becoming an Origami Master.

Origami Learning Software installed in tablets

And as if that wasn't enough, we've also integrated our easy-to-follow folding methods with our tablets to make sure origami is as accessible and simple as possible.  This Mobile Studio is sure to be the most high-tech origami vehicle around!

 

About the contribution perk levels

Here are some details about what you can get for your generous contribution!

 

  • Updates and reports about the project

Stay in the loop and find out when the mobile studio is going to be near you!

  • Taro's Origami special postcards

These beautiful postcards show off some original Taro Yaguchi origami designs and are a lot to fun to send to friends that you can't see in person!

           

  • Taro's Origami Paper Bundles (Standard 65 + 100 + 200)

Our traditional "kami" origami paper is the standard for paper folding excellence in the industry.  It is hand cut in Japan by generations of paper professionals.

  • Easy Origami Textbook and Videos

This book with over 30 models contains some of the easiest folding around and is a wonderful place to start learning this ancient art form.  Then watch all of our videos on the models to learn them in the easiest way possible!

​

  • Teach Yourself Textbook and Videos

This book is for people interested in learning origami and all the folds needed to master it.  There are over 30 easy to complex models to work on.  Then follow our videos from our teaching staff to master each of the models!

  • Brand-New Origami City Book 

This All-new Origami book from Workman and Taro's Origami Studio allows you to build and play with your very own origami city!

  • Online Lesson Videos by our Taro's Origami Teachers

There are only about 30 folds in all of origami, and these on-line video courses will teach you all you need to know about them and then also provide models for you to practice on.

  • Private On-Line Origami Lessons with our Senior Staff

Take a class with our professional teachers and help master your skills

  • An origami model folded by Taro Yaguchi himself!

  • Certification in the Taro's Origami Artist Course

Become a certified Taro's Origami Artist, this includes private classes and tutorials with our senior staff.

  • Dispatch the Taro's Mobile Studio to a designated location for a class of you own!

Send our mobile studio to a location near you!

  • A decal of your company on the back of the Mobile Studio

Display your logo on the van itself!

  • A Yearly Origami Subscription Service for your company

We will create and pass along origami videos and diagrams for you to help spread the joy of origami to your staff, guests, clients, and friends.

 

What our plan is moving forward

  • This funding goal will help us purchase a new van, create decals and get out on the road spreading origami!
  • A newer van costs around 18,500$ and with the customizations and decals that our design team is working on now we believe that 25,000 is a reasonable goal.
  • Everyone who donates will receive gift, ranging from of our very own Japanese origami paper, to models that founder Taro Yaguchi folded himself!

The Impact

  • Since 2011 we have worked diligently to spread origami with projects in cities like New York, San Francisco, Orlando, Dallas, Los Angeles, Las Vegas and Denver.
  • This new Mobile Origami Studio will allow us to reach underfunded areas in our neighborhoods.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Continue folding origami and buying paper and books from our stores!
  • Thank you so much for your support and we'll see you again soon!

Updates and reports about the project
Stay in the loop and find out when the mobile studio is going to be near you!
Taro's Origami special postcards
These beautiful postcards show off some original Taro Yaguchi origami designs and are a lot to fun to send to friends that you can't see in person!
           

Taro's Origami Paper Bundles (Standard 65 + 100 + 200)
Our traditional "kami" origami paper is the standard for paper folding excellence in the industry.  It is hand cut in Japan by generations of paper professionals.

Easy Origami Textbook and Videos
This book with over 30 models contains some of the easiest folding around and is a wonderful place to start learning this ancient art form.  Then watch all of our videos on the models to learn them in the easiest way possible!
​
Teach Yourself Textbook and Videos
This book is for people interested in learning origami and all the folds needed to master it.  There are over 30 easy to complex models to work on.  Then follow our videos from our teaching staff to master each of the models!

Brand-New Origami City Book 
This All-new Origami book from Workman and Taro's Origami Studio allows you to build and play with your very own origami city!

Online Lesson Videos by our Taro's Origami Teachers
There are only about 30 folds in all of origami, and these on-line video courses will teach you all you need to know about them and then also provide models for you to practice on.

Private On-Line Origami Lessons with our Senior Staff
Take a class with our professional teachers and help master your skills
An origami model folded by Taro Yaguchi himself!

Certification in the Taro's Origami Artist Course
Become a certified Taro's Origami Artist, this includes private classes and tutorials with our senior staff.
Dispatch the Taro's Mobile Studio to a designated location for a class of you own!
Send our mobile studio to a location near you!

A decal of your company on the back of the Mobile Studio
Display your logo on the van itself!

A Yearly Origami Subscription Service for your company
We will create and pass along origami videos and diagrams for you to help spread the joy of origami to your staff, guests, clients, and friends.
 

What our plan is moving forward

This funding goal will help us purchase a new van, create decals and get out on the road spreading origami!
A newer van costs around 18,500$ and with the customizations and decals that our design team is working on now we believe that 25,000 is a reasonable goal.
Everyone who donates will receive gift, ranging from of our very own Japanese origami paper, to models that founder Taro Yaguchi folded himself!


The Impact

Since 2011 we have worked diligently to spread origami with projects in cities like New York, San Francisco, Orlando, Dallas, Los Angeles, Las Vegas and Denver.
This new Mobile Origami Studio will allow us to reach underfunded areas in our neighborhoods.


Other Ways You Can Help

Continue folding origami and buying paper and books from our stores!
Thank you so much for your support and we'll see you again soon!

story:
I have been teaching film photography for 20+ years! Most of our younger generation does not know about film, but once they see an image expose and print right before their eyes, they are in AWE! I love that sound!

I have the camera, chemicals, teaching skills and desire to share the beauty of original photography wet plate processes. Your support funds will help me build a moble darkroom and camera obscura that demonstrates how light travels and creates an image. All ages will love this!

Help me spread the love for photography and the 'printed' image.

Donate $200 or more and I will create an 8x10 tintype photograph for you.

Thank you!

Darcie Westerlund

story:
NOW IN STOCK ...

Fast US shipping

See our ETSY shop for more options:

www.etsy.com/shop/TarotofSaqqara

www.tarotofsaqqara.com

tarotofsaqqara@gmail.com

The 2nd Printing of the Tarot of Saqqara

The Tarot of Saqqara

Five thousand years ago in the sacred sands of the Sahara, on the west bank of the river Nile, the greatest Pharaoh of the Third Dynasty commissioned Imhotep to build the first pyramid of Egypt.  It was here at Saqqara during a trip in 1981 that Donald Beaman became inspired by the great monument which served as the necropolis for the ancient Egyptian capital of Memphis. It remained an important complex for royal burials and cult ceremonies for more than 3,000 years and it is here that the initiations of those seeking enlightenment were performed.

Using his skills as a professor of theatrical design at Boston University and from his study of sacred geometry, Mr. Beaman began to create images of the early systems of spiritual divination and transformation. His original paintings are composed on 36” x 52” wooden art board using acrylic, silver and gold leaf paints.  The final work is an elaborate collection of images derived from the architecture and knowledge of the earliest societies. They comprise not only an Egyptian influence but also that of the Kabbalah, Roman, and Celtic traditions. These paintings would eventually form an 82-card tarot deck entitled “The Tarot of Saqqara”.

The Deck

The Tarot of Saqqara is based on the traditional 78-card tarot deck on 3.5" x 5.5" cards. The stock is light and flexible with a glossy sheen, while the backs have a reversible pattern that speaks to Prof. Beaman's understanding of sacred geometry. There are four additional cards which are not to be used in an ordinary reading. They were created to explain the initiation to the student or the neophyte. Each of the major arcana cards depicts an associated Coptic symbol, Hebrew symbol, Rune symbol, and Egyptian hieroglyph symbol, along with design elements rooted in sacred geometry, numerology, and astrology. Also included with the deck is a 96-page instructional booklet.

"The Tarot of Saqqara deck is a visually stunning deck with highly symbolic touch. If you enjoy Egyptian art and understand the basics of Sacred Geometry this deck is for you. Donald Beaman's artwork is the heart of this deck. His paintings hold much information in which to read in your sessions."

 "Donald Beaman is a master of this unique work. Filled with a plethora of research; talent beyond compare with the illustrations, he captivates the reader and querent alike. A must-have for all tarot enthusiasts."

"The Atus or majors are represented as niches in a temple, filled with radiant light and superior realism creating the effect of a true temple of initiation. Sacred numerology and geometry reminiscent of Tarot Maconnique make the small cards equally rich. The court cards are organized in the Thoth manner and are exquisite."

Who Will Enjoy This Deck?

If you are a collector of Tarot cards or an appreciator of sacred geometry, an Egyptophile, Kabbalist, or art collector, a divinator, card reader, psychic medium, or occultist you will appreciate having these richly symbolic cards in your collection.

Donald Beaman's Artistic Legacy

In 2014, at the age of 81, artist Donald Beaman passed away leaving this amazing treasure, the Tarot of Saqqara, for mystical seekers of the truth. It is our great pleasure to help keep his life's passion alive through the publication of these amazing Egyptian Tarot Cards based on his artwork. 

Renowned psychic and tarot reader Stephen Parker says: "This is one of the most important additions to the subject of tarot that I have had the fortune to encounter in the 42 years I've been involved in facilitating readings."

The Photographer and Designer - David Browning

I was fortunate enough to be introduced to Mr. Beaman in Massachusetts the day before the magnificent paintings of the major arcana were due to be boxed up and taken from the inn where they were hanging to be stored in an attic. At his request, the movers gave us the opportunity to take photos of each of these paintings split seconds before they were crated up for storage. This has allowed us the opportunity to permanently display these beautiful images in both tarot card and digital format for thousands to enjoy.

You Can Help

With your participation and support, each deck that is purchased provides another opportunity for YOU to discover your own soul secrets through Donald Beaman's impressive work with symbology, sacred geometry, and mythology. Together we can share these richly detailed paintings for generations to come.

  • Contribute by purchasing a tarot deck for yourself.
  • Contribute by purchasing a tarot deck for yourself AND a friend.

FREE Ways To Help

  • Help us spread the word by SHARING this project on your Facebook timeline.
  • Email, text, or call your tarot enthusiast friends and let them know about this limited edition of the Tarot of Saqqara.
  • LIKE, FOLLOW, SHARE, & INVITE FRIENDS to the Tarot of Saqqara Facebook page

FREE Tarot of Saqqara Publication Links

  • LWB "Little White Book" Tarot of Saqqara deck Instructional Companion PDF version.
  • Video of Prof. Donald Beaman giving a tarot reading using the Tarot of Saqqara.

Wholesale

  • Please contact us through Indiegogo for a wholesale price link for Tarot of Saqqara deck quantities over 5.

 

Excerpt from the 96-page instructional booklet included with the Tarot of Saqqara deck


A trip through THE TAROT OF SAQQARA is not “The Grand
Tour” of enlightenment, nor a “get-away to the island of your
dreams,” nor a safari to the dark recesses of superstition. It is
simply movement toward an affirmation of Life.
Each of the cards is a part of yourself – a ripple in the water,
indicating you have passed by. If we would construct a Temple
of Truth of THE TAROT in our mind, we must become one
with the original. We must allow the Ancients to speak through
us; and we must be willing to demonstrate in our lives that
Wisdom which is unchanging. Then all Temples become one
and THE ONE is our self and we are

THE HERMIT, and THE MAGUS, and THE FOOL.
And All are One
In NEITH
Who is WISDOM
If you are resolved to penetrate the darkness of our own
ignorance and to illuminate with your Thought, the Mystery
behind the Veil, then pass on, Pilgrim. May you walk in the
ways of WISDOM. Live and be well. Live and be ONE.

 

Thank you for your time,

your interest in this deck,

and for your support of this Indiegogo project.

tarotofsaqqara@gmail.com

www.tarotofsaqqara.com

story:
Reggie's Story

  Reggie Madison was born in Chicago on the south side in 1941. He has been an artist for 52 years and is self taught in all disciplines.But there was not actually any art in his house as a child.  One thing that was a constant in his upbringing was always jazz music. His parents were avid listeners and regulary frequented the Club Delisa in Chicago. The love and respect for jazz music is largely the primary influence and reason of this project being born. 

    Reggie recalls being a young man and hearing his parents talk about a musician and composer of their day named  Herman Blunt. As Reggie matured into a man he discovered the music of Sun Ra who happened to be Herman Blunt..... in his previous life. He found the man's music and the transition to Sun Ra very interesting. There was the music of course which was great yet it is myth and personae of Sun Ra that is the subject of his latest work. This is the construction of 10 musicians, made of wood, and many salvaged materials. This is a epic project that Mr. Madison has been working on for 3 years. This is a passion project that is a tribute not only to Sun Ra but also to Mr. Madisons parents who instilled the appreciation of jazz music. Unfortunately due to primarily financial reasons the project keeps getting held up. At this current point Reggie is not free to get on with the project in a way that will allow him to have the collection of pieces ready for his  premier @ CR10 Contemporary Art Space owned by Francine Hunter McGivern. Reggie is in need of monetary support from the artistic community in order to complete this project.

What we need and What you get!

Much of his funding will go towards buying new power tools for the sculpture. These include an air compressor,a nail gun,and a power router. Some other supplies such as nails for the nail gun and bits for the router will be needed. Another major expense is the cost of renting his studio space for 3 months. That rent however does not include his utilities which will be another expense. Other living expenses such as food and transportation are a heavy burden to have to worry about when you are trying to focus on a creative project. Due to the scale of the project(many figures are 8 feet tall!) and number of pieces he will have to pay an assistant to help in the transportation of the pieces. He also has to pay for other promotional expenses such as editing of this video,flyers,and social media to get the word out there. The rest of the funding will go into fulfilling your perks as a donor. One of our coolest perks is going to be a one of a kind hand painted re-print of the work. Moreover the most important commodity in making this project possible is TIME. And as they say TIME= MONEY! Money is the only tangible thing that is scarce and preventing the project from moving forward at full steam. But even if we don't reach our goal you can be sure all the funds will go to completing as much of the project as possible before the premier on June 6th,2015.
Financial Breakdown :
Tools + Materials = $6,500
Rent+Utilities = $3,000
Misc Living Expenses=$1,500
Paying Assistants=$1,800
Fullfilling Perks=$2,200

The Impact

The project is valuable because the show will have an impact on Reggie's career. The relative success of this premier of Sun Ra's Arkestra in Sonic Sculpture has the potential to be a crucial piece for making a living as an artist in the future. As we have said Reggie is not a weekend warrior. He is a true commited artist for life. He has a tremendous body of work behind him and . Reggie has shown his work in many venues including NYC Philistine on Green st, Spazi Fine Arts in Housatonic Mass,The Hugh Hill Gallery in Kent,Ct , and recently in The John Davis Gallery on Warren st in Hudson,NY. Every year at Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute Reggie has done a presentation for Black History Month and currently showing there with Lemerol Gatewood. 

Risks & Challenges

Inspiration has never really been a problem for Reggie but money is. We can't stress enough how frustrating it is for Reggie to have the vision for his "Arkestra" yet not be able to make it happen because he does not have the proper funds. Mr. Madison is a very resourceful and inspired artist who has a special talent for improvising materials.The dedication and commitment to the project will allow him to reach the end of the project. No matter what Reggie will finish this project. 


Other Ways You Can Help

So we totally realize that not everyone can donate to the project but you can still help. We need all the help we can get trying to get the word out about Reggie's project and his upcoming show. So please share our links on your facebook,linkedin,twitter,and any other forum you know of that might get Reggie the recognition he so much deserves.
