story:
Ready to help out a True American dream? It all started when I joined the U.S. Marines to serve my country in the early 90's. Now there is something that seems to be common across all branches....Tattoos. They are somewhat of a must in the military and now are very main stream in today's society. This part is no big secret. The one thing that eluded me when I wanted to get my first Marine Corps tattoo was where to get it, how much is a good price, how do I know this is a reputable artist? This business has seemed to be a mystery for some time. I found that even the artists themselves find it very difficult to connect with a client base efficiently. I started an on base publication for military personnel to see local artists and their work. The publication grew by leaps and bounds and was very popular. Then I was moved to California and didn't have the energy to restart this at a new base. I thought there has to be a better way. So after some years of research and planning(and major advances in the internet since 1991). Ink Badger was born. Ink Badger is a patent pending software that allows clients who are looking for A tattoo to upload a design and have multiple artists bid in your local area. Each artist has their own profile page and is rated by prior clients. Once an artist wins the bid, the client goes for the consult with their set price and the confidence they are getting a great price from the right tattoo artist. This also solves the problem of up and coming artist looking to break in the business to find that customer that would never be able to find them. The site is completed and we are in beta testing phase now. Ink Badger will also have an app that customers can upload a tattoo they currently have for a cover up bid, as well as all the capabilities as the full site. All the technology is in place to get my dream off the ground. Now we just need you to help us launch!!

And please remember because of our military roots we believe in giving back. A portion of our proceeds and your funding will go to Standown.org 

                                               


Stand Down House, owned & operated by Faith*Hope*Love*Charity, Inc. (FHLC, Inc.), helps male 
veterans who are struggling due to mental / physical wounds & illness, addictions, homelessness and/or 
other issues regain their lives through a multi tiered program, transitional living, & collaborative efforts. 
FHLC, Inc. addresses the needs & unseen wounds of our veterans & military members.

PROBLEM?


SOLUTION




_____________________________________________________________________________

What we need is to get a complete setup for a convention tour we will be launching starting in May 2015 at Tattoo Mania. We have already became a major sponsor for the event.

This is where we will get the most exposure to the tattoo community in a small amount of time. The impact we need to make at these events has to be impressive. We need the money raised to purchase a traveling trade booth setup that is surprisingly expensive. One example is below of just the back drop wall that are close to $2100 alone.

You may be thinking I'm not a tattoo type. That's ok too. We still have some pretty great rewards for helping us get to our goal. From cool Ink Badger gear to custom shoes and tattoos, we have something for everyone. We have our own line of "Love Ink Shirts"

We also have wireless speakers that look like soda cans, temporary tattoos, monthly subscriptions for artists, and advertising spots on our site and app for your business, and of course real chair time for someone to get a fantastic tattoo they have been dreaming of!

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Our biggest challenge so far is that we may grow too fast before we can open an area or city. Because of the demand of clients might outgrow the amount of artists in a certain city, it is imperative that we launch one state at a time starting with Florida. Growing faster than we could handle would cause client and artist loss over time.
Press Release
 Click Here for latest press release

Now the site is done and we are on our way to launch, we turn our efforts to the mobile app that has been in development for some time now. Not just any app that mimics the website. It does have all the features of the site but with one very important element for cover ups and tattoo removals. The app allows the customer to use normal smart phone camera to take a picture of an existing tattoo and measure the size of the tattoo for optimal quotes from tattoo cover up artists and tattoo removal companies. The app is set to launch shortly after the launch of the site in May 2015.


Whether you are a tattoo lover , or just looking to help an entrepreneur on his way to fulfill a dream, contribute to Ink Badger. You will score some great rewards and help some people along the way.


Support our movement by following us on:

Just featured on 24HourCrowdfunding
Click Here

artist wins the bid, the client goes for the consult with their set price and
the confidence they are getting a great price from the right tattoo artist.
This also solves the problem of up and coming artist looking to break in the
business to find that customer that would never be able to find them. The site is completed and we are in beta testing phase now. Ink
Badger will also have an app that customers can upload a tattoo they currently
have for a cover up bid, as well as all the capabilities as the full site. All the technology is in place to get my dream off the
ground. Now we just need you to help us launch!!And please remember because of our military roots we believe in giving back. A portion of our proceeds and your funding will go to Standown.org 
                                               


Stand Down House, owned & operated by Faith*Hope*Love*Charity, Inc. (FHLC, Inc.), helps male veterans who are struggling due to mental / physical wounds & illness, addictions, homelessness and/or other issues regain their lives through a multi tiered program, transitional living, & collaborative efforts. FHLC, Inc. addresses the needs & unseen wounds of our veterans & military members.
PROBLEM?




SOLUTION




_____________________________________________________________________________


What we need is to get a complete setup for a convention tour we will be launching starting in May 2015 at Tattoo Mania. We have already became a major sponsor for the event.

This is where we will get the most exposure to the tattoo community in a small amount of time. The impact we need to make at these events has to be impressive. We need the money raised to purchase a traveling trade booth setup that is surprisingly expensive. One example is below of just the back drop wall that are close to $2100 alone.

You may be thinking I'm not a tattoo type. That's ok too. We still have some pretty great rewards for helping us get to our goal. From cool Ink Badger gear to custom shoes and tattoos, we have something for everyone. We have our own line of "Love Ink Shirts"





We also have wireless speakers that look like soda cans, temporary tattoos, monthly subscriptions for artists, and advertising spots on our site and app for your business, and of course real chair time for someone to get a fantastic tattoo they have been dreaming of!

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------




--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------










Our biggest challenge so far is that we may grow too fast before we can open an area or city. Because of the demand of clients might outgrow the amount of artists in a certain city, it is imperative that we launch one state at a time starting with Florida. Growing faster than we could handle would cause client and artist loss over time.
Press Release
 Click Here for latest press release




Now the site is done and we are on our way to launch, we turn our efforts to the mobile app that has been in development for some time now. Not just any app that mimics the website. It does have all the features of the site but with one very important element for cover ups and tattoo removals. The app allows the customer to use normal smart phone camera to take a picture of an existing tattoo and measure the size of the tattoo for optimal quotes from tattoo cover up artists and tattoo removal companies. The app is set to launch shortly after the launch of the site in May 2015.

Whether you are a tattoo lover , or just looking to help an entrepreneur on his way to fulfill a dream, contribute to Ink Badger. You will score some great rewards and help some people along the way.

Support our movement by following us on:


Just featured on 24HourCrowdfunding

Click Here

story:
SometimesBeautiful is a celebration and contemporary analysis of the notion of beauty, defined by a selection of over fifty artists, primarily women, spanning the globe from New York, Philadelphia and Los Angeles, Berlin, Milan and Paris to Amsterdam, Seoul and Transylvania. They are as varied in ethnicity, race, sexual identity and interests as their choice of artistic media. SometimesBeautiful empowers and redefines, both physically and cerebrally, the perception of beauty.

SometimesBeautiful challenges prescriptive beauty as defined by consumerism and media machines; and celebrates those who exude magnificence. This book considers such themes and is organized through the following tenets—Beauty, Fetish, Voyeur, Taboo, Distorted and Aversive.

The funds raised will be used to independently publish the SometimesBeautiful book.....Long term goals include using the book (distributed to innovative curators and museum directors) to secure a major traveling exhibition to include works from all artists in the book.

Participating artists include:  

Bruce Adams, American, Buffalo, NY; Cindy Baker, Canadian, Lethbridge, Alberta, Canada; Michelle Liane Baillargeon, Canadian, Alberta, Canada; Lynn Bianchi, American, New York, NY; David Michael Bowers, American, Eighty-four, PA; Rubens Cantuni, Italian, Milan, Italy;  Monica Cook, American, Brooklyn, NY; Michael Costello, American, Boston, MA; Paula Jean Cowan, Canadian, Sackville, New Brunswick, Ontario, Canada; Jen Davis, American, New York, NY; Kelli Damron, American, Greenville, IL; Martin De Vita, American, Buffalo, NY; Steffi Greenbaum, American, Falmouth, ME; Joe Gregory, American, Kansas City, MO; Naomi Grossman, American, Long Island City, NY; Joshua Hagler, American, Berkeley, CA; Susie Hamilton, British, London, England; Biff Henrich, American, Buffalo, NY; Sally Hewett, British, Canterbury, England; Lilli Hill, Kazakhstani, Berlin, Germany; Substantia Jones, American, New York, NY; Dean Karr, American, Los Angeles, CA; Sarah Kaufman, American, Philadelphia, PA; Catherine Larré, French, Paris, France; Margaret E. LeJeune, American, Batesville, AR; Yossi Loloi, Italian, Milan, Italy; Mary Ivy Martin, American, New York, NY; Melinda Matyas, Hungarian, Transylvania, Romania; Meredith Miller, American,New Haven, CT; Allyson Mitchell, Canadian, Toronto, Ontario, Canada; Leonard Nimoy, American, Los Angeles, CA; Brenda Oelbaum, Canadian, Ann Arbor, MI; Rolf Ohst, German, Berlin, Germany; Kayleigh O’Keefe, British, London, United Kingdom; Lydia Panas, American, Kutztown, PA; Sarah Paul, American, Cleveland, OH; Ann Piper, American, Selinsgrove, PA; Marisa Portolese, Canadian, Montreal, Québec, Canada; Lee Price, American, Beacon, NY;  Abe Robinson (Blind7Photography),American, Cleveland, OH;  Jennifer Saftler, American, New York, NY; Adam Schultz, American, Redfeather Lakes, CO; Esther Shimazu, American, Honolulu, HI; Koh Jeong Soo, Korean, Seoul, Korea; Iiu Susiraja, Finnish, Turku, Finland; Elisabeth Walden, American, Providence, RI; Clint Weathers, American, Minneapolis, MN;  Koh Sang Woo, Korean, New York, NY; Christine Wuenschel, American, Lafayette, IN. 


(*) Please note that the SometimesBeautiful book, to be published following the close of fundraising efforts, will be formatted, structured and quality assured reflective of the maximum level of funding attained.

story:
Une odyssée dans l'imaginaire des premières féministes engagées

Artiste multidisciplinaire, diplômé de l'Université du Québec à Trois-Rivières en Arts et nouveaux médias et détenteur d'un diplôme professionnel en photographie, Sylvain Robert met ici à profit ses vingt ans d'expérience en scénarisation, réalisation et conception visuelle avec cette exposition inspirée du cinéma du début du 20e siècle. « Seules contre tous » se veut une interprétation des hantises imaginaires des premières féministes engagées de l'époque telles Catharine Macaulay, Annie Besant et Florence Nightingale. Par des mises en scène photographiques séquentielles amalgamant la photo numérique et la photo argentique 35 mm, Sylvain Robert offre une réflexion à la fois humoristique et dramatique sur ce propos délicat qui prit naissance publiquement dans les années 1400 et qui n'en est pas moins d'actualité quelques 600 ans plus tard.

Le but de la campagne de financement

Déjà plus de 2000$ ont été investis à titre personnel dans le projet en déplacement, décors, costumes, accessoires et équipements spécialisés. L'ensemble des photos est déjà prêt à l'impression et les dates et les lieux de la tournée 2015-2016 se multiplient. Ne reste que l'impression (Longue durée UV) et l'encadrement (aluminium et verre) estimés entre 75 $ et 150 $ par photo selon le format, soit approximativement 2000 $ pour l'ensemble. Dans le cas ou l'objectif ne serait pas atteint, seule la qualité du cadre sera reconsidérée. L'ensemble du projet, le nombre de photos ainsi que leur qualité d'impression n'en seront pas affectés. Dans le cas où la campagne de financement surpasse les attentes, la qualité de présentation en sera accrue et l'excédent servira à rentabiliser les nombreuses heures investies qui ne sont pas prises en compte dans les calculs ci-haut.

L'impact

Le soutien du public et du privé au sein d'un projet artistique démontre l'intérêt et la pertinence de la démarche de l'artiste dans son milieu. La méthode de financement étant reliée à l'achat d'oeuvres photographiques, elle contribue fortement à la mise en circulation des oeuvres et à la visibilité de l'artiste.

Dans les contreparties vous trouverez la pré-vente du livre exclusif de l'exposition Seules contre Tous au coût de 55$, l'une des plus mémorables façons de contribuer.

D'autres façons d'aider

Vous connaissez un lieu de diffusion reconnu qui est intéressé par la promotion du talent des artistes émergents? N’hésitez pas à m’en faire part et surtout, parlez du projet autour de vous ! Merci infiniment pour votre soutien et vos encouragements, Sylvain Robert

story:
The Story

Hi there! My name is Blake Higgins and I'm an independent journalist who has been working on the story of Ken Botham Jr. for the last 16 months. Ken has been in prison for over 39 years for the murder of his wife Patricia, his neighbor Linda and Linda's two young boys Troy and Chad. However, his guilt has recently come into question, and it's possible there may be some viable DNA candidates to test that could prove his innocence.

I've decided to tell the story in a serialized first-person podcast called Junction. I released the first episode at the end of April and have received a lot of great feedback. In order to tell the story properly, though, I need to be in Grand Junction, Colorado, (where this all took place in 1975) for the next six months to talk to everyone who was involved in the case.

And this story goes much deeper than just Ken's story. Eight women and children were murdered in Grand Junction in 1975. This was unprecedented for a small town of only 23,000 where only two murders had occurred in the past decade. I'd like to poke around and see what exactly was going on during the year locals still call 'the killing season.'

I want to tell this story so that Ken, the victims, the families of the victims and the whole town of Grand Junction can finally receive definitive answers about this case. I hope this story can provide some resolution for everyone involved. I also want to tell the most compelling story I can, because this is one of the most interesting stories I've ever come across.

You can listen to the first episode below or visit junctionpodcast.com to listen to the podcast, read old newspaper articles and keep up with the behind-the-scenes blog.



The Perks

$10-Postcard Thank You You'll receive a hand-written postcard from yours truly thanking you for helping to make Junction a reality. Of course the postcard will be from Grand Junction, so you'll have a little bit of show history to keep forever, plus a sample of my handwriting for all your forging needs!


$25-Junction T-Shirt A super-soft American Apparel t-shirt with the Junction logo on it! The shirts are made for a fair wage in Los Angeles so you can be guilt-free as well as ridiculously good-looking. (Headless models not included.)

       


$25 Junction Poster-Hang one of these 18" x 24" posters over your bed to remind you of your favorite podcast every day! Or, buy a bunch and wallpaper your whole house...there's no end to the possibilities!


$50-The Combo For those who weren't content with just one perk! The combo includes a t-shirt, a poster and the thank-you postcard all for a discounted price. Insanity, I know.

 +  + 


$100-Storytelling Podcast Consultation I'll spend 90 minutes with you answering all your questions about creating your own storytelling podcast. I'll cram everything I've learned about finding a story, interviewing, editing and distribution into your brain. This can be done via Skype or in person if you promise not to kidnap me. (I included a picture of the teacher from Stand by Me because that's how inspiring of a teacher I'll be!)


$250-Ad Read I'll read a 15-second advertisement on an episode of Junction! Promote your business or project on a podcast that will be getting listens for years down the road...possibly centuries. (Image represents estimated number of people who will listen to your ad.)


$1,000-Storytelling Workshop I'll come to you and teach an all-day storytelling workshop for however many people you want! I'll share everything I've learned and give everyone a chance to practice new techniques.  Airfare and a bed will be extra unless I happen to be in your area. (Image is representative of how blown your minds will be by this workshop.)


The Budget

Here's a breakdown of how I'm going to be spending the funds
  • $4,000-Living Expenses Rent, utilities and other living expenses that will come up over six months of reporting. As you can see, I live cheap.
  • $3,100-Fees The boring stuff that needs to be prepared for like taxes, credit card fees and Indiegogo's fees.
  • $2,500-Perks Shirts, posters and shipping all cost money. This is my estimate of how much I think everything will cost.
  • $1,700-Car Car payment, insurance and gas for six months as I drive around Grand Junction. 
  • $1,500-Tech Server costs, website fees and the cost for the Mobile Cause donation app service.
  • $700-Gear Digital recorder, microphone and an external hard drive to back everything up with

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're a bit strapped for cash but still want to help, there are plenty of things you can do!

  • iTunes-Find Junction on iTunes and be sure to leave a written review. This will help the podcast climb the New and Noteworthy charts and be seen by more people.
  • Facebook-You can find Junction on Facebook and keep up with the story as it grows and evolves!
  • Twitter-Check out the Junction twitter page and be sure to follow, favorite and re-tweet all my peals of wisdom.
  • Spread the Word-Even though social media is great, telling your friends, family and co-workers about the podcast the analog way is still the best way to spread the word.
  • Go Deeper-Be sure to visit junctionpodcast.com to read hundreds of articles and follow the behind-the-scenes blog.

story:
NO LIMIT – Stockholms klubbscen 1993-1995

  • en inbunden 152 sidors coffee table-bok om det tidiga 90-talets klubbscen
  • innehåller över 100 unika foton tagna på Stockholms klubbar 1993-1995
  • intervjuer med över 70 av dåtidens klubbprofiler
  • nytagna foton på 90-talets klubbkids, från Lina Perned till La Camilla
  • kronologi över Stockholms klubbhistoria 1990-1995
  • extramaterial i form av flyers, topplistor mm
  • design i toppklass
  • påkostat tryck i stort format med foliering och utvik
  • kort sagt: historien om hur Stockholm blev hippt

Vi behöver er hjälp att finansiera produktion och tryck av den hittills största och mest omfattande boken om Stockholms galna 90-tal.

Historien om det tidiga 90-talets klubbscen i Stockholm, berättad av de som var med.

Det var fantastiskt, det var galet, och Stockholm skulle blivit helt annorlunda utan denna speciella epok. Stockholms status som internationellt erkänt nav för design, mode, musik och it tas idag för given. Men för 25 år sedan var Stockholm mest känt för blondiner och isbjörnar utomlands.

Stockholms omstart skedde de första åren på 90-talet, när en mängd kreativa och exhibitionistiska lycksökare från alla håll möttes på Stockholms klubbar, fulla av glädje, ambition och väldigt mycket attityd. Ambitionen var att ha kul, leva för stunden och att göra sin egen grej. Känslan var att allt är möjligt.

Ni som var med vet vad vi menar. För alla er andra, här är chansen att upptäcka en svunnen värld fylld av avklädda och plastklädda klubbkids – de som blev dagens generation av media- och modechefer, regissörer, design- och nattklubbschefer. 

Payman Dehdezi, klubbkid 1994. Idag nöjeschef på Hornhuset.

Unika foton från 90-talets klubbar. Med nytagna foton och intervjuer 20 år senare.

Eftersom det inte riktigt ansågs coolt att gå på klubb med en kamera på 90-talet finns det inte mycket foton bevarade. Det handlade om att leva i stunden och det fanns inget behov att visa upp hur snygg man var eller hur kul man hade. Alla var ju där!

Därför är det tur att Stefan Holm fick i uppdrag av klubbarrangörerna att under den stockholmska klubbexplosionens högtidsperiod – åren 1993-1995 – ta foton på de massiva Deep-festerna samt på klubbar som 2001 och Vegas.

20 år senare har vi sökt upp närmare 100 av det tidiga 90-talets klubbprofiler, intervjuat samtliga samt fotograferat dem på nytt, 20 år senare. Av detta har vi vävt samman den kollektiva historien om Stockholms glömda 90-tal, berättad av de som var med.

Vilka är vi?

Stefan Holm, mode, reklam- och porträttfotograf som var aktiv redan på 90-talet, då han fick i uppdrag att fånga utelivet på några av Stockholms mest tongivande fester och klubbar: de massiva Deep-festerna på Cirkus, klubbar som 2001 och det legendariska Vegas, som bara fanns i ett år och var ursprunget till den senare G-klubben.


Mikael Bohman, på det tidiga 90-talet tv-producent på ungdomskanalen ZTV.
I denna egenskap var han både i centrum för och bevakade det stockholmska klubblivet, oftast tillsammans med parhästen Peter Siepen.

Vad ska pengarna gå till?

Vi vill göra en riktigt högkvalitativ bok i 1 000 exemplar. Det kostar en del pengar. Vi ger ut boken själva, så inga pengar går till ett förlag. Så här ser budgeten ut:

  • Redaktör, transkribering av intervjuer, korrläsning: 40 000 kr
  • Formgivning, layout och sättning: 25 000 kr
  • Tryckning: 59 000 kr

Summa: 154 000 kr eller cirka 18 000 dollar. Får vi in mer pengar än så, får vi ersättning för de hundratals timmar vi har lagt ned och kommer att lägga ned på projektet.

Vi räknar med att ge ut cirka 400 förbeställda böcker genom den här kampanjen. De övriga kommer vi att sälja på utvalda boklådor och på nätet.

Risker & utmaningar

Den främsta risken är att vi inte uppnår våra insamlingsmål. Det vi kan göra då är att dra ned på upplagan. Vi är dock inte beredda att dra ned på kvaliteten på boken, så om vi inte får ihop tillräckligt med pengar för att trycka boken så ger vi pengarna tillbaka. Men det ska mycket till för att det ska hända. Vi har redan lagt ned oerhört mycket tid på det här och är fast beslutna att projektet ska bli av.

Hjälp oss sprida kampanjen!

Vare sig du kan ge oss ett bidrag eller inte: om du gillar projektet – hjälp oss genom att sprida det socialt och snacka upp det hos dina vänner och bekanta!

Nu kör vi!

Micke & Stefan
Stockholm, 2 juni 2015

Tack till:

  • Josefin Crafoord, Tony Zoulias, Apollo, Robert Bohman och Wai Chan för medverkan i boktrailern.
  • Tove Bergqvist, Dragan Stankovic, Pontus Ernfors, Caj Müller, Joel Cornéer och Lexter Ljuddesign för produktionshjälp. Vi fikade på Taverna Brillo.
  • Ingmari Pagenkemper för att vi fick spela in på Södra Teatern
  • Hypernature - Metal Hunter, House of Virginism - I'll Be There For You, Alexi Delano - Not For Release Traxx, Seba & Lotek - So Long
  • Stockholmsnatt för tillstånd att visa teckningar i trailern
story_txt:
NO LIMIT – Stockholms klubbscen 1993-1995


en inbunden 152 sidors coffee table-bok om det tidiga 90-talets klubbscen
innehåller över 100 unika foton tagna på Stockholms klubbar 1993-1995
intervjuer med över 70 av dåtidens klubbprofiler
nytagna foton på 90-talets klubbkids, från Lina Perned till La Camilla

kronologi över Stockholms klubbhistoria 1990-1995
extramaterial i form av flyers, topplistor mm
design i toppklass

påkostat tryck i stort format med foliering och utvik

kort sagt: historien om hur Stockholm blev hippt

Vi behöver er hjälp att finansiera produktion och tryck av den hittills största och mest omfattande boken om Stockholms galna 90-tal. 



Historien om det tidiga 90-talets klubbscen i Stockholm, berättad av de som var med. 

Det var fantastiskt, det var galet, och Stockholm skulle blivit helt annorlunda utan denna speciella epok. Stockholms status som internationellt erkänt nav för design, mode, musik och it tas idag för given. Men för 25 år sedan var Stockholm mest känt för blondiner och isbjörnar utomlands.
Stockholms omstart skedde de första åren på 90-talet, när en mängd kreativa och exhibitionistiska lycksökare från alla håll möttes på Stockholms klubbar, fulla av glädje, ambition och väldigt mycket attityd. Ambitionen var att ha kul, leva för stunden och att göra sin egen grej. Känslan var att allt är möjligt.
Ni som var med vet vad vi menar. För alla er andra, här är chansen att upptäcka en svunnen värld fylld av avklädda och plastklädda klubbkids – de som blev dagens generation av media- och modechefer, regissörer, design- och nattklubbschefer. 




Payman Dehdezi, klubbkid 1994. Idag nöjeschef på Hornhuset.



Unika foton från 90-talets klubbar. Med nytagna foton och intervjuer 20 år senare.
Eftersom det inte riktigt ansågs coolt att gå på klubb med en kamera på 90-talet finns det inte mycket foton bevarade. Det handlade om att leva i stunden och det fanns inget behov att visa upp hur snygg man var eller hur kul man hade. Alla var ju där!Därför är det tur att Stefan Holm fick i uppdrag av klubbarrangörerna att under den stockholmska klubbexplosionens högtidsperiod – åren 1993-1995 – ta foton på de massiva Deep-festerna samt på klubbar som 2001 och Vegas.
20 år senare har vi sökt upp närmare 100 av det tidiga 90-talets klubbprofiler, intervjuat samtliga samt fotograferat dem på nytt, 20 år senare. Av detta har vi vävt samman den kollektiva historien om Stockholms glömda 90-tal, berättad av de som var med.




Vilka är vi?
Stefan Holm, mode, reklam- och porträttfotograf som var aktiv redan på 90-talet, då han fick i uppdrag att fånga utelivet på några av Stockholms mest tongivande fester och klubbar: de massiva Deep-festerna på Cirkus, klubbar som 2001 och det legendariska Vegas, som bara fanns i ett år och var ursprunget till den senare G-klubben. 


Mikael Bohman, på det tidiga 90-talet tv-producent på ungdomskanalen ZTV. I denna egenskap var han både i centrum för och bevakade det stockholmska klubblivet, oftast tillsammans med parhästen Peter Siepen. 








Vad ska pengarna gå till? 

 Vi vill göra en riktigt högkvalitativ bok i 1 000 exemplar. Det kostar en del pengar. Vi ger ut boken själva, så inga pengar går till ett förlag. Så här ser budgeten ut:  Redaktör, transkribering av intervjuer, korrläsning: 40 000 kr
 Formgivning, layout och sättning: 25 000 kr
Tryckning: 59 000 kr

Summa: 154 000 kr eller cirka 18 000 dollar. Får vi in mer pengar än så, får vi ersättning för de hundratals timmar vi har lagt ned och kommer att lägga ned på projektet. 
Vi räknar med att ge ut cirka 400 förbeställda böcker genom den här kampanjen. De övriga kommer vi att sälja på utvalda boklådor och på nätet.
    Risker & utmaningar
Den främsta risken är att vi inte uppnår våra insamlingsmål. Det vi kan göra då är att dra ned på upplagan. Vi är dock inte beredda att dra ned på kvaliteten på boken, så om vi inte får ihop tillräckligt med pengar för att trycka boken så ger vi pengarna tillbaka. Men det ska mycket till för att det ska hända. Vi har redan lagt ned oerhört mycket tid på det här och är fast beslutna att projektet ska bli av.Hjälp oss sprida kampanjen!Vare sig du kan ge oss ett bidrag eller inte: om du gillar projektet – hjälp oss genom att sprida det socialt och snacka upp det hos dina vänner och bekanta!Nu kör vi!Micke & StefanStockholm, 2 juni 2015Tack till: 

Josefin Crafoord, Tony Zoulias, Apollo, Robert Bohman och Wai Chan för medverkan i boktrailern. 

Tove Bergqvist, Dragan Stankovic, Pontus Ernfors, Caj Müller, Joel Cornéer och Lexter Ljuddesign för produktionshjälp. Vi fikade på Taverna Brillo.
Ingmari Pagenkemper för att vi fick spela in på Södra Teatern

story:
Children's Book Summary

I'm Amy Scheidegger, a working visual artist, graphic designer, local children's book illustrator as well as the Founder of the Artistic Rebuttal Project. Established in 2011, we aim to provide an outlet for anyone to share their arts experience in an effort to advocate on behalf of creative careers, respect for artists and their rights, arts education and arts access.

Since 2011, the kids at Mighty Writers have been contributing pieces of visual artwork that express in words their love for the arts, some of which have gone on exhibition, been published in the Artistic Rebuttal Children's Edition, and incorporated into a Mural Arts Program mural!

Artistic Rebuttal is once again partnering with Mighty Writers, but this time to create our OWN children's book about the importance and power of the arts: a story WRITTEN BY MIGHTY WRITERS about three friends who use art to overcome death, bullying and identity. All characters and plot lines come straight from the kids themselves and are beautifully seamed together by Rachel Loeper, Mighty Writers' Education Director.

To celebrate the opening of the new bilingual Mighty Writers South Philly location, we will produce a Spanish version of the book, expanding our audience!

Our goal is for this book use it as an art & youth education/literacy advocacy tool to benefit the youth of Philadelphia in a time of overwhelming budget cuts in public schools and therefore the lack of meaningful expression in school settings. We strive to spread the written word about the transformative, collective good of creative practices, especially in youth who have a lot to say about their worlds but who are, more often than not, tuned out. 


What We Need & What You Get

For our goal of $2,300 we plan to:

  • Fairly compensate each Mighty Writer who contributed to the book
  • Fairly compensate ourselves for writing, illustrating, and designing the book
  • Purchase 50 copies of the finished book to distribute to Mighty Writers who contributed to the plot and distribute it for free around the city to arts and/or education advocacy organizations/individuals
  • Add the book to Lulu.com where you can buy it on demand as a physical book or PDF
  • Supply all perks to those who donate!


The Impact

Your contribution will not only help us make books, it will also assist in

  • Our regional and state-wide art and education advocacy efforts
  • Getting middle-school-aged writers published, some for the first time!
  • Possibly getting a publishing deal (that's the dream!)


Risks & Challenges

It's been a challenge piecing together one cohesive story from a dozen stories from the MOST imaginative kids we've ever seen, but we think we've written a winner here. It's both funny and heart-wrenching - we can't wait for you to have a copy of your own!


Other Ways You Can Help

We know some people just can't contribute monetarily, so if you're willing, you can help out by asking folks in your networks to get the word out and make some noise about Artistic Rebuttal's First Children's Book!

You can friend us on Facebook and share posts @Artistic Rebuttal Book Project

You can follow us on Twitter and retweet/share thoughts @ArtistRebuttal

You can follow our Instagram and see pics of the illustration process! @ArtisticRebuttal

You can email us with any contacts or resources you think would be interested in hosting a reading of the book, or any other interactive activity: artisticrebuttal@gmail.com

story:
Hi! I am a freelance fashion illustrator currently juggling a full time job in a finance office with my freelance illustration work.

Until recently I have worked mainly on private commissions to friend and family. I also sell work online via New Blood Art. However sales are sporadic and because I still work full time I don't have enough time to produce work fast enough to sell regularly.

I was very lucky recently to be featured in Aesthetica Magazine and as a result, have been invited to show at the Global Art Agency's Miami Expo in June. I am over the moon to be invited but it’s going to be quite a chunk of money to ship work and try to get there by myself.

This is an amazing opportunity for me to further my career and maybe get one step closer to my dream of illustrating full-time; I am looking for support towards the cost of getting myself and my artwork there.

The exhibition is a perfect platform for me to meet other artists, galleries, art collectors and sponsors. Something I normally wouldn't be able to do. I am sure that this could be a big break for me and would be so thankful for any support.

If you can't sponsor me, but like my work please check out my pages below, and share. All support is most welcome! 

If I didn’t make my target, I would like you all to know that the funds I did raise would go towards sending my artwork to the exhibition by themselves, and anything extra would go towards producing more work and towards publicising my work further.

please have a look at my work:

www.reilly-cooperillustration.tumblr.com

www.newbloodart.com

www.facebook.com/trcillustration

www.twitter.com@treasbeesknees

story:
Introduction!

Hello!

My name is Morgan Bath, I am a recent graduate of the Art Studio BFA program. I am a 4th generation Canadian and due to a lack of income I have seen very little of my great country, because of this fact I have been planning and working towards a coast to coast road trip! This dream of mine has become a reality with the help of a small grant I received from the Roloff Beny Photography foundation. I have saved and raised just enough to make it coast to coast with very little wiggle room if I stop here and there to work small jobs along the way. 

This campaign is to raise money so I can make it to the territories as well.  This trip is about experiencing the Canadian landscape and producing artwork in response to that. I'm not going to lie either.... I am also pretty excited to camp all summer! I will be visiting all the major city centres across Canada as well as any little places that look interesting along the way.


What I Need & What You Get

If my funding goal is reached I will be able to :

           -  Make it to the Canadian territories

          -  Set up mentorships with senior artist and/or makers to further my                                  knowledge and Artistic practice

          -  Eat more than protein powder and cheap canned things

          -  Spend time in areas of inspiration to create artworks instead of having to                      stick to a very strict schedule in order to be able to make it home

          -  Explore artistic city centres across Canada for more then one day

          -  Afford to pay for ferries to islands along the coasts (such as Newfoundland &              Labrador) 

Even if I don't reach my entire goal I will be using the funding exactly for what the perk says I will! Well I may by a tea instead of coffee but other than that. It would be WONDERFUL to reach my funding goal but anything and everything will help so much. 

I'm an avid journal writer and I'm sure with the lack of company on this trip my writing will be at an all time high! So most if not all of my perks come with a handwritten (or I may use my typewriter) letter. This will most likely include rambling of non sense of funny or embarrassing mishaps of the journey.... which I can guarantee there will be a lot of (there is a reason my last solo show was titled "I Wish I Was A Little More Delicate" ha!). Accompanying these will be an array of thing such as small collect objects, souvenirs, drawings, prints, zines, journals, art pieces, instant photographs and handmade paper!  

If you have a special request just contact me and I'm sure we can work something out! I'm very flexible! 


The Impact

I have  been trying to pull together a trip like this for a few years now. I think it is so important as a Canadian Artist to really indulge in your country and understand where you come from before you can build off it. I am so very excited to have this opportunity to do just that! Any and all support that I can receive is a wonderful addition and really fuels my passion for my work and my journey! 

On that note! I will be creating a blog/timeline of my entire journey from coast to coast!! If you are interested or just want to look through more examples of my work please do not hesitate to check out my website! 

www.morganbath.wix.com/morganbath


Risks & Challenges

Within this project the only real obstacles I have faced has been of a finical nature. I have worked very hard to get the amount of money I have now but it is just enough to get by. This campaign is to take what will already be a wonderful experience and really turn it into a less stressful one. I can't thank you for your support enough for this. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help fund but are interested about my project please please please spread the word!! E-mail, Facebook, Twitter use any of the indiegogo sharing tools or copy and paste the old fashion way! 

If you would like to help in other ways please get in contact with me! I would love to know "Must see" places across Canada! 

Most of all if you know an Artist or a Maker that would be willing to do a mentorship with me in exchange for work or for a money (depending on my funding) please let me know!! I'm interested in many different fields such as:

          -  Printmakers

          -  Paper makers

          -  Weavers

          -  Fishing net makers

          -  Sound Artists

          -  Installation Artists

          -  Sculptors

          -  Book makers

          -  Textile Artists

          -  Artists working with found and natural materials

          -  Artists or Makers that would with natural dyes

My website is  www.morganbath.wix.com/morganbath if you can think of any others that would help me along in my practice don't hesitate to point me in the right direction!! 

Thank you so much for taking the time to read over my campaign.

story:
We have created an adult children's book, which will have photography and illustrations and writing.

It's a horror-tale about a group of deer who encounter a hunter.

The plot is fairytale/fantasy/ horror.

The deer seek revenge on the Hunter.

We have already photographed the book,now we need the founding to self publish the book and have a gallery book release which will be an open house and an art show.

story:
Please scroll down for the english text! 

Ein Schiff wird kommen…?! Spenden dringend benötigt!
Wie aus einer verrückten Idee Wirklichkeit werden kann…

Im Treptower Hafen in Berlin liegt seit einigen Jahren der zur schwimmenden Jugendbildungsstätte umgebaute Finow-Maßkahn „Horst-Günther“. 28 Schlafplätze, Duschen, Toiletten, eine voll ausgestattete Küche, ein großzügiger Aufenthaltsraum – und ein Deck, auf dem man verschiedenste Aktionen starten kann…

Mit einer Kindergruppe waren wir vor einigen Jahren erstmals auf diesem tollen Schiff – und wir haben uns sofort verliebt. Aus der verrückten Idee, das Schiff zu kaufen und in unserem Sinn zu betreiben, ist nun tatsächlich Realität geworden.

Nun haben sieben Potsdamer einen Verein gegründet, den „Horst-Günther Jugendbegegnungsstätte e.V.“ . Anfang Mai haben wir das Jugendbildungsschiff übernommen – und es steht bereit für Kinder- und Jugendgruppen, Klassen- und Kursfahrten, Gemeindegruppen, aber auch für GKR-Freizeiten, Probenwochenenden, Schüler- und Besuchsgruppen aus anderen Ländern, Familienfeste und so weiter, die in Berlin Übernachtungsmöglichkeiten suchen.

Auch für viele andere Ideen und Visionen sind wir offen.

Wir sind zu finden unter: www.hgdasschiff.de

Dort sind auch mehr Fotos und die genauere Beschreibung zu finden.


Weitere Informationen, Buchungsanfragen und gern auch Nutzungsideen und Verbesserungsvorschläge an tileman.wiarda@gmx.de oder hartmutnocke@me.com

Wir laden ein, für 30 € im Jahr Fördermitglied im Verein zu werden.

Mit der Mitgliedschaft können Sie die Vereinsarbeit langfristig absichern.

Unser Konzept sieht vor, dass mittel bis langfristig auf dem Schiff erlebnispädagogische Angebote und Kinder- und Jugendfreizeiten durch unseren Verein angeboten werden.

Der Kaufpreis für das Schiff, den wir in fünf Raten bezahlen können, beträgt 100.000 €.  Die erste Rate von 20.000 € konnte bereits überwiesen werden. Vielen Dank an unsere Unterstützer!

Für die nächste Rate brauchen wir nun weitere Hilfe. Jede Spende ist willkommen, egal, wie groß oder klein!

Uns hilft ebenfalls, wenn die Welt von uns erfährt. Deshalb: Bitte kräftig weiterleiten, werben, und: ünterstützen!


A ship is approaching - we need your support!

There is a ship at the small mid-town harbour Berlin-Treptow.

It`s the Horst-Günther, a steel-barge.

It was built to carry heavy load like sand, coal etc. into the growing town of Berlin.

Then it was coverted to a swimming youth-hostel, with 28 beds, showers, toilets, complete kitchen, a spacious room for activities, heating for winter and a flat deck on top.

We went there with groups of children from our parish.

And then:

We decided to run this ship ourselves. We incorporated an association and bought the ship to open it for various groups, children and young people, schoolclasses, choirs, retreats,  family celebrations, parish groups from near and far away etc..

In the future, we additionally will offer christian-based experiental education, as we do it already in our parishes.

You find more informations at www.hgdasschiff.de

You can contact us for further questions, ideas, booking etc.:

hartmutnocke@me.com

tilemanwiarda@gmx.de

both pastors of the Christian Church EKBO

We ask for your kindly support:

you can be a member of our association for 30€/year

you can use the perks we offer

you can send a sum of your choice.

We have to pay the ship in 5 rates of 20.000€/year.

We payed the first rate already, and now we need further support.

Thank you.
story_txt:
Please scroll down for the english text! 
Ein Schiff wird kommen…?! Spenden dringend benötigt!
Wie aus einer verrückten Idee Wirklichkeit werden kann…
Im Treptower Hafen in Berlin liegt seit einigen Jahren der zur 
schwimmenden Jugendbildungsstätte umgebaute Finow-Maßkahn 
„Horst-Günther“. 28 Schlafplätze, Duschen, Toiletten, eine voll 
ausgestattete Küche, ein großzügiger Aufenthaltsraum – und ein Deck, auf
 dem man verschiedenste Aktionen starten kann…
Mit einer Kindergruppe waren wir vor einigen Jahren erstmals auf 
diesem tollen Schiff – und wir haben uns sofort verliebt. Aus der 
verrückten Idee, das Schiff zu kaufen und in unserem Sinn zu betreiben, 
ist nun tatsächlich Realität geworden. 
Nun haben sieben 
Potsdamer einen Verein gegründet, den „Horst-Günther 
Jugendbegegnungsstätte e.V.“ . Anfang Mai haben wir das 
Jugendbildungsschiff übernommen – und es steht bereit für Kinder- 
und Jugendgruppen, Klassen- und Kursfahrten, Gemeindegruppen, 
aber auch
für GKR-Freizeiten, Probenwochenenden, Schüler- und Besuchsgruppen aus anderen
Ländern, Familienfeste und so weiter, die in Berlin Übernachtungsmöglichkeiten
 suchen.
 Auch für viele andere Ideen und Visionen sind wir offen.
Wir sind zu finden unter: www.hgdasschiff.de
Dort sind auch mehr Fotos und die genauere Beschreibung zu finden.


Weitere Informationen, Buchungsanfragen
und gern auch Nutzungsideen und Verbesserungsvorschläge an tileman.wiarda@gmx.de oder hartmutnocke@me.com
Wir laden ein, für 30 € im
Jahr Fördermitglied im Verein zu werden.
Mit der Mitgliedschaft
können Sie die Vereinsarbeit langfristig absichern.Unser Konzept sieht vor, dass mittel bis langfristig auf dem Schiff 
erlebnispädagogische Angebote und Kinder- und Jugendfreizeiten durch 
unseren Verein angeboten werden.

 fünf Raten bezahlen können, beträgt 100.000 €.  Die erste Rate von

Unterstützer!

story:
Each of us is a singular narrative, which is constructed, continually, unconsciously, by, through, and in us―through our perceptions, our feelings, our thoughts, our actions; and, not least, our discourse, our spoken narrations. Biologically, physiologically, we are not so different from each other; historically, as narratives―we are each of us unique.  ― Oliver Sacks, The Man Who Mistook His Wife for a Hat and Other Clinical Tales

What is your story? What is our collective story? What does it mean to be part of―and contribute to―the multitude of experience that comprises the human condition? These are the questions Cara Levine and Arianne Gelardin, curators of Indigo Mind, have asked while developing an inspiring exhibition that explores and celebrates the pioneering work of neurologist Dr. Oliver Sacks.


What is Indigo Mind?

Indigo Mind is an ambitious group exhibition celebrating the work of neurologist Dr. Oliver Sacks. Opening September 26, 2015 at StoreFrontLab in San Francisco’s Mission District, the project features artists who explore a range of brain and body phenomena examined in Sacks’ research. These works present the influence Sacks has had on our understanding of the human condition in its limitless variation and form. Indigo Mind highlights distinct physical and neurological states, named after various publications written by Sacks: A Leg to Stand On, The Mind’s Eye, Seeing Voices, Hallucinations, An Anthropologist on Mars, and Migraine. Each week’s focus will feature artists working within these distinctions, inviting the public to engage in activities that shed light onto these unique experiences. 

This project has been received with such open arms by the San Francisco Bay Area community and friends and followers of Dr. Sacks that it has grown into a celebration of great proportion. We are seeking lead sponsorship from organizations that align with our mission to connect the arts and disability communities, as well as support on any level from individuals who simply want to honor the impact Dr. Sacks has made through his work on the fields of creative, fine, and the performing arts. We welcome and are grateful for any help that you can offer.

*This exhibition is being mounted to honor the work of Dr. Sacks. Dr. Sacks has no direct role in the exhibition itself.  


Cara Levine is a San Francisco Bay Area-based artist. She explores the intersections of the physical, metaphysical, traumatic and illusionary through video, photography and sculpture. Her work explores the effects chronic pain, namely chronic migraine has on her experience in the world. She is humbled and honored to be co-curating this show in celebration of her lifelong literary hero, Dr. Oliver Sacks.

Arianne Gelardin is a San Francisco-based artist and curator. She works to dress the mundane with colorful moments and thoughtful interruptions, breaking us free from habitual attitudes and auto-responses. Arianne is Curator at StoreFrontLab, a community space for ideas and dialogue. The writings of Dr. Oliver Sacks has deeply influenced Arianne's work as she explores what it means to be fully human amidst a tide of ever changing realities. 


What We Need?

We need you! We are looking to raise $15,000 by September 13, 2015. Ambitious, indeed, but with your help, we can do it! $15,000 will enable us to support the following:

-Travel expenses for artist Emilie Gossiaux to host a public Dinner and lecture / performance presenting her Brainport technology.

-Travel expenses for David Bufano, brother of the artist the late Lisa Bufano. David will speak on her behalf about how his sister overcame illness through dance and art. 

-Workshops all over the Bay Area which engage in disability and creativity focussing on the color and feeling of Indigo: an Indigo dye bath, a beach walk and water color session, and a meditation in the gallery 

NOT TO MENTION:

-Material and installation

-Event and marketing

-Rental fees

-Artist travel 

-Artwork shipping

While we are setting our funding goal at $15,000, it will be flexible. This is not an all-or-nothing campaign. $15,000 is what we need to realize the project as we envision it, but should we fall short, the show will go on. We will humbly and gratefully use what we have available to communicate to the public the incredible influence Dr. Sacks has had on the arts and disability communities.


The Impact

We are tapping into a collective story, a collective consciousness, through art, through interpretation, metaphor and performance in order to expand and express fully what it means to be human, physically, mentally and emotionally, as a shared experience. We are teaming up with the Disability Visibility Project (StoryCorps), to archive our artists stories and let their voices be heard far and wide. We have partnered with the Exploratorium, uncovering past exhibitions that Dr. Sacks had direct involvement with. We are also partnered with the Disability Unity Festival, held this year at San Francisco City Hall, to celebrate the community’s strength, and the special 25-year anniversary of ADA (Americans with Disabilities Act, 1990).


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to make a donation, but would still like to support us, you can do so by SHARING this campaign with EVERYONE YOU KNOW! Email, phone calls, Twitter, Instagram, Facebook land, text messages, hand written letters, flyers, your neighbors — We are grateful for any support you can give us.  


Thank you!


Indigo Mind Team

#indigomind

#indigomindexhibition

@indigo_mind_exhibition

link to this campaign - http://igg.me/at/9Ag2BiOPAkA/x/11716163


Artists
Adrienne Adar, Sherrie Aradanas, Miguel Arzabe, AXIS Dance, Alexandria Bell, Michelle Blade, Rebeca Bollinger, Alice Bonczkowski, Terri Bowden, Lisa Bufano, Casey Byrnes, Amy Cranch, James Davis, Gina Damerell, Arianne Gelardin, Sonsheree Giles, Emilie Gossiaux, Casey Gray, Lauren Hartman, Kathleen Henderson, Desiree Holman, Jennifer Justice, Lynn Marie Kirby, Petra Kuppers and Olimpias, Dohee Lee, Cara Levine, Neil Marcus, Paulino Martin, Anna Mayer, Ali Nashke-Messing, Alison O'Daniel, Jacob Palmer, David Parsons, Carlos Perez, James Pitt, Carissa Potter, Rowland Ricketts, Tamra Seal, Katherine Sherwood, Cassie Thornton, Valerie Tribble, William Tyler, Monica Valentine, Merrit Wallace, Amber Jean Young

Collaborators
Alice Wong, Disability Visibility Project (a community partnership with StoryCorps); Amy Cranch, Anna Halprin's Advanced Performance Lab; Case for Making; Creative Growth Art Center; Disability Unity Festival at San Francisco City Hall; Susan Schwartzenberg, Senior Artist and Curator, Exploratorium

story:
Short Summary

Hello, I am Anny and I am from Greece, Athens. I have been painting since I was 4 and I have kept doing so till now. I studied Arts at Brighton, England and I have participated in many art exhibitions in Greece and in Europe. I also do ceramics and have won many awards for my creations. 
I am starting this campaign because I thought it would be nice for you to have a customized and personalized zodiac painting, of yourself, your loved one, your relatives, your friends or even your pet! 
You will help me create some art that is quite rare to find and I am sure you'll love it!

The idea behind this project
Some years ago, when first started making these paintings, some people asked me if I can make a personalized zodiac sign painting instead of common ones. 
The following are examples of my work. Note that they are old sample paintings for customers that I have kept in my basement.
For example, a father who was taking care a lot of his kids, was a Gemini. So I made a male figure holding  two babies. It is showing that he is a father of two while also meaning his zodiac sign is a Gemini.


Another example, is of an owner of a grocery store. His sign is Libra. So I painted a man, dressed up as a grocery store owner holding a scale. Also, the sign name is painted on the right in Greek letters. But of course it can also be written in English or any other language.


You can check more pictures in the campaign gallery!

All paintings will be created on marine plywood which is very strong and durable. After many years of trying different types of wood, I found this to be the best. Water does not affect it and it is very very strong. The type of plywood that I will use is BS 1088 (British Standard,  Lloyd's Register). The paint that will be used will by acrylic. The final product will be coated with a transparent matte spray for durability of the color.
There are 3 sizes for you to choose from when buying a perk, so decide well! Sizes  are approximated. The deviation will be marginal.
  1. 19cm x 13cm (7.4 inches x 5.11 inches)
  2. 25cm x 18cm (9.84 inches x 7.08 inches)
  3. 30cm x 20cm (11.8 inches x 7.87 inches)

Funding

The funding that I will receive will go for my raw materials like wood, paint, brushes and other art stuff needed. Also some of the money will help me take care of the the stray cats that find refuge in my yard and I take care of them. And of course my adopted dog from the shelter. 
Don't worry, if my goal is not reached, you will still get your own personalized zodiac sign painting! 

Custom Orders

When you buy a perk, you can contact me and give me hints about your self so that I can create something that applies to you or your loved one. For example, type of job, color of eyes, hair, build, etc. It can be anything. These hints will help me create something special for you.
Note that you have also have to tell me:
  • Size of painting purchased (just to double check)
  • In what language you want the sign to be written
  • How the sign is spelled in your language
  • If you don't want the sing to be written or if you want your name. Your name can also be written with the Greek alphabet.
Note that the date on the estimated delivery is approximated. I will start working as soon as possible and I will work in the same order that the funding was received. Of course, I will keep each one of you posted about the progress of the painting!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot buy a perk, you can still help by spreading this project in any way that is easy for you. It can be Facebook, an e-mail, a chat with a friend or try asking your cat or dog if he/she wants a painting!

And that's all there is to it.


Thank you for seeing my project page!

story:
Rendezvous is a gathering place;  a Carnival Nouveau influenced sculpture which provides the stage for planned and chance meetings alike.  Functioning as a dynamic backdrop for intimate romantic engagements, impromptu performances and sacred ceremonies, Rendezvous provides an environment for your most memorable encounters.  Consisting of five ornate CNC cut panels, it creates a dynamic wall of changing light that is 13' wide and 8' tall. By day, visitors will be able to relax on the base, in the comfort of the intricate shade cast by the panels.  At night, Rendezvous will come to life with a mosaic of light, creating an inviting scene of color and ambiance.  


About the artists

   After meeting at Burning Man in 2009, the team of Ruby Bettencourt and Jeff Howe quickly discovered that they shared not only a common desire to create, but also a similar sense of aesthetics and intentions.  Ruby's experience as a jewelry and fashion designer and Jeff's background as an architect come together when they create art for Burning Man.  Meeting in the middle between large buildings and human scale fashion,  they create medium sized sculptural projects as well as custom jewelry.  

Exciting news!!! 

Ruby and Jeff's medallions were just featured in the new book titled, 

The Jewelry of Burning Man  

This beautiful book showcases the history of jewelry on The Playa while sharing stories about the art of gifting.  This remarkable collection of images and writing is available for purchase on the Burning Man website at 

https://marketplace.burningman.com/product/jewelry-of-burning-man/


From Ruby and Jeff -

We both embrace the philosophy,

Dream Big and Follow Your Dreams

As this has become a tradition, our dreams are bigger than our budgets. 

This year we are celebrating Ruby's 20th consecutive year at Burning Man.  We need your support to manifest our vision, and to commemorate her 20th dance around the man. 

To make a large wood sculpture for Burning Man 2015, we are again turning to the community for support.  

To help finance the creation of Rendezvous, we have created an exquisite medallion based on aspects of the sculpture.   As perks for your generous donations we are offering numerous medallion packages and if you want to share in the experience of giving, we are now offering Gift Giver Sets.  With these jewelry packagesyou may share in the pleasure of GIFTING them year round to friends.

 The Rendezvous Medallion 2015

We need to meet our goal before the event so we can afford the transportation of the finished sculpture.  If it wasn't for the last minute, there wouldn't be a Burning Man.  For your generous contributions we will be shipping medallions as soon as we can.

These collectible jewelry pieces are a considerable investment in time and material for us, requiring almost as much labor as our sculptures themselves.  We do this because we love it, and we are counting on you all to make our dreams possible.

Be sure to check out our website which showcases some of our work together at

http://steellovedesign.com

  

A number of our previous sculptures and some of our other medallions are available for purchase.  Please contact us directly if you are interested in any of the items you see on the site.  All of the proceeds from Steel Love Design funnel directly back into creating more art.

Your generous donations will help to keep the momentum of our creative dance and foster our ability to inspire others through art.  We hope that with your help we can offset some of the cost of materials, transportation, and tooling required for us to continue following our dreams.

Some of the items that your donations will help provide include:

Structural and Finish Wood

Steel

LED Lighting

CNC Router Table Use

Plasma cutting and welding consumables

Rented workshop space

Rental of a truck and trailer to transport Rendezvous to and from Burning Man 2015

After you have made your contribution please tell your friends, family, campmates, and cohorts about this exciting new sculpture.  Please share this on your facebook or twitter. Every repost or share helps us move up the ranking system which helps to gain more public exposure.

aesthetics and intentions.  Ruby's experience as a jewelry and fashion designer and Jeff's background as an architect come together when they create art for Burning Man.  Meeting in the middle between large buildings and human scale fashion,  they create medium sized sculptural projects as well as custom jewelry.  Exciting news!!! Ruby and Jeff's medallions were just featured in the new book titled, The Jewelry of Burning Man  This beautiful book showcases the history of jewelry on The Playa while sharing stories about the art of gifting.  This remarkable collection of images and writing is available for purchase on the Burning Man website at https://marketplace.burningman.com/product/jewelry-of-burning-man/From Ruby and Jeff -We both embrace the philosophy,Dream Big and Follow Your DreamsAs this has become a tradition, our dreams are bigger than our budgets. This year we are celebrating Ruby's 20th consecutive year at Burning Man.  We need your support to manifest our vision, and to commemorate her 20th dance around the man. To make a large wood sculpture for Burning Man 2015, we are again turning to the community for support.  To help finance the creation of Rendezvous, we have created an exquisite medallion based on aspects of the sculpture.   As perks for your generous donations we are offering numerous medallion packages and if you want to share in the experience of giving, we are now offering Gift Giver Sets.  With these jewelry packagesyou may share in the pleasure of GIFTING them year round to friends. The Rendezvous Medallion 2015We need to meet our goal before the event so we can afford the transportation of the finished sculpture.  If it wasn't for the last minute, there wouldn't be a Burning Man.  For your generous contributions we will be shipping medallions as soon as we can.These collectible jewelry pieces are a considerable investment in time and material for us, requiring almost as much labor as our sculptures themselves.  We do this because we love it, and we are counting on you all to make our dreams possible.Be sure to check out our website which showcases some of our work together athttp://steellovedesign.com  A number of our previous sculptures and some of our other medallions are available for purchase.  Please contact us directly if you are interested in any of the items you see on the site.  All of the proceeds from Steel Love Design funnel directly back into creating more art.Your generous donations will help to keep the momentum of our creative dance and foster our ability to inspire others through art.  We hope that with your help we can offset some of the cost of materials, transportation, and tooling required for us to continue following our dreams.Some of the items that your donations will help provide include:Structural and Finish WoodSteelLED LightingCNC Router Table UsePlasma cutting and welding consumablesRented workshop spaceRental of a truck and trailer to transport Rendezvous to and from Burning Man 2015After you have made your contribution please tell your friends, family, campmates, and cohorts about this exciting new sculpture.  Please share this on your facebook or twitter. Every repost or share helps us move up the ranking system which helps to gain more public exposure.

story: 0

THE WAR PIGS & DADDY WAR BUS

Who are The War Pigs you ask? Well.. it's not a long story, but an unfortunate one. We are the remnants of a by gone ideal. Law. There isn't any anymore, and we are the scraps and scabs of it. We are what is left of the MFP, the law enforcement of a world left smoldering.

When Civi fell apart and hemorrhaged, people went crazy. The law abiding became savages and the scaggs became worse. Max left with The Interceptor, berzerker just disappeared. March Hare became someone we couldn't recognize. We were left stunned, holding the bag of a now despised position. We were hunted and attacked. 

There was no more protocol, no structure, no law. We grabbed what we could. Our families (if still alive), a forgotten MFP transport bus, and all the supplies and gear the halls held. We barricaded ourselves in The Halls of Justice. Used the motor pool to build our "DADDY WAR BUS" and outfit and supply it with all we could vulture from the hall. Screw Mandate 11! We grabbed every single confiscated weapon the lock up held. We emptied every ammo bunker we could find.

We protected them for so long, we served them for so long. And now when it all falls apart we are the criminals! They called us bronze, they called us fuzz, they called us PIGS! Well, it is war after all and war we shall bring. WAR PIGS WE ARE!! We serve only ourselves and our tribe. We protect only ourselves and our tribe. Our bronze shields shall now carry fear to all who see them. Scaggs beware...the Pigs are coming!

What We Need & What You Get

  • The War Pigs need your help! We have purchased a 1997 Blue Bird flat nose school bus. We've put new brakes on, checked the engine, put a battery in and are diving head first into the conversion project: DADDY WAR BUS, a Post-Apocalyptic War Rig 'RV'!
  • The exterior of Daddy War Bus needs a kick ass paint job and will be decked out with offensive weapons along with a multitude of defensive add-ons, which we will be mostly making and modifying ourselves. We've been scavenging tons of parts to achieve this goal. But, we need more, more, more!
  • The interior of Daddy War Bus will be a "Road Warrior" armored motor home for eight or so survivors. It will be a post-apocalyptic RV, of sorts. We need to build seating, a galley, a head, gunner's positions, and sleeping bunks for eight.
  • Daddy War Bus will also house a generator, water tanks, and will don some fine nose art from local artists. We're very lucky to know a lot of creative people!
  • This project is turning out to be more expensive than we hoped. This is where you enter the picture. We need your help to fund our project and get us to Wasteland Weekend (www.WastelandWeekend.com), the Road Warrior-esque festival held each fall in the Mojave Desert.
  • Friends, Family, and other concerned Souls who wish to enter Valhalla, Shiny and Chrome! We have a slew of great perks for those who make a contribution, from War Pigs swag to actually joining The War Pigs on Daddy War Bus to Wasteland Weekend!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not in a position to make a contribution, you can help us other ways:

  • You can donate materials and components to Daddy War Bus.
  • You can help get the word out by sharing our campaign on social media and by word of mouth. Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • You can get your hands dirty and help us build a War Bus!

And that's all there is to it.

Daddy War Bus will also house a generator, water tanks, and will don some fine nose art from local artists. We're very lucky to know a lot of creative people!

This project is turning out to be more expensive than we hoped. This is where you enter the picture. We need your help to fund our project and get us to Wasteland Weekend (www.WastelandWeekend.com), the Road Warrior-esque festival held each fall in the Mojave Desert.

Friends, Family, and other concerned Souls who wish to enter Valhalla, Shiny and Chrome! We have a slew of great perks for those who make a contribution, from War Pigs swag to actually joining The War Pigs on Daddy War Bus to Wasteland Weekend!

You can get your hands dirty and help us build a War Bus!
   And that's all there is to it.

story:
"This isn't just an art show about a 1980s crisis - it's a show about the human condition framed through the lens of AIDS, and anyone who cares about humanity needs to see it."  
−Rosemary Ponnekanti, The Olympian

Thank You!

We truly appreciate all the support we have received for this campaign. We were able to raise nearly $14,000 both through this site and through offline donations. Your contributions will go a long way toward helping Art AIDS America travel to museums across America: to the Zuckerman Museum of Art near Atlanta this spring, to The Bronx Museum of the Arts in New York this summer, and to Chicago at the end of 2016--stay tuned until we can reveal the name of that location!


+About Art AIDS America

Tacoma Art Museum proudly presents Art AIDS America, a groundbreaking exhibition that reveals, for the first time, how the AIDS epidemic indelibly changed American art, beginning in the 1980s. The exhibition provides a framework to honor our collective loss, and rightfully recognizes the creative community that galvanized to ignite social and political change. It reminds us that the crisis continues, and explains how the HIV legacy still influences artists today.


“Art AIDS America is an epic and national treasure.”

−Jen Graves, The Stranger 

Help TAM raise funds forArt AIDS America to travel!  By taking up this cause, you send a signal that challenging, richly layered exhibitions are a vital part of our national dialogue. Your contribution helps to cover exhibition, programming, and traveling costs. Help us bring this experience to others around the United States.


Through a whopping 127 works in a wide range of media and spanning 30+ years, visitors see how artists transformed pain and loss into activism, expressions of beauty, and portrayals of personal experience. Learn their stories of resilience, hope, and progress. The works represent diverse artists including the internationally acclaimed (Keith Haring, Robert Mapplethorpe, Annie Leibovitz, and more), those whose careers were tragically cut short by AIDS, and contemporary artists working today. 


See additional video updates in the Video Gallery, and visit the Tacoma Art Museum website for an in-depth look at the art and artists in Art AIDS America.


+Perks

+Critical Acclaim

 

“The Art AIDS America exhibition is not to be missed. In fact, it’s one for the history books.”

−Trenton Straube, POZ Magazine 


“Memorable masterpieces, fresh perspectives, tragedy, hope, progress, and milestones both unsettling and inspirational are the order of the day in this exhibition that is ostensibly about how the AIDS crisis changed society -- but is really about how art can change the world.” 

−Shana Nys Dambrot, Huff Post Arts & Culture 


 “Uncomfortable, wistfully beautiful, and vitally important…”

–Christopher Harrity, Advocate.com  


“The early epicenter of the U.S. AIDS epidemic was white and gay neighborhoods in San Francisco and New York. Today those hardest his are largely black, Latino, poor... If many Americans are lulled into thinking HIV/AIDS has gone away, it’s because the people most affected are largely invisible to them – just like members of the lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender community had been at the pandemic’s beginning.”

−Mary Engel, Fred Hutch News Service


"Art AIDS America...looks at how AIDS inserted itself into the art world's conversation, leading to some personal, local, and activist works. At the time, popular art wasn't all that biographical--consider Andy Warhol's screen-printed homages to consumerism, or Jackson Pollock's abstracted paintings. AIDS changed that. It spurred artists to use the medium to tell the world about their crisis." 

−Margaret Rhodes, WIRED


“...Art AIDS America may be the most important, historically salient, stylistically diverse, and politically inspirational of them all.” 

−Shana Nys Dambrot, Huff Post Arts & Culture 


“Hushka and Katz argue that AIDS changed the very nature of art-making in the ‘80s. The urgency of the experience took priority over debates about art-world ‘isms.’ Practice outweighed theory.”

−Michael Upchurch, Seattle Times 

+Other Ways to Help

Help us spread the word! Share #ArtAIDSAmerica on social media, tune into our Facebook and Twitter feeds, and tell your friends about the campaign!

+Thank You

We greatly appreciate your support. Thanks to you, Tacoma Art Museum is able to continue our mission of connecting people through art. 
 

+Frequently Asked Questions

 

Q: Who is curating this exhibition?

A: We have expertise and pioneering scholarship around this subject through our Chief Curator Rock Hushka and long-standing relationship with curator and scholar Jonathan David Katz, PhD. The co-curators have worked for more than 10 years to bring this exhibition to fruition. They formerly worked together on the award-winning exhibition Hide/Seek: Difference and Desire in American Portraiture. 

 

Q: Who are some of the prominent artists in the exhibition?

A: Some widely recognized names are Gran Fury, Robert Gober, Felix Gonzales-Torres, Keith Haring, Jasper Johns, Annie Leibovitz, and Robert Mapplethorpe. Other names you may recognize are Mark Chester, Sue Coe, Chloe Dzublio, Karen Finley, Jim Hodges, Jenny Holzer, Peter Hujar, Bill Jacobson, Ann P. Meredith, Mark Morrisroe, Catherine Opie, Alon Reininger, Andres Serrano, Carl Tandatnick, Julie Tolentino, David Wojnarowicz, and many more.

Q: Why does the exhibition include contemporary pieces? Didn’t the epidemic end in the early 1990s?

A: HIV/AIDS is still here. The "AIDS cocktail" (or HAART, Highly Active Antiretroviral Therapy) became available in the 1994 as a treatment for the disease, but there is no known cure. A shocking 1.2-million Americans are living with HIV and approximately every 10 minutes, another American becomes infected.

Art AIDS America explores how the creative community reacted in the early days of the epidemic, shifting American art toward a more autobiographical voice. It also explains that just as HIV/AIDS are still with us, artists today continue to reference the epidemic in their work.

 

Q: Is the exhibition traveling to any other locations?

A: Yes! After the exhibition wraps up at Tacoma Art Museum on January 10, 2016, it will travel to Zuckerman Museum of Art, Kennesaw State University, GA, from February 20 - May 22, 2016, and then to The Bronx Museum of the Arts, NY, from June 23 - September 11, 2016. We hope to add a surprise new location in Chicago at the end of 2016!

 

Q: Can I donate offline?

A: Yes! Offline gifts may be mailed or taken over the phone. Send to:

Development Department
Tacoma Art Museum
1701 Pacific Avenue
Tacoma, WA 98402 
 
Or call 253-722-2465

Q: What happens if TAM doesn’t raise all the money or exceeds the goal?

A: We will put all funds we receive towards the exhibition.

+Perk Questions

 

Q: When will I receive my perks?

A: Perks will be mailed in December after the end of the campaign. We will notify you if there are any delays.

Q: How do I tell you what t-shirt size I want?

A: When the campaign comes to an end, we will send you an email. Please reply with your t-shirt size and style preferences.

Q: How much is shipping? What if I’m an international donor?
A: Shipping is a flat rate of $5 for domestic orders and $8 for international orders, with two exceptions: the Art AIDS America Poster and "Gran" Swag Package.

Q: What if one of the perks I want is sold out?

A: Due to the special, limited-edition nature of the perks, we have a finite number of each item. Make sure to get yours today by contributing now!

story:
Short Summary

Hi everyone. My name is Alli Winot and I am the creator of the Nocens world. I am a senior at Hanover College with a major in English and a part of Hanover's Business Scholar Program. Between my junior and senior year I was required by the BSP program to do a project-based internship and this art book is the end-point of it. This is an art book drawn by illustrator and internship sponsor Kathryn Silver illustrating the world that my novel, Project Nocens, takes place in. Inside of the art book will (surprisingly) be art and also will include short stories that take place in the world of the Nocens. The book will provide as a guide book or prequel-esque to the universe before the novels themselves. 

Now, the question I'm sure you're asking is: what is the novel series about? Plainly said: superheroes. The Nocens Saga is about a wealthy business man name Xavier Zachariah who has built the city up to the highest point it can be, only to destroy it simply because he can. His history of crimes is long, but mostly hidden, but it all goes back to a girl named Robin Windsor. Robin went missing at the end of her freshman year of college and her roommate has been trying to figure out what happened to her ever since and everything points of Xavier. Everything. 

In addition to the art book we are also offering you the first issue of the Nocens Saga's first comic book called the Children. It's about a girl named Nora who begins to investigate what is going on with her friend and everything isn't as innocent as she may hope. The comic takes place after the first novel, but don't worry there aren't any huge spoilers. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • 500 dollars has been budgeted for the printing of 50 books, however because we are including more than just the books themselves we are aiming for the goal of $1000. 
  • Higher backers will get unique prints drawn by Katie as well as the chance to read brand-new Nocens writing before it ever gets shared to the world. My goal is to open myself to be given feedback and criticism to people who are outside of my friend group. 
  • No matter if we get completely funded or not we will go through with the printing of the books. 

Risks & Challenges

I know that 1000 dollars seems like a lot, and it is, but I have complete faith in this project to be backed for printing. However, I have a very small fanbase and am a fairly introverted person so it's hard for me to get the word out about my project. So some of the following things may create challenges: 

  • Getting the word out. Even if you can't contribute please please please share this project so that it can see the light of day. If you're a fan of superheroes, awesome art, and helping someone grow in their writing please share this project to others even if you can't contribute. You can share on Facebook, twitter, youtube, tumblr... The list goes on and on. 
  • Meeting our deadline. I'm going into my senior year and while technically my internship ends in September, this project will continue to go on until next year. 
  • Shipping after everything is over with and complete will be a huge task for us to handle. There are some risks with that while though I have faith in our lovely post office, things do get lost in the mail sometimes. 
  • Editing. I am not the greatest at grammar and I'm also not the greatest at editing myself. Editing to the point where the writing is crisp and typo-proof is going to be slightly challenging.
