story:
A few days ago HOMKE posted a story about John Jermaine Jackson, who has been transitioning in and out of homelessness for the past 11 years. John's story of holding on to his dreams and hope is one that has invoked a desire to act within our community. "Milwaukee Cares" is our chance as a community to bring aid and resources to John and many others who are experiencing homelessness in our city. We can show them that we might not have much, but the Humans of Milwaukee do care. 

As I encounter people who are homeless over the next few months, I will talk with them about what their hopes are and provide them with a bit of support from our community to keep their hope alive.

Humans of Milwaukee will also collaborate with Hope House of Milwaukee ongoing mission to end homelessness and build safe communities. Feel free to drop off any donations (food, clothes, hygiene products) that will aid families, women, men, and children who are experiencing homelessness. Any clothing or toys should be unused when donating. Hope House is located at 209 W. Orchard St.
story_txt: A few days ago HOMKE posted a story about John Jermaine Jackson, who has been transitioning in and out of homelessness for the past 11 years. John's story of holding on to his dreams and hope is one that has invoked a desire to act within our community. "Milwaukee Cares" is our chance as a community to bring aid and resources to John and many others who are experiencing homelessness in our city. We can show them that we might not have much, but the Humans of Milwaukee do care. As I encounter people who are homeless over the next few months, I will talk with them about what their hopes are and provide them with a bit of support from our community to keep their hope alive.Humans of Milwaukee will also collaborate with Hope House of Milwaukee ongoing mission to end homelessness and build safe communities. Feel free to drop off any donations (food, clothes, hygiene products) that will aid families, women, men, and children who are experiencing homelessness. Any clothing or toys should be unused when donating. Hope House is located at 209 W. Orchard St.

story:
Get a taste of Wise Tortoise: Join us for a double feature October 4th

Time: 1:15-2:30pm (with room at the end to socialize till 3pm)

Place: 4th Floor of 245 McDermot Ave, Winnipeg Mb. (wheelchair accessible from back lane entrance)

Price: $15 in advance or $20 at the door (snacks and beverage included in pricing)

Enjoy live theatre along with snacks and beverages.

We are featuring two of our shows at this event, we bring our dinner theatre piece to the stage, "Let's Dine" as well as introduce another one of our plays to the public "Fourteen". Don't miss it! Featuring new actors and some original cast of our first show done back in June. Please come out and support your local theatre group and don't be afraid to spread the word! Descriptions below.

Whether it is your first time attending one of our productions or are a returning audience member, all are welcome.

FOURTEEN (Run Time Approx: 30 mins)


Comedy

An
unexpected blizzard throws a kink into the plans a high society hostess
mere hours before her latest dinner party. A seemingly endless round of
guests cancelling and new guests being invited is assisted by the ever
helpful butler, and the hostess's slightly less helpful daughter. The
plucky hostess plans for the social success of the season, while
simultaneously panicking that it will end up the flop of the century.

LET'S DINE (Run Time Approx: 20 mins)

Dramadey


A surprise
event at a banquet between a sweetly eccentric man and his charming
girlfriend unleashes a Pandora's Box of high emotions for both. Thing
get even more interesting when she runs in to her ex-fiance who just so
happens to be attending the same banquet.

The event includes these two shows as well as an intermission and....

ACTOR TALK BACK

Get a chance to know the actors involved in our shows.

A WORD FROM THE DIRECTOR

Many have asked, "How on earth does directing via skype work?"

Find out how it works and more!


*Names will be held at the door for those who have purchased online. You will be asked for your full name as you arrive. Thank you.

story:
Now that the campaign is quickly coming to an end I want to assure you that any last minute contribution - big or small - will greatly help me to travel back to the U.S.-Mexico border soon to visit and photograph new artists !! And a big THANK YOU to my all my wonderful backers !!

My name is Stefan Falke, I'm a photographer living in New York. I would like to invite you to contribute to the next phase of my ongoing project:

LA FRONTERA: Artists along the US-Mexico Border.

From the moment I set foot in Tijuana in November 2008 I realized that the border region would become the most compelling material of my life as a photographer. I recognized that all the news about violent crimes told only a small part of life along the border. My discovery of a vibrant art scene flourishing back then was a great inspiration, and I urgently wanted to share its story. 

I have already photographed over 180 painters, muralists, sculptors, performance artist, poets, gallery owners and curators south (and some also north) of the US border in Matamoros, Reynosa, Nuevo Laredo, Ciudad Juarez, Nogales, Mexicali, Tecate, Tijuana as well as San Diego, El Paso, McAllen and Brownsville.

Here is my short video about the beginning of my work on the border:


The LA FRONTERA project continues.

I'm planning to revisit some of the 180 artists on the U.S.-Mexico border whose work has had the most impact on their communities and produce in-depth interviews and videos about their lives and their art. Finding new artists will also be part of my expanded La Frontera project. 

The interviews, photographs, and videos will be published on the website borderartists.com, which will re-launch with a visually richer, updated and interactive design. I am also working on a book for the US and Mexico, which will include the new material. 

The new educational and entertaining website will be the heart of my LA FRONTERA project. I will invite art museums and cultural institutions from both sides of the border to add their calendars and other content to the site, and individual artists can to link to their work. An app for smartphones and tablets is planned.

Your contribution will help to accomplish this.

My long term goal is to create an online community around the website that will forge cultural connections along the entire 2,000-miles-long border.

I feel passionate enough about this project to ask you for your help. Here is what I need:

Funds for roundtrip air fare from New York as well as for lodging, car rental, and video equipment for three separate trips:

1. New York - Brownsville/McAllen/Matamoros/Reynosa/N.Laredo

2. New York - El Paso/Cidudad Juarez

3. New York - San Diego/Tijuana/Tecate/Mexicali

If funds permit I will include other border towns and cities, especially the city of Piedras Negras, since the state of Coahuila is not represented in my project yet !!

(and please contact me if you have any questions at stefanfalke@mac.com)

I appreciate you in advance!

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Perks: Frontera Special 1 and 2 (signed prints 8x10" or 11x14)

Border 1

Border 2

Border 3

Border 4

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

La Frontera solo exhibitions to date:

Casa del Tunel (Tijuana, Mexico), Casa Familiar (San Ysidro, California), The Mexican Cultural Institute (Washington, DC), IMAS Museum (McAllen, Texas), Cervantes (Frankfurt, Germany), The Mexican Embassy Frankfurt (Frankfurt, Germany), Photoville 2014** (New York, NY), The Triennial of Photography (Hamburg, Germany), 2015. 

** that exhibition was supported by the Mexican Cultural Institutes of New York and Washington DC, and BRIC Media House, Brooklyn.

Upcoming exhibition: La Frontera at Deutsches Haus at NYU in New York City, opening 04/28/2016  !!

LA FRONTERA in The New York Times

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Press: The project was featured in print and/or online by The New York Times, Huffington Post, WIRED, BBC, L'Oeil De La Photographie, aCurator, Hyperallergetic, Forward Thinking Museum, Hahnemühle,  FAZ Magazin, EL MEXICANO, FRONTERAS Desk, Courrier International, TRIP Magazin, German Missions in the United States, Faust Kultur, Photoville New York 2014 and many others.

More press here: https://borderartists.com/press/

Social Media: Instagram: @borderartists Facebook: LaFrontera  

The book: The LA FRONTERA book with photographs of all 180 artists from the project was published in Germany (German/Spanish) by Edition Faust:  Stefan Falke: LA FRONTERA  ISBN: 978-3-9815893-5-1  http://www.faustkulturshop.de/Edition-Faust/La-Frontera.html 

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Perks La Frontera 2, 3, 4 (personal postcard):

 (Raechel Running at the border fence near Agua Prieta, Mexico)

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Perks 3  (Border Collage screensaver): 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Perks La Frontera 9, 10, 11:

Raechel Running with US-Mexico flag at the border fence in Agua Prieta.  

All limited edition prints are signed and numbered, available in sizes: 

11 x 14 (29x36 cm), 16 x 20 (40x51 cm), and 20 x 30" (51x76 cm).

© Stefan Falke - All prints are produced by Luxlab, New York, on Hahnemuhle Photo Rag Ultra Smooth 305 gsm.

(Please send me a message to stefanfalke@mac.com if you wish another image from "Border 11-22", shown below)

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The Perks La Frontera 12 and 13:

The limited edition clamshell portfolio box is available in two sizes:
 11 x 14 (29x36 cm) - edition of 25, and 16 x 20 (40x51 cm) - edition of 15 (!). 
The box includes all 12+1 prints Border 10-22, as shown above.

© Stefan Falke - All prints are produced by Luxlab, New York, on Hahnemuhle Photo Rag Ultra Smooth 305 gsm.

Below is the larger version, 16 x 20" (40x51 cm):

story:
Vines Art Festival

Hi, we are excited to introduce Vancouver's newest, free outdoor festival, Vines Art Festival. Vines intention is to allow a platform for sharing and connecting through art in the outdoors. With a focus on involvement of artists and audience alike. There are 20 artists/artist groups  (dance, theatre, visual art, music) that will be performing and engaging on August 22nd from 12 PM - 6 PM at Trout Lake Park in Vancouver. To see a full list go to vinesartfestival.com. 

What We Need & What You Get

So far Vine's has been able to raise funds through sponsorship and a silent auction. However this is only enough to cover the bare minimum costs, event permits and insurance. So that leaves us with an empty park space. I want to be able to pay the artists for their work as well as have supplies to put on free workshops for anyone to take a part in. This is where you come in. All funds raised through this campaign will be split using a profit-sharing model for the artists. In return you will be able to witness a full day of art and workshops for FREE! 

The Impact

My hope is to encourage people to acknowledge how lucky we are to have these beautiful outdoor parks in Vancouver. Allowing for thought about how we treat the nature around us directly and indirectly. I also want inspire others to creatively immerse themselves in the beauty of our surroundings. I imagine through watching artists create others will want to express themselves more. Vines can create a space where people won’t feel scared about not understanding what it is that is going on and just give it a try.

A second aim is to expand Vancouver's art audience. I see a need to find new ways to inspire Vancouverites to watch and understand the power of creation and expression. Vines will create an approachable platform for new audiences to connect to artists imaginations and joy.     

Other Ways You Can Help 

If you can't contribute that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about Vines.
  • Share the campaign on social media. 

Video Credits

Filming and Editing: Jason Bempong
Performers: Jessica Ames, Robert Azevedo, Jen Bolcsfoldi, Heather Lamoureux, Alisha Lemire, Tin Gamboa, Marisa Gold and Antonio Somera. 
Special thanks: Arash Khakpour

story:
Event news:

(1) Washington Post:

http://www.washingtonpost.com/goingoutguide/mus...

(2) China Daily

http://usa.chinadaily.com.cn/epaper/2015-08/14/content_21599987.htm

Hello Everyone:

My name is Xichen Xu, an arts administration graduate student from Savannah College of Art and Design. I am organizing the first-ever Chinese Opera mask exhibition in Washington, D.C. as my master degree's thesis project. 

The whole event is organized, produced and curated independently by myself.

With your generous contribution, this event could be able to cover the high expense and will be able to present such an event again in the near future.

Event Introduction

A Celebration of Chinese Opera, is the first-ever Chinese Opera mask exhibition in Washington, D.C from August 22-27 with free admission at the Katzen Arts Center.

Why this event needs your donation?

This event consists of three parts: children's workshops, a call for artists and an exhibition. The children's workshop and call for artists are both be held in preparation for the exhibition.

The workshop is to provide children a chance to create a Chinese Opera mask, and the results will be shown during the exhibition. With your generous contribution, it could achieve the goal to develop children's creativity and to enhance the awareness of arts education by showcasing their works.

The call for artists is to encourage both domestic and international artists to bring this traditional Chinese element into their creation process. By selecting 10 artworks for the show, the event aims to provide artists a chance to exhibit their work. 

The featured artists won't be charged any entry fee or commission fee, with your donation, this event could afford the exhibition set up fee and installation fee for the works, what's most important is all artists could be promoted during the event and their works can be recognized by the public.

During the exhibition with free admission, audiences will not only enjoy a collection of 3-D Chinese Opera masks, but also have the chance to take a glimpse at other non-mask related artworks, including Opera costumes, paintings, photography and more.

For the opening reception night on August 22, all audiences will also have a chance to participate in the creation of their own Chinese Opera mask. As the event director, I will organize a live workshop to encourage all audience members to create their own Opera masks to take home.

With your generous contribution, I could able to present such an event to the public for free as well as to advocate for the arts, to increase community engagement and enrich the world of art in the D.C area.

Expense of A Celebration of Chinese Opera 

Venue Rental Fee: $2,500

Workshop expense: $500

Chinese Opera masks: $1000

Marketing materials: $500

Food and drink: $300

“Besides donating money, is there any other way I could support this event?”

Yes. First of all, thanks for your support.

You could help to promote and share the event link to all of your social media.

The most important thing is, if you are a resident of D.C, VA, or MD area, please do not hesitate to join the Opening reception on August 22 at 5:00 PM.


Introduction of perks

Beijing Opera masks originated from totem in ancient times, develops into facial paintings of the Song and Yuan Dynasties, and eventually takes the shape of the facial costume of the Ming and Qing Dynasties. It plays the artistic functions of implying commendatory and derogatory connotations and differentiating benevolence and malevolence, enabling the audience to get a glimpse of the inner world of actors and actresses through their symbolic facial make-up. In this sense, facial make-up has obtained the reputation as "The Painting of Heart and Soul".


Each color means different characters:

  1. Red Color: Red indicates devotion, courage, uprightness and loyalty. 
  2. Black Color: Black symbolizes Integrity. .
  3. Yellow Color: Yellow signifies ambition and brave. 
  4. Blue Color: Blue represents staunchness and fierceness.
  5. Purple Color: Purple stands for uprightness and sophistication.                                
The Perks for you

1. Chinese Opera Mask Gift Set

2. Postcards

3. Pen

4. Opera Silk Painting

story:
I am Antonio De Jesus, an entrepreneur, illustrator and designer with a passion for toy design. When my son, Adrian, turned two years old, I was inspired by his ability to see every object he interacted with as a toy. Using his curiosity as inspiration, I developed a series of wooden toys, among them, this elephant puzzle. This is how this Wooden Elephant was born. This Puzzle DIY toy platform became our parent-child activity toy. It gave us the opportunity of spending time together as we assembled and decorated this real wooden puzzle.  My goal is to give ALL my supporters the chance to experience such a delightful time by assembling the puzzle and decorating it. I want to make it happen by the end of the year! 


Your contribution will go towards the development and production of this Elephant Puzzle. I know we can do this together!

I have taken the concept farther than I've ever imagined. Earlier concept used pegs to hold the pieces together. I have been developing and improving this puzzle for the past four years; the latest version uses magnets to hold and connect the pieces together. This gives us opportunities to disassemble it and put it back together as many times as you like.

What I Need the Money for
Producing a traditional wooden toy is more expensive than producing a plastic toy. I have to get multiple prototypes done overseas and sent over to the United States to achieve the accuracy and quality of the product.  Then I need to do final molds that are costly. 

I have already done a lot of work and I've also paid for the prototype, so after that I need $10,000 to get the production running, and approximately $4,000 to pay for shipping plus rewards, IndieGoGo, Paypal and other expenses that will surely arise. 

We want to raise $14,000 for final prototyping, first production run and cover shipment from overseas to the US and to you. 

What You Get

Ok, here's what you were all looking forward to! The cool part! 
Your donations are highly appreciated! To show you to which extent they are appreciated, I've been working on great rewards worth your money. Take a look at the different levels. You can get multiple rewards at the same time. Including this digital downloadable version of Upside Down book by Adrian and illustrated by Antonio (me) readable in your mobile devices.


The main rewards is the 5" tall DIY Blank or wood finish puzzle. You can get the Wooden Elephant factory painted in his Day of the Dead and Blue with Yellow. The beautiful Love Pink, Monkey and Color Splash outfit will be customized by me and by request only.


My Impact

Everyday we find a reason to let our children play on their own. We find excuses to spend time doing our own things first. This parent-child activity toy would make you spend a great amount of time talking, sharing ideas and seeing their creativity come to life. Because our little ones will only be children once, now is the time to share unforgettable moments with them. It did it for me and my son. 
Your support will make this project come to life!

Risks & Challenges

Q: "Ok, so I backed your project...Now what? When can we expect my Wooden Elephant Puzzle?"

A: I've created the following graphic explaining the production process. I will update you regularly to let you know at which stage the puzzle is!


The team working with me, taking care of this production have a ton of experience in toy production. I have full confidence in them since they were referred to me by a close friend. The Wooden Elephant should be ready by mid November, but as in any project that involves factories and the work of many different people; there could be delays. I'm positive this will all go smooth, but I will make sure to let backers know of any delays or problems. 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are many ways you can contribute to make this Wooden Elephant Puzzle toy come to life. Every penny or effort will help create it. Share this campaign with others on your Facebook page or any social media. Help me get the word out and make some noise about my campaign. Please make sure to use the Indiegogo share tools!
story_txt:
I am Antonio De Jesus, an entrepreneur, illustrator and designer with a passion for toy design. When my son, Adrian, turned two years old, I was inspired by his ability to see every object he interacted with as a toy. Using his curiosity as inspiration, I developed a series of wooden toys, among them, this elephant puzzle. This is how this Wooden Elephant was born. This Puzzle DIY toy platform became our parent-child activity toy. It gave us the opportunity of spending time together as we assembled and decorated this real wooden puzzle.  My goal is to give ALL my supporters the chance to experience such a delightful time by assembling the puzzle and decorating it. I want to make it happen by the end of the year! 




   
Your contribution will go towards the development and production of this Elephant Puzzle. I know we can do this together!
I have taken the concept farther than I've ever imagined. Earlier concept used pegs to hold the pieces together. I have been developing and improving this puzzle for the past four years; the latest version uses magnets to hold and connect the pieces together. This gives us opportunities to disassemble it and put it back together as many times as you like.
